story:
The Plan

I am Sarah, a student at Alaska Pacific University. Alaska is a state still rich in its Native traditions, and I have spent 2011 incorporating some of these into our kayaking curriculum for my senior thesis. There is no better way to enhance our kayaking classes than by learning about the very origins of the kayak. Helping us learn is Maligiaq, a local Inuit master boat builder who has already taught many of our students how to roll a kayak in the Inuit tradition. We are asking for your support in implementing a skin-on-frame boat building project for our students. We'll get the full experience from selecting the woods, to constructing the boat, and finally paddling them in Alaska's Prince William Sound. With your help in piloting this 2012 extra curricular project, we could introduce boat building next year as a unique and hands-on window into learning more about Alaska's diverse Native paddling traditions.

Where the Money Goes

We are raising funds to build three skin-on-frame kayaks, each made for a different body size so everyone can paddle them. About $1,500 total goes to purchasing materials, and $1,000 per boat pays our local master boat builder for his time with us. That all adds up to $4,500. If we don't reach our goal of $2,000 with indiegogo.com, we will still put the money towards boat building, and keep looking around for other funding sources. It may be that we will have to build only one boat this year instead of three. 


Our gifts will help you spread the interest about Native kayaking traditions, just like we're working to do. The shirts, hand crafted harpoon throwing sticks, and Inuit-style kayak paddles will definitely start some conversations with your friends, especially if you're a paddling fanatic like we are! 


We appreciate your contribution and hope that this project serves as a catalyst for your paddling or woodworking interests.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Rob Otani.  I am a structural engineer, adjunct professor of architecture, builder, and artist. As an avid hobbyist of boatbuilding, I have envisioned the design, fabrication, and installation of the interactive sculpture "Transformative Kayak" as a way to combine my interests in boatbuilding, engineering, and architecture for the interests of the patrons of Governor's Island and hopefull contribute to the richness of culture and art created by the Figment organization.  The "Transformative Kayak" design has been selected by the Figment organization to be built and exhibited on Governor's Island, New York from June to October of 2011.  I have estimated that the raw material costs and rental costs to build this sculpture as $5,000.  I am reaching out to raise the funds to build this installation.  After the exhibit, the sculpture will be dismantled and the kayaks will be donated to a local school for their use.

The Impact

The Transformative Kayak sculpture is a beautiful sculpture that will be built solely by volunteers.  Its construction will be a way of teaching friends and students how to work with simple hand tools to create a unique structure.  The transformation of the sculpture is a about the transformation of sustainable materials, exchange of ideas and thoughts, collaboration, and ultimately the donation of the beautiful skin-on-frame kayaks to a local school for the kids to use. 

What We Need & What You Get

The campaign is targeted to raise $5,000 specifically for the materials of the sculpture.  Some of the funds will be used for rental of equipment and vehicles for transporting the sculpture as well as insurance. 

Other Ways You Can Help

(Unleash the DIWO! -- 'Do It With Others' by asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Don't forget to remind them about the share tools!)

story:
Short Summary

For years we’ve provided the community with workshops for adults and kids, encouraging creativity and innovation. We promote art students, emerging and established artists with gallery exhibition space. We develop creative projects and are creative consultants to many artists. Archway 1 Archetype Art Studio is located under a bridge in a viaduct and we have been there for 8 years. Obviously we want to continue doing this, but unfortunately we’ve recently hit a bit of a bump in the road. The neighbour that we were sharing the power with has abruptly disconnected our power! We have been without power for nearly two months and this has distrupted our ability to work and has forced us to temporarily shut down, unfortunately postponing our entire workshop program. We now work by natural light and candlelight as well as freeze our butts off (it's winter in Sydney) all day, every day. So, we need the community to very kindly help us out. 

We are an artist run space and gallery that does not receive government funding. All our work is on a voluntary basis and we rely on funds from our workshops to keep us going.

Rachel: That's me. I'm one half of the creative directors. I manage all things Archetype Gallery, Archway 1 Archetype Art Studio and the Creative Arts Alliance Sydney. I'm your usual multi-faceted creative person, a filmmaker stemming from a performing arts background. Actor, singer, dancer, choreographer.

Stefan:Is the other half of the creative directors. He is an artist; painter, writer, photographer, filmmaker. He takes great portraits of dogs, in our local area and had an exhibition and book launch recently from his body of work, titled Park Life. The video link provided here, is from that launch and gives you an idea of just some of what we do.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re fighting to get the power turned on again, but in the mean time we’re left with no choice but to buy a generator. Operation Power Up is to raise funds to get our power back on asap, and an electrician to hook up our entire studio inclusive of our workstations. The 2.6kVa 4 stroke digital generator can power up our entire place and our electrical equipment and appliances. The cost of the generator is $1595, the electrician cost is the balance.

Power is essential for us to get back to what we do best, provide creative and artistic avenues for everybody. 

If we don't reach our intended goal, then we will sell lemonade, continue to save our pennies, make up the difference and buy a generator, however this could be months away.

The Impact

We are a team of volunteers, that love what we do. Our regular students; children between 1 and 12 years, are waiting for our workshops to resume again. Some kids came into the studio recently, ignored the dark and freezing cold and just started drawing and painting! That demonstrates how important accessing our creative space means to the little ones in the local community. 

Your contribution to our fundraiser will guarantee you a place in our hearts. Every contributor will go on our website page as a sponsor and the Archway 1 Archetype Art Studio community will know that you helped us in Operation Power Up, to enable their favourite local arts space and gallery to be open and operational, for them.

This is our first ever online fundraising campaign, so we are excited!

If you're a local, drop in for a cup of coffee or tea and if you're somewhere else in the world, feel free to check out our website and get in touch to enquire further or email us to just say "hey".

The Perks

There are so many perks to choose from and we will start sending them out once you make a contribution. 

$20 - a digital artwork signed by artist Stefan A. von Reiche (size 29.7cm x 21cm) PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$40 - A Limited edition Original Archetype t-shirt in black or white. Each design unique and a one-off. Advise your size, Sml, Med, Large, XL, XXL. PLUS  a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$50 - Original artwork (size 29.7cm x 21cm) | ink and watercolor signed by the artist Stefan A. von Reiche PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website. 

$60 - Ink Portrait of You (size 29.7cm x 21cm) | signed by the artist Stefan A. von Reiche. Email us a photo of yourself or your loved one and the artist will paint your portrait PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$100 - 2 day Art Workshop (2hrs per day) Create a work of ART! You will learn drawing, ink and watercolor techniques, in addition to creating a work using found objects PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$100 - A Photographic Print (size 42cm x 29.7cm) from the Park Life Book signed by the photographer Stefan A. von Reiche PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$200 - 3 hour Photography Workshop | with a professional commercial photographer (online or onsite) PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$200 - 2 hour Portrait Photography Photoshoot session (studio or on-location), includes 2 prints and 50 digital images. (On-location shoot subject to Sydney Metropolitan area) PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$500 - Original artwork on watercolor paper (size 118.9cm x 84.1cm) | Ink and watercolor signed by artist Stefan A. von Reiche. PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

$1000 - Your name on the Generator | We WILL name the generator after you PLUS Two Limited edition Original Archetype t-shirts in black or white PLUS an Original artwork (size 118.9cm x 84.1cm) | Ink and watercolor signed by artist Stefan A. von Reiche PLUS an Ink Portrait of You (size 29.7cm x 21cm) | signed by the artist Stefan A. von Reiche PLUS a Sponsor credit on the Archetype website.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love it if you could share our campaign, so that a bunch of people see it. 

Use the Indiegogo share tools, to share to all and hears hoping we reach our goal. 

Thank you so much in advance from the Archetype Team.

 

Music video credit: At the Mall (Emerald Park) myspace.com/emeraldpark

story:
What is Healing Hearts?

And so a work of art in honour, in service to the gods and in service to the divine heart of each of us, is begun.

An Oracle deck – a work of art that is handled, spoken to, listened to – and a book of their stories and rituals together to bring the gods in their many forms, male, female, androgyne, into our lives. They come to show us that we too are sacred and that all the people of the world, regardless of sex or gender or race, are divine too.

Healing Hearts is an Oracle Deck which includes male, female and third-gendered deities from cultures all over the world, to allow us to meet the divine in its many faces and heal our relationship to the divine masculine, feminine and androgyne in our lives, within and without.

It is also a detailed book detailing the stories and history of each deity within the deck with rituals and devotionals to help you listen to their words directly, useful when paired with the deck but equally helpful on its own for those that prefer books to decks. In order to make this really awesome I’ve asked my friend Pawl to help with the research!

We still get any funds pledged if we don't hit our target, and will use every penny towards making this deck - it will just take a lot longer to do :)



What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised will go towards covering three important areas, in this order:

  • Materials and creation of perks (£300)
  • Printing an initial run of decks (£200)
  • Time to dedicate exclusively to this project (£500)

And then covering IndieGoGo fees! Any funds over the initial goal will be split between further time (as it will take longer than 10 days!), marketing and further printing costs.

All money earned for time spent on this project will go towards funding my PhD and career as an undercover Enchantress in academia (and paying my lovely researcher, Pawl!) starting with a trip to present my first aesthetics paper, on the experience of the artist as part of nature, which will kick-start my path to changing some minds!

In return for helping Healing Hearts you can get:

  • Original art, commissions or prints, to honour your favourite deity at home
  • Signed copies of a unique deck in its first edition
  • A guidebook to the stories of the gods, complete with devotional rituals
  • A Deck that includes a card just for you, illuminating your divinity!
  • Oracle readings to shed light on your life
  • To honour your favourite deity with a commissioned painting

You also get the satisfaction of supporting both a deck which strives to heal the world, one reading at a time AND a woman diving into a traditionally male-dominated field in order to bring an under-represented area (Pagan theology and enchantment) into Philosophy.



The Impact

Art Heals. Card decks are artworks that get interacted with, handled, listened to. Oracles are methods of allowing the gods to speak directly to us. The proliferation of awesome Goddess decks gives us a way of meeting the divine feminine whatever level of experience we have, but what of young pagan males? Or third-gendered pagan newbies? Where can they see the faces of the Divine that look like them? Where can they find the role models that show them they belong too? Through the stories. And so to bring the stories into an Oracle deck brings these faces into relationship with the feminine faces in a way that shows people of all levels that they too are reflected in the Divine.

Not only that, but we each contain shades of all genders, one way or another, to one degree or another. Here is a way we can find our inner divine in all its faces and heal our relationships to those parts of ourselves.

Healing starts in the heart. With every card listened to, every story heard, every face seen, every reading where the Great Divine flows through us I believe that we heal a part of the world. In the gods we find role models that include kind men that are strong, victorious women that are nurturing mothers, and cross-gendered people who walk without fear.

My qualifications? I’ve been painting the gods and crafting Oracle decks since I first found tarot and paganism aged ten. I even self-published a faery Oracle deck two years ago. Most of my personal work is devotional and I’ve been a Priestess and teacher within the creative, ecstatic tradition of Reclaiming Witchcraft for almost a decade. I love bringing the gods to earth and healing through art!


Other Ways You Can Help

I know what it is like to see something awesome but not be able to contribute financially so I want to share a secret: I’m rubbish at self-promotion so I really, really need your help in spreading the word. Below are some of the people who are likely to be interested in this project, if you know anyone who fits, please send them this way! If you want to support healing Hearts, share on social media, write a blogpost, tell your friends.

  • Pagan Groups
  • LGBT groups
  • Art Lovers
  • Equal Rights campaigners
  • Tarot / Oracle collectors
  • Storytellers
  • Folklorists and lovers of mythology
  • RE students (and teachers)
  • Spiritual groups
  • Neo-pagans (and new pagans)
  • Multi-faith groups
  • Druids
  • Goddess Temples
  • Pagan Societies in Universities
  • Healers and therapists
  • Anyone else you can think of!

Thank you for spreading the word, thank you for contributing and thank you for reading this far!


Sketch for an idea for the back of the cards including the powers of water and fire, the sky and the earth, the God, the Goddess and the light of Spirit beyond gender or sex:

Original Intro:

The Enchantress shares three moments:

Paint dripped down the page as I stepped back, to see a face of the divine peering back at me. It spoke.

Cards fell from fingers, faces of the feminine divine laid out before us as we heard their words spoken with reverence. I wondered where the masculine was.

The Green Goddess, the Horned God and the Sacred Earth spoke to us from their seats through our Priest and Priestesses. They called us to honour our hearts and the hearts of those around us.

Image and word in cards combine. The divine ones speak to us. In many forms they gift us with their guidance. Their stories light our way, bring healing to our hearts. Their many, many forms and faces reach out to us and stand before us as role models for our lives, as guides to the Sacred in our own Hearts, showing us where their powers reside in us and in the world.

And so a work of art in honour of and in service to the gods and the divine heart of each of us, is begun.

An Oracle Deck and Book full of divine beings, their stories and their healing magic to bless your life and heal the world.

This project is a part of A World Enchanted, the home of myself (Halo), and thus is supporting my pursuit of a PhD in philosophy of art and enchantment in order to bring the importance of magic into an academic, philosophical framework. Enchantment requires living as part of the natural world, not above it, and by welcoming the many forms of the divine into the world through art I am helping to open the possibility for more individuals to recognise their place within the circle.

I am artist, philosopher, storyteller, enchantress. I welcome you to fly with me into this realm of wonder and help to re-enchant the world!

Happy Thoughts,

~ Hayley 'Haloquin' Addis

Their many, many forms and faces reach out to us and stand before us as role models for our lives, as guides to the Sacred in our own Hearts, showing us where their powers reside in us and in the world.And so a work of art in honour of and in service to the gods and the divine heart of each of us, is begun.An Oracle Deck and Book full of divine beings, their stories and their healing magic to bless your life and heal the world.This project is a part of A World Enchanted, the home of myself (Halo), and thus is supporting my pursuit of a PhD in philosophy of art and enchantment in order to bring the importance of magic into an academic, philosophical framework. Enchantment requires living as part of the natural world, not above it, and by welcoming the many forms of the divine into the world through art I am helping to open the possibility for more individuals to recognise their place within the circle.I am artist, philosopher, storyteller, enchantress. I welcome you to fly with me into this realm of wonder and help to re-enchant the world!Happy Thoughts,~ Hayley 'Haloquin' Addis

story:
Constant Growth

Supreme’s geometric abstract artwork coined “Echt” has captured the attention of tens of thousands worldwide.  While steadily growing his brand and audience along the way, he has taken the time to determine what works and what doesn’t. As his unique art style reflects, he is a man of action and movement. With your assistance, Supreme will be able to enter the next chapter of his professional art career by issuing his first set of prints. This allows him to reach a bigger audience of art lovers on a level that gives them the opportunity to purchase 1st edition, high quality artwork at an affordable cost. In this way, everyone can get a piece of the pie while also showing their support in all the ways that count.  

This summer, Supreme also plans on further expanding his brand by participating in global shows and festivals. However, this takes preparation beforehand to mass-produce artwork for the anticipated large crowds.

What We Need & What You Get

Now more than ever, it is important for artists to have their work available for fans all across the world. With prints to create and shows to attend, the funds raised will help offset business expenses and jumpstart revenue to help Supreme continue to bring his signature style of artwork to the forefront on a consistent basis. With your help we must raise $3,800, which will directly be used for digital scanning  and printing fees. 


 As a token of our appreciation you you will receive:

  • a signed / numbered print
  • a 11" x 14" custom color scheme original painting
  • a one on one painting session with Supreme
  • a 18” x 24” custom color scheme painting
  • a private paint party instructed by Supreme for you and (15) guests
  •  an original 48” x 48” Acrylic on canvas painting 

The Impact

Show after show Supreme's artwork has proven to brighten, energize and inspire. With your help we'll be able to spread that same energy globally. Sales generated from prints will cover business expenses and provide a means to creating new exciting work.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • SHARE SHARE SHARE please don't hesitate to spread the word by using the Indiegogo share options to post and email to your friends. There's power in numbers and with your support we can grow faster and larger than we ever imagined one step at a time.

story:
Who we are and what we hope to achieve: 

Mote Gallery is an artist-run gallery funded by Felipe Castelblanco. The gallery started in Columbus (USA) in 2013 out of a tiny -functional- window and quickly became the largest / tiny gallery in the region, showcasing the work of emerging artists from all over the world. We have been developing public programming internationally in places like London, Venice, Istanbul and Mexico City since 2014. Through gallery shows or site-specific artworks, Mote Gallery strives to become a catalyst for conversations, interventions and hacks around the notion of: art + display + commerce + social engagement = The Art World.

Thanks to our commitment and groundbreaking work, we have been invited to present the gallery at SUPERMARKET Art Fair, a large independent art fair and networking gathering in Stockholm between April 20th to April 24th of 2016. This is a huge opportunity for Mote Gallery and the artists that we work with to connect with other art spaces, art patrons and a whole new artistic community. 

Your donation is that extra push we need to bring the gallery's programme to Stockholm and increase the artists' commission! 

Making a difference:

We are an artistic platform for critical making and fostering new ideas. We also want to instigate conversations about the role that artists play in shaping the gallery context. This is why we are excited to try a new financial model where crowdfunding allows our exhibiting artists to receive a fair compensation for the work they do. 

In order to make this possible, MOTE Gallery is seeking your support to cover part of the traveling costs, exhibition fees, shipping and art handling. Securing these funds means the artists will receive a higher percentage (~ 85%) after their work is sold. We think there are many ways of engaging with the art market without taking advantage of the artists that make it all happen. 

What we need:

Mote Gallery has miraculously functioned outside the dollar-economy until now. We have borrowed spaces for shows, shared rides, gatecrashed parties, volunteered our time and creatively used our limited resources to bring amazing artworks all over the place. However, this time it will take a lot more effort to bring the gallery's programme and  the work of the artists we want to exhibit to Stockholm. We have a huge ocean in between and poor swiming skills.

Your donations will help us to pay for:

  • Exhibition fees and the rental of a 3 x 4 mts booth at the art fair (~$600)
  • Airfare from NYC to Stockholm for one of the team members. (~$450 one-way)
  • Printing a small number of our newly designed catalogue and archival publication (~$200)
  • Screws, brushes, sandpaper and tools rental. 
  • Coffee and pastries for the volunteers that will help us in Stockholm to install the artworks and make everything run smoothly! 

Why Are We Doing This: 

As artists / exhibition-makers behind Mote Gallery, we want to take back some control around the conditions of the global art market. The current art market seems to show little recognition for the labor behind art making, increasing the precarious financial conditions that most young artists face today, even when their work is selling...

By attending this art fair, we want to expand the gallery's nomadic working model, allowing a larger number of emerging artists to receive a lot more exposure and economic incentives for their work. We also want to network with other art spaces and develop stronger programming for the upcoming year. 

Attending Supermarket Art Fair this year is the first milestone, where we will test and improve this model to then bring the gallery, and its artists, to more international art platforms. 

Risks & Challenges

We still have a long way to go and a short timeframe to reach the goal of this campaign. We're committed to attend the art fair either way but the more money we raise, the higher the artists' commissions will be. 

Our team is tiny and we're working hard to arrange with the artists and prepare all the print materials before we send it to print, so please bear with us if we get slow at posting updates. Nevertheless, we really value your feedback and hope you ask us any question that helps to clarify our project and goals. 

We have tried different funding routes and have proved that the very nomadic nature of this project makes it difficult for us to fit within the funding rules of most arts organizations. Still, we're convinced that keeping a small team, a fluid physical presence and our focus on showing, not selling makes Mote Gallery a unique art space.

Please, support us in any way you can and spread the word!

Thank you, 

Mote Gallery's team.

story:
Short Summary

I have always been called to create, to share and connect. Throughout the past 15 years I have been engaged in an exploration of colour and community. I constantly strive to get better and hone my craft as well as work on community causes that contribute to the betterment of our world. This takes resilience and focus, intention and perseverance.

New Course is a one month, guided residency for the personal growth of creative professionals. With collaborative methods and professional guidance by Dr. Margi Brown Ash, the program expands and enhances an artist’s creative practice, their routines, and way of being.

I am Finnish and Anishinaabe on my father's side (Irish and English on my mother's side). In 2017, I turned 40 and he turned 70. We decided to celebrate these milestones by journeying together to explore our Finnish ancestry. This decision led to a discovery of the Arteles Creative Centre in Finland. The look and feel of the place struck a chord, and when the spring residency for New Course was announced, it was natural to apply... And I got in!

For over three years, I have balanced a robust visual art practice, a social art practice, and a creative facilitation practice. My art practices explore the themes of kinship, reconciliation, decolonization, and indigenous traditions through painting and silk screening, intergenerational collaboration, and community weaving. In particular, my creative facilitation has offered a rich opportunity to practice public speaking and listening, storytelling, running workshops, and creating experiential learning spaces for adults and youth.

This residency will be the perfect space to experiment with integrating these practices, while at the same time strengthening my personal commitment and daily routines. With time and space, professional mentorship, and an international creative community with whom to explore, the potential feels world-changing... a whole new era.

And, my father Lloyd, will come to join me, to be witness to my final performance piece, and then to share the wonder of our ancestoral land! We have just over two weeks to explore - family history and new friends, simple pleasures and extravagant novelties. 

I know that going to Finland will make me a stronger mentor in the community because I will have a more well-rounded view of who I am and where I came from. Integrating all parts of myself will allow me to walk in truth as I continue to mentor and work with youth. I know going to Finland is incredibly important. Of course, I do not know what will come out of it, but I know that this is something I need to do, something I am called to do. I am excited and grateful for this opportunity! 

Anyone for Finnish Pancakes?!

 

What I Need & What You Get

Thank you for reading this far and for considering funding this creative endeavour/ancestral pilgrimage!

I have applied to the Canada Council for the Arts for travel funding, however word of my success (or otherwise) will not come until I am already underway. As such, I am seeking interim and contingency funds to allow me to fully engage with this opportunity.

What you get, besides the obvious satisfaction of helping someone to fulfill their dreams, is original art, prints, hearts of courage, phonecalls, emails, in-person conversations, poetic and artistic experiences. There may be trees involved...

I have set a goal of Cdn $9500, the equivalent of about €6300, for the costs of being away from home for almost two months. The funding I receive will firstly cover residency costs, food, transportation, and such, but will also help to expand and enhance this experience to which I am already committed. How big and grand can self-exploration get? Help me find out!

Thank you so much for being on this journey with me! 

 

The Impact

These days we often hear that we need a New Story. A story of collaboration, of gratitude, a story of acceptance and wonder, and of a democracy of species where we all matter...

Young and old, all are part of it. Here, there, everywhere, are the places it is needed, and found.

I am one of the many people striving to create, to learn, to share the uplifting stories which might lead to the New Story, creating spaces for participatory, in-the-moment, interactive, international storytelling to happen, so that maybe, just maybe, we might get there. With a little luck.

And a lot of support.

One way or another, I will live this New Story, so that in turn, it can live. This is my dream, my calling.

 

Risks & Challenges

My biggest challenge is putting this crowd-funding campaign together and saying to the world and my community that I need some financial support. Does anyone else have a hard time asking for help??!

When I put my mind to something, I show up and follow through.

When I was in Grade Five, I enrolled myself in Late French Immersion. In Grade Nine, I enrolled myself in Trek, an outdoor education program. After graduating high school, I applied for Film School and completed four years at Ryerson. In 2006, I called myself to action, putting me on the road to learning about my Anishinaabe ancestry and my orientation towards community building. 

This trip is the next step in my growth as an artist and as a human being; another one on the long road to self discovery. And they are expecting me! Who could let the Finns down??

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Miigwetch, Kiitos, Thank you!

Even if you are currently unable to make a financial contribution, no problem, I get it! There are many ways of helping. Positive wishes, often called prayers, really do make a difference. Send them along!

And if you think this is a worthwhile endeavour, maybe you would consider sharing my campaign with people you know. Plus it will let the artists in your world know you recognize the social value of their contributions.

It warms my heart and curbs my fears knowing there are friends, family, artists, and art enthusiasts who understand the value of authentic experiences, and space and time for focused creative exploration.

Indiegogo has handy share tools, if you are comfortable with those. Word of mouth is also good!

Miigwetch, Kiitos, Thank you for supporting this creative endeavour! 

May we all learn more about who we are and who/where we come from!

story:
Artist Statement

Claire Viele is an artist, photographer, writer and model. In the bulk of her work she explores the boundaries and spaces between identities. Through the inclusion of flaw, imperfection and incompleteness in makeup, costumes and settings, and by working primarily with spontaneous posing and affect, Viele seeks to portray herself and her models in light of their organic and ever-changing nature. She induces tension through incompleteness: forming an open question, through which the viewer becomes engaged emotionally and intellectually, and is left to find their own meaning.

The most extensive focus in Viele’s portfolio is her self-portrait work, which is part of an ongoing project that began in 2006,  to identify and integrate the multiple parts of her own identity. Through both spontaneous experimentation and meticulous planning, Viele has identified dozens of individual micro-identities within herself and manifested them in her images. Some of her characters are well-defined and integral to her every-day life, while others are representations of a particular point in time, or in-between state unearthed in the process. In this way, her self-portrait project has been as much (or more) about the process, as the ‘finished’ product.

Project and Funding

A short series of my self-portraits have been accepted the the 2012 Femme Conference in Baltimore, Maryland August 17th and 18th! This conference is entitled "Pulling the Pieces Together" and is an exploration in the complexity and expression of femininity and queer lifestyles from a great diversity of regions, classes, races, ethnicities, and abilities. This conference is a great opportunity for artists to share their stories and art; increasing awarness through unique social and cultural viewpoints, and bringing to light important social issues relevant to us all.

The photos I chose to submit are a part of my self-portrait project developed over the last 6 years, and they represent the dramatic transformations of my own explorations into identity. Each image is also it's own feminine character, manifested at various points in my development as a person and artist. The changing skin tones and expressions are external representations of emotion and thought, often driven by my experiences of race, mental illness, ability, and gender, both personally and through those close to me.

I see the diversity of work in this confernce as a valuable opportunity for human beings to share unique experiences and perspectives without judgement or prejudice. Now comes the hard part! Unfortunately, assembling my art and getting it to the conference is an expensive endeavor. In order to make this happen, I need approximately $545 to cover printing, framing and shipping costs. I will be ordering 5 11"x17" prints from a high-quality printing company, framing them, and shipping them directly to Baltimore for installation.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't/won't/shouldn't contribute? You can still help by telling your friends about my indiegogo fundraiser and/or my website www.claireviele.org. I can also be found on facebook and twitter for easy updates and sharing. Thank you so much!

story:
Big Spirit Studio!

 What is happening in this space:

* My own art practice- Continuous creation of original and commissioned artwork! 

* Classes and Workshops- I am serving homeschooling families, local families and individuals of all ages interested in going a little deeper into their creativity in drawing, painting, ceramics, print making and all kinds of mixed media!

* Community Art Access - Big Spirit Studio will offer two 2 hour free / by donation art sessions per month starting in May.  As the studio grows I will be able to offer more free art classes and events! I will work with our neighborhood to include community art projects at the fabulous events such as MLK day, Dia de los Muertos and Mayday celebrated at our local park. Community art access is a core value of Big Spirit Studio; building this value into the studio growth makes it a foundational part of Big Spirit Studio.

   

Hello!  

I am Jenna Forder: mama, artist, creative facilitator, and I am so excited to invite you to support a big dream to come true! I have followed the path of art since I was small, drawing for hours every day where ever I was, all the way through college receiving my BFA in ceramic sculpture from CCA(C). Out of this passion, and with the support of family and friends, I built a working artist's studio for the purpose of making, showing and selling my art and facilitating access to the arts in our community. This is my happy place! I share my love for art making with my two kids, 6 and 2, and they provide plenty of inspiration!

Along the way I have discovered a love for teaching and collaborating with people in making and showing art. And now you can help me further my art practice AND help me spread my passion for making art to my community! Here in Oakland, as in many places, there is little or no art in the schools. What we do have is a thriving art community! 

By opening my art studio to the community, and offering my guidance and enthusiasm to local children and their families, I am increasing access to the arts for not just our young people, but for the community as a whole. What feeds me is when people find their own way to get their visions out, sometimes we just need some technical input and encouragement, guidance from a creative facilitator.

I already have some wonderful students and I want to expand my ability to offer my gifts in the forms of individual instruction, classes, workshops for families and individuals, birthday parties for all ages and fun creative community events. I have spoken with neighbors, and many in our community are very excited and enthusiastic about these programs, stopping me on the street to ask: "When can I sign up?"

Will you support my vision for my art studio? You will receive my deep appreciation and one of the fabulous thank you gifts listed to the right for your contribution!

  

The studio is up and running, but in need of a little more financial support to be fully operational. And for your contribution I will send you some beautiful perks that will bring art right into your home! All my perks will be handmade by me with the help of a few of my students. They include hand made cards, prints, ceramic mugs and mixed media artwork. If you are local you can choose to take a workshop at Big Spirit Studio!

Art is Important!              

Art and creating is an innate human tool for discovering and communicating. We've always needed to express ourselves visually. So many don't have access or even have come to believe they are not creative. At Big Spirit Studio I offer a compassionate and fun place to explore and create! To make a mess. We need this in our lives to deepen our understanding, to enrich the experience of life itself. It is time to try a color we didn't know we liked. To spill paint, to get messy. And to make objects that we are proud of. That inspire each other. 

I get energized just writing this to you!

What needs funding:        

Your contributions will help to get Big Spirit Studio running at a highly functional and professional level, and will help me to keep my pricing affordable and accessible! Here are some of the things you will be funding:

Kiln Shed- materials are $384

Electrical update for kilns- $500

Kiln repair and updating- I already have 2 great kilns that just need a little work- $615

Kiln furniture (shelves and posts)- $600

A second work table-approx $200 in materials

Chairs- $180

Easels- $320

Advertising, cards etc- $300

 More Materials; clay, glazes, paints, brushes, screens for printing etc- $400

Childcare for first two months- $1000 (priceless!)

How else can you help?

Please share this campaign with your community! It is easy to share on Facebook, twitter and email. And that is a great way to support my project. Also look out for some fun workday/art-day BBQ events we will be having to keep the momentum going!

You can help me make art accessible to my neighborhood!

With Gratitude,

Jenna 


Thank you for supporting my dream!
story_txt:

story:
歌はジョークです。真面目な内容ばかりにして雰囲気を壊してしまいたくなかったので。

右上の、contribute nowっていうピンクのボタンで募金ができます。

歌の歌詞は下にのせます。The lyrics and translation will be on the bottom.

介助犬を連れて行きます！

I'm taking my service dog with me!


みなさんこんにちは、ヒントンです。The english will come after this. 僕、ものすごく日本に行きたいんです！皆さんご存知かと思うのですが、いま神経疾患を患っていまして（多発性硬化症のひどい版みたいなものです。）、仕事を病欠しています。なので、時間はあるのですが、お金がないんです。家族も今ヘルプはしてもらえない状況です。そこでふと思いついたのですが、僕には友達がいるじゃないですか！ということで、この際、彼らにお願いしてみることにしました。そう、君たちです。ということで、100円でも、一億円でもかまいません。設定されている目標金額は、行くために最低必要な金額です。集まれば集まるだけ、日本に長く居ることができます。なので、もちろん財布が痛くならない程度で構わないので、どうか僕にお金を恵んでください。できるかぎりの恩返しをすることは約束いたします。お金も、良い使い方をします。どうぞよろしくお願いします。これが多分、仕事に復帰するまでが多分、まとまった時間日本に行ける最後のチャンスなんです。

支払いはペイパルか、クレジットカードになってます。たぶんデビットや銀行カードでもできます。簡単です。あと、旅を写真や映像におさめ、ちょっとしたドキュメントにもしようと思ってます。思い出アルバムとしても、場所が遠いなどでお会いできない方にも自分の募金がどんな風に使われたのか、そのお金で僕がどんなことをできたのかををみていただけるように。

何か質問があればいつでも連絡下さい！


Hello it's Yoshi. So, I wanna go to Japan. As you know, I'm on a sick leave from work now (For those of you who didn't know, it's like a worse version of Multiple Sclerosis.). I have lots of time, but no money. Unfortunately my family can't help me out now either. So that made me think of something. What if I beg for money to all my friends? That's right, YOU! So, a dollar or a million, anything would make me happy. The funding goal is only the minimum amount I need to go there. The more I get, the longer I will be able to stay. Please only give me what won't hurt your wallet at all. ANY amount will be greatly appreciated, and I will do my best to repay the favor. I will use the money wisely too. Thank you very much for listening, and please gimme some money! This is probably the last chance I'll have to go to Japan for a good amount of time. Once I return to work, I probably will never have that chance again.

I will take lotsa videos and pictures and document the whole trip, so all of you can see what kind of happiness your money created.

If you have any questions, hit me up anytime!


【追記】

病気の事について質問があったので、詳しい症状を書きます。

神経疾患です。

原因は、ぶっちゃけ謎です。まだ診断中なんです。最高の医療チームで、五ヶ月診断ができていない状態で、どうやらとってもレアな難病みたいです。症状は多発性硬化症（よりひどいようですが）にとてもよく似ていて、目は見えるし言葉も話せますが、体のいろんなところに異常が出てます。大きい症状からあげていくと、まず、足がうまく動きません。一時は全く歩けなくなりました。基本的に杖で歩いていますが、これから介助犬を飼って彼に歩くのを助けてもらいます。つま先に力を入れると、clonusという、激しい震えが出ます。電車通勤のときなんかに、すごくウザいです。続いてウザい症状は、倦怠感です。一般的にこの言葉をきいて想像するような生温い倦怠感ではなく、ベッドからまったく動けなくなるような倦怠感です。例えるならば、もんのすごい重いアーマーをきている感じです。あと、尿閉というのもありまして、たまにおしっこが出てきてくれなくなります。膀胱の出口の筋肉が硬直してしまっているのです。何度かERでカテーテルを入れてもらわなければならない日もありました。カテーテルは、地獄です。抜くとき、内蔵がすべてチンチンから出て行ってるような感じがします。笑。あと、全身が毎日痛いです。筋肉痛と関節痛と神経痛が全部混ざったようなものだと思います。これは日によって上下がありますが、基本的に毎日、朝はからだの痛みで目が覚めます。痛みで起きてしまうので、あまり長時間眠れません。痛みだけでなく、全体的に筋肉は硬直していて、あと、ムズムズします。筋肉はあまり思うように動いてくれません。あと、食欲もかなり低下しています。基本的に、一日一食しか食べません。たまに食欲が回復するときもありますが、食欲がまったく出なく、栄養シェイクみたいなのを飲む日も多いです。あと、性欲はゼロです。基本的に射精はあまりできません。吐き気が一日中続く日も多いです。脳機能が著しく低下する日もあります。あと、歩くとクラクラします。他にもいろんな細かな症状が出たり去ったり去らなかったりしています。

こんな感じなので、一時は鬱もひどかったです。とても沈んでいました。でもそこから這い上がり、いまは心はとても元気です。




↓ジョークですので！不謹慎でしたらすんません！(this is all a joke of course)↓

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

金、金、金。

Money, money, money.

金、金！同情するなら金をくれ！

Money, money! If you're gonna feel sorry for me, give me your money!

金、金！

Money, money!

金、金、金。

Money, money, money.

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

お金を下さい。

Please give me your money.

金、金、金。

Money, money, money.

Thank you very much for listening, and please gimme some money! This is probably the last chance I'll have to go to Japan for a good amount of time. Once I return to work, I probably will never have that chance again.I will take lotsa videos and pictures and document the whole trip, so all of you can see what kind of happiness your money created.
If you have any questions, hit me up anytime!

story:
Aaron Rozenfeld (Nurse Ratched), artist, 5 year Burner, and all around nice guy.

 

 

Camp Orphan Asylum and I are raising money to build and bring the Green T to Burning Man 2018 and we'd love your help.

Why?

Because it's important to us to uphold and cultivate the Burning Man culture in ways that include creating, building, and bringing a gifting experience that will hopefully serve the community by enriching their experience.

 

Your donations will help transform this intention into a reali-tea.

 

What We Need

  • We are hoping to raise $2000 for supplies.

It takes many pieces to make a 12 foot by 12 foot t-shaped kiosk tea house. That includes PVC, canvas tarps, rope, bungee balls, crates, wood, lighting, power, water, a menu, teapot, and (of course) a variety of green teas.

  • If the entire goal isn't reached, all funds will go towards finishing the project as close to proposal as possible.

Science!

 

Stretch Goal

  • If we raise over $2500, we will add the "T-Mobile" (get it?) upgrade. Technically speaking, it's a transport system (also known as "wheels") designed to give the Green T the ability to be moved around Black Rock City, including other camps, art car meet ups, or middle-of-the-night trips to "that way".

Imagine a glowing Green T in deep playa, gifting hot tea in the middle of the night!

What You Get

  • Unique perks? We've got them. Glow-in-the-dark wristbands, name a flavor of tea to be included on our menu,  a personal tea service for you and your friends, and more. It's a win-win!

The Impact

Green tea from a Green T. Warming the stomach on a cold desert night. Cooling the brow on a hot desert day. What more could one ask for?

Remember to bring your cup!

 

Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
Hello friends,

I'm "Mama Bekz", a crafter that thrives in the heart of the Willamette Valley of Oregon.  I have a loving husband, two gorgeous young kids, and a faithful Dalmador (dog).  

I've always wanted to make a positive difference in the world and I believe I came across a calling to do so with children.  It started a couple years ago when a few children in our church family were diagnosed with cancer.  One was able to win the battle, and the other not.  I would make stuffed animals, both sewn and crocheted, to send to them as well as their family members and friends.  As time passed I realized that I thoroughly enjoyed giving items away that I put a lot effort into, it's rewarding and fulfilling.  However, my dream (to send Loch Ness Monster Plushies) takes funds to complete.

To make 200+ "Love Me Loch Ness Monsters" to send to children's hospitals all over Oregon would be a joy and blessing.  There are a lot of materials needed to make this amount of  adorable monsters and various ways to ship them to their destination.  They require hypo-allergenic poly fill, fleece, safety eyes, thread, packaging, shipping funds, etc. 

If I'm able to reach decently past the goal of $800, I believe that I could even spread Love Me Loch Nessies across the country!!!  That would be simply amazing!!!

Thank you for your time and help, every bit is greatly appreciated!

(Love Me Loch Ness is a original design, created by me, RPM-Kreations)
story_txt:
Hello friends,
I'm "Mama Bekz", a crafter that thrives in the heart of the Willamette Valley of Oregon.  I have a loving husband, two gorgeous young kids, and a faithful Dalmador (dog).  
I've always wanted to make a positive difference in the world and I believe I came across a calling to do so with children.  It started a couple years ago when a few children in our church family were diagnosed with cancer.  One was able to win the battle, and the other not.  I would make stuffed animals, both sewn and crocheted, to send to them as well as their family members and friends.  As time passed I realized that I thoroughly enjoyed giving items away that I put a lot effort into, it's rewarding and fulfilling.  However, my dream (to send Loch Ness Monster Plushies) takes funds to complete.
To make 200+ "Love Me Loch Ness Monsters" to send to children's hospitals all over Oregon would be a joy and blessing.  There are a lot of materials needed to make this amount of  adorable monsters and various ways to ship them to their destination.  They require hypo-allergenic poly fill, fleece, safety eyes, thread, packaging, shipping funds, etc.  If I'm able to reach decently past the goal of $800, I believe that I could even spread Love Me Loch Nessies across the country!!!  That would be simply amazing!!!Thank you for your time and help, every bit is greatly appreciated!(Love Me Loch Ness is a original design, created by me, RPM-Kreations)

story:
Short Summary

On a white board at Lipscomb University in the year 2009, Celeste Debro, was conceptualizing an idea to help control the conflicts of independent artists. That day her professor pushed her to answer the questions that would ultimately lead to the development of The Artist Progression Network, Inc.

While interning in Atlanta in 2011, before obtaining her MA in Conflict Management from Lipscomb University, Celeste began coaching and facilitating artists to help balance their career and personal lives. The idea of TAP Network still loomed in her head as she heard story after story of the same issues between all of the artists. Some of the reoccurring issues were money, time, not infrequent opportunities and a lack of business knowledge to push them forward.

In August 2011, TAP Network became an LLC.  Even though things were still a little cloudy she knew she wanted to set up something to help multiple artists simultaneously. After consulting some business savvy people, she decided to make TAP a non-profit, giving the artists would have more opportunity to learn and grow.

In April 2014, The Artist Progression Network, Inc. was granted its 501c3.

TAP is raising money to kick off their Creative Middleman Crash Course that will change the “ I have to starve to make it” deception that many artists share. TAP wants to teach them that there is a better way to cultivate their art through education and proper planning. We have developed a course - that is just for the creative mind. This course will help validate their purpose and give back to the community through economic growth.

Your contributions will be ever so appreciated as we strive to make our mission come alive. Words cannot express the joy we feel  in  having theability to  actually start our  objectives by helping  our community. We look forward to you being a member of this partnership to make dreams come true. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $5000 towards our mission. $1750 will go towards our first Creative Middleman Crash course, $2000 will go towards the logo design, trademarking, merchandising, press releases and publications needed to make our campaign a success. The extra $1250 will go in the bank to be a nest for continuous  growth of our mission.  TAP Network thanks you from the bottom of our hearts as we strive to promote positive artistry to the masses. 

You can donate as little as $1 and all donations are TAX Deductible!!

All donors get a nice tweet and Facebook shout out.

$25: A TAP Network Bumper Sticker

$50: Your name as a silver donor on our website and a really cool TAP Network Ink Pen

$100: Your name as a gold donor  on our website and a cool TAP Network T-Shirt

The Impact

It’s the creative professionals today who are stimulating innovation in businesses across the board. Creativity changes the way information is shared and perceived. This project is extremely needed in these times due to the overwhelming growth in independent artistry (self-supporting artist).  As the times have introduced us to many ways of gathering information and exposing ourselves, via the Internet, more and more people are pursuing their passions to work as full-time artist. The problem with that is there are not a lot of legit resources for these artists to educate themselves on the Do’s and Don’ts when it comes to actually trying to make a living from their art. Many artists just want to focus on creativity while leaving the necessary business information in the midst. This leads to artists not understanding the process it takes for their creations to become lucrative, which ultimately reduces our economic growth.  This is why we deem it important to campaign against “The Starving Artist” so that we may shed a different and more economically stimulating light in the art community.

Risks & Challenges

We may experience a hard time introducing this concept to individuals who don’t understand the art world, and that’s ok. The impact that we can have on our communities will be recognized one way or another through knowledge, perseverance and hard work. We all have to take risks and without taking those risks we may never know what we are able to achieve. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not able to help financially, don't be sad!! You can still spread the word through email, social media or through conversation. Also, if you are in the Atlanta area we are always looking for extra hands!!

story:
"If men had wings and bore black feathers, few of them would be clever enough to match the crow." —The Reverend Henry Ward Beecher



Short Summary

In March 2014, the Spirit Room will publish "In the Spirit of Crow: A Gathering of Art and Poetry from the Great Winter Crow Shows, 2004-2012," a 56 pp. high-production value book to commemorate the 10th anniversary of The Spirit Room’s continued celebration of our companion, the crow.

"In the Spirit of Crow," currently in production, will be launched at the 2014 Great Winter Crow Show. Thom Tammaro, award winning writer and editor, suggested the book to Dawn Morgan, Executive Director of the Spirit Room, and together they assembled a committee of professionals to make the publication possible: Robb Siverson as photographer; Allen Sheets as book designer; and Dwight Mickelson and Jane Gudmundson as art curators. Thom selected poetry by noted regional poets who read their work at one of the Great Winter Crow Show openings. Selecting from more than 400 pieces of art, Mickelson and Gudmundson identified thirty works to represent the variety of media and diversity of talent. All inclusions in the book are from past Great Winter Crow Shows.

Your support of "In the Spirit of Crow" will help preserve and document the history and artistic diversity and talents of one of the region’s most exciting and eagerly anticipated cultural events, The Great Winter Crow Show, now approaching its 6th anniversary and 12-year history.

The Spirit Room has always seen itself as a community-centered organization, and that “community” has always meant individuals in collaboration for the common good and toward common goals.

While we have received partial funding and support from The Lake Region Arts Council and Advanced Business Methods of Fargo to support the publication of "In the Spirit of Crow," we are seeking additional support from individuals like you to help make the publication a reality.

What We Need & What You Get

We hope to raise $3,000 to supplement a grant from the Lake Region Arts Council and in-kind printing from Advance Business Methods of Fargo to produce and market "In the Spirit of Crow."

We offer a variety of opportunities and levels of giving to support the publication of "In the Spirit of Crow." Please look over the options listed to the right, and consider contributing to a level that fits your budget.

All funds received through our Indiegogo campaign will go directly toward the printing costs of this first edition of 350 copies. In order to achieve high-quality production values, full color photographic reproductions of each piece of artwork selected for the book were a necessary and time-consuming process. We have also developed a marketing campaign that will include bookmarks, pins, and posters to help us spread the word about the book.

The Impact

Your contributions will help support the creation of a beautifully designed book that celebrates the art and artists from five previous Great Winter Crow Show exhibitions, as well as ten poems by noted regional poets who read their work at one of the crow show openings. Please join us in creating this lasting testimony to the state of the arts in the greater Fargo-Moorhead community.

The Great Winter Crow Show at the Spirit Room, held in alternate years, is a non-competitive festive exhibition free of entry fees and open to all levels of artistic talents. It is intended to be a mad combining of energies and visual ingredients. The theme is the crow, the blackbird, and all their marvelous and malevolent associations. The crows and ravens keep us company in the wintertime and continue to remind us with their squawks and pacing that they keep a close eye on our behaviors and movements.

Begun in March 2004, the Great Winter Crow Show has gained momentum, with more entries each year and great attendance at the opening reception. Artists within all mediums are invited including visual, literary, dance, music, handwork and the occasional "caw."

Crows are known to play catch with twigs, to slide down snowy hills on their backs head-first, to soar and dive for entertainment, to carry shiny objects back to their nests for contemplation, and to collect hallucinogenic seeds in the fall, saving them to bring color to winter-white boredom. It gets slow in the winter for people too—another good reason to celebrate "the uncanny crow!"

The mission of The Spirit Room is to enrich people’s lives through the development and practice of creative, contemplative, and healing arts. Begun in 1999 as an all-volunteer organization, the Spirit Room became a non-profit organization in the state of North Dakota in 2003 and received federal tax status as a 501c3 non-profit educational organization in August 2004.  Dawn Morgan continues to serve as Executive Director.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that financial support is not always possible for everyone, so we certainly are grateful for any contribution you can offer.

If you cannot make a financial contribution, perhaps consider volunteering your time at the Spirit Room.

Also, please help us spread the word of "In the Spirit of Crow" to your friends and acquaintances. We encourage sharing our Indiegogo address with your social media friends by using the easy Indiegogo share tools! With just a simple click, the caw! caw! caw! of the crow will be heard by all your social media contacts.

And most of all, please join us on March 15, 7:00 P.M., at the Spirit Room, 111 Broadway, in downtown Fargo, North Dakota, when we launch "In the Spirit of Crow: A Gathering of Art and Poetry 2004-2012," in conjunction with the opening of the 2014 Great Winter Crow Show Exhibition! We guarantee an exciting evening for all!

The Spirit Room staff and the editorial team of "In the Spirit of Crow" thank you for your contributions. And, of course, the crows thank you, too!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael A. Dixon aka Michaelveli, and I am a visual artist. I was born June 19, 1978 in Columbia,SC.  I have been interested in art since I was a child, but I never knew it would have an impact on my life the way it does.  I would like to have an event here in Columbia, SC to bring the art culture to a new life.  Instead of me having an art show in other bigger cities, I would love to share this vision here at home.  The documentary about my art and I, directed by Derrick Belton, will be shown and then my art work will be on display. Your donations will help me achieve of a vision of greatness for the art scene of Columbia.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach 1,000 dollars, which will be used to rent out a venue, equipment, and the reception.  There are 2 perks: $20 perk gets you and guest access to the documentary screening, art show, food and beverage.  $50 perk gets you and guest access to the documentary screening, art show, food and beverage. Plus you get a FREE print of ANY of my creations that is at the show! If you do not get any of the perks, you still can attend! It will be $15 a person at the door and you will have access to the documentary screening, art show, etc.

The Impact

 Everyone who knows who I am, know how deeply passionate I am about my art work and where I can go with it.  For those who do not know me, December 3rd 2014 will be a great time to come see what I am so passionate about and why!  It is a honor to share my dream and passion with the city of Columbia instead of elsewhere.  This event has not been done before and I would be the first to bring such an event to my home city. I have been in art shows in Myrtle Beach, Atlanta, and I have one next year in Miami.  I been in 2 here in Columbia, but for the first time, I will have my own solo show!

Risks & Challenges

Yes this events have risk and challenges, just like everyday life.  And like those challenges and risk I will over come them.  But your help is needed.  I have come to far to turn back now and I am that close of accomplishing part of a dream. So I am asking for a donation to get over the hurdles that may come.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, I truly understand. But you still can help by getting the word out by posting this campaign on your facebook page, twitter, instagram, etc.

story:
Popvenstre: En festival med politikk og kultur

Sosiale bevegelser trenger kulturelle uttrykk for å vinne fram, og venstresiden har lange tradisjoner for å knytte politikk og kultur sammen. De siste årene har denne tradisjonen blitt forsømt og en kan få følelsen av at politikk bare foregår i lukkede møterom.

Samtidig blåser en venstrevind over Europa og den er båret fram av engasjement nedenfra. I mange europeiske land samles titusener til festivaler arrangert av partier og bevegelser på venstresida. Lørdag 27. august vil vi bringe denne bevegelsen til Oslo. Vi vil fylle Kubaparken med alle som mener verden trenger mindre egoisme og mer rettferdighet.

Nå trenger vi din hjelp.


Tenk deg en slags blanding mellom Roskilde og politisk konferanse...

Initiativtaker til Popvenstre er partiet Rødt. Tanken bak er kort sagt at vi ønsker å bidra til en mer utadvendt venstreside. Vi tror mange opplever politiske partier som lukkede. Derfor vil vi lage et sted hvor du ikke trenger å være frelst for å dukke opp. Det holder å være nysgjerrig. Et sted som senker terskelen inn på venstresida. 

Under festivalen vil du kunne oppleve debatter, seminarer, bokbad, øltelt, konserter, kulturinnslag, barneprogram, god mat og drikke. Du får dessuten en unik mulighet til å bli kjent med likesinnede fra hele landet.

Les mer om programmet på http://popvenstre.no


Mye er allerede klart

Popvenstre-programmet kan allerede nå skilte med noen av de største stjernene på den radikale venstresida: Bhaskar Sunkara (redaktør i amerikanske Jacobin Magazine), Catarina Principe (Bloco de Esquerda i Portugal), Pablo Bustinduy (Podemos i Spania) og Kajsa Ekis Ekman (journalist og forfatter).

På musikkfronten kan vi friste med konserter med Albert og Elise som spiller Hoola Bandoola på norsk, magiske Einar Stray Orchestra, den vakre og lavmælte duoen Ole & Silje Huleboer og mer til. Ikke minst gleder vi oss til å høre artist Moddi fortelle om sin siste plate med forbudte sanger fra hele verden.

I tillegg blir det debatter, seminarer, bokbad, øltelt, konserter, kulturinnslag, barneprogram, mat og drikke og en unik mulighet til å bli kjent med venstreradikale fra hele landet.


Kjøp Solidaritetspass

Å lage festival er dyrt. Nesten alt koster penger, selv når man baserer seg på frivillig innsats. Vi jobber fortsatt med å utvikle festivalprogrammet, og for at det skal bli best mulig trenger vi din støtte.

Du bestemmer selv hvor mye du vil bidra med, alle beløp hjelper! Gir du over 33 $ får du et Solidaritetspass. Da har du inngangsbilletten i orden, og du bidrar samtidig til å finansiere festivalen. Alle som kjøper Solidaritetspass vil få litt ekstra oppmerksomhet under festivalen. Vi vil vise fram og skryte av alle som turte å tro på Popvenstre fra starten av.

Siden Popvenstre fortsatt "blir til mens vi går" er ikke alle fordelene ved Solidaritetspassene klare, så her vil det komme oppdateringer!

Gi litt ekstra - få litt ekstra

I lista over 'perks' til høyre ser du en oversikt over premier du kan få for ulike bidrag. Disse kan plukkes opp i infoboden under festivalen. Du kan selvsagt også gi penger uten å velge en perk. Pengene vi samler inn vil blant annet gå til:

  • Flere internasjonale gjester (Du blir smartere)
  • Større scene med bedre lyd (Du blir gladere)
  • Annonsering (Du hjelper oss å nå alle som burde komme på Popvenstre, men som ikke har hørt om det enda)

Andre utgifter:

  • Reiseutgifter til gjester fra utlandet
  • Lydutstyr og tekniske fasiliteter
  • Telt og sitteplasser
  • Honorarer til artistene som skal opptre

  • Sikkerhet

Hva går pengene ikke til? First House, lønnsøkning til festivalledelsen, valgkampen til Donald Trump.

Hva om vi ikke når innsamlingsmålet?

Da blir festivalen dårligere. Nøyaktig hvor mye er litt vanskelig å si, men vi har gjort et forsøk:

Når vi målet, vil festivalscenen se omtrent sånn ut:


Om vi IKKE når målet, derimot, vil scenen se omtrent sånn ut:


Sånn cirka.

Andre måter å bidra på

Popvenstre lykkes ikke uten hjelp fra grasrota. Derfor er det mange måter du kan bidra på. Vi trenger økonomisk drahjelp, men også hjelp til å gjøre festivalen kjent, særlig utenfor Oslo. Kanskje du vil sette opp buss fra din hjemby?

  • Meld deg som frivillig under festivalen: Send oss en epost på popvenstre@roedt.no
  • Meld deg til å henge opp plakater i ukene før festivalen: Send oss en epost på popvenstre@roedt.no
  • Invitér dine venner og kjente til Facebook-arrangementet
  • Send oss et valgfritt beløp på kontonr: 7878 05 75416. Merk betalingen med 'Popvenstre'.
  • Vipps oss et valgfritt beløp på Vipps-nummer 10303. Husk å skrive 'Popvenstre' i meldingsfeltet.

Sosiale bevegelser trenger kulturelle uttrykk for å vinne fram, og venstresiden har lange tradisjoner for å knytte politikk og kultur sammen. De siste årene har denne tradisjonen blitt forsømt og en kan få følelsen av at politikk bare foregår i lukkede møterom. Samtidig blåser en venstrevind over Europa og den er båret fram av engasjement nedenfra. I mange europeiske land samles titusener til festivaler arrangert av partier og bevegelser på venstresida. Lørdag 27. august vil vi bringe denne bevegelsen til Oslo. Vi vil fylle Kubaparken med alle som mener verden trenger mindre egoisme og mer rettferdighet. Nå trenger vi din hjelp.

Tenk deg en slags blanding mellom Roskilde og politisk konferanse...
Initiativtaker til Popvenstre er partiet Rødt. Tanken bak er kort sagt at vi ønsker å bidra til en mer utadvendt venstreside. Vi tror mange opplever politiske partier som lukkede. Derfor vil vi lage et sted hvor du ikke trenger å være frelst for å dukke opp. Det holder å være nysgjerrig. Et sted som senker terskelen inn på venstresida.  
Under festivalen vil du kunne oppleve debatter, seminarer, bokbad, øltelt, konserter, 
kulturinnslag, barneprogram, god mat og drikke. Du får dessuten en unik mulighet til å bli
 kjent med likesinnede fra hele landet.
Les mer om programmet på http://popvenstre.no

Mye er allerede klartPopvenstre-programmet kan allerede nå skilte med noen av de største stjernene på den radikale venstresida: Bhaskar Sunkara (redaktør i amerikanske Jacobin Magazine), Catarina Principe (Bloco de Esquerda i Portugal), Pablo Bustinduy (Podemos i Spania) og Kajsa Ekis Ekman (journalist og forfatter). På musikkfronten kan vi friste med konserter med Albert og Elise som spiller Hoola Bandoola på norsk, magiske Einar Stray Orchestra, den vakre og lavmælte duoen Ole & Silje Huleboer og mer til. Ikke minst gleder vi oss til å høre artist Moddi fortelle om sin siste plate med forbudte sanger fra hele verden. I tillegg blir det debatter, seminarer, bokbad, øltelt, konserter, kulturinnslag, barneprogram, mat og drikke og en unik mulighet til å bli kjent med venstreradikale fra hele landet.
Kjøp Solidaritetspass
Å lage festival er dyrt. Nesten alt koster penger, selv når man baserer seg på frivillig innsats. Vi jobber fortsatt med å utvikle festivalprogrammet, og for at det skal bli best mulig trenger vi din støtte. Du bestemmer selv hvor mye du vil bidra med, alle beløp hjelper! Gir du over 33 $ får du et Solidaritetspass. Da har du inngangsbilletten i orden, og du bidrar samtidig til å finansiere festivalen. Alle som kjøper Solidaritetspass vil få litt ekstra oppmerksomhet under festivalen. Vi vil vise fram og skryte av alle som turte å tro på Popvenstre fra starten av. Siden Popvenstre fortsatt "blir til mens vi går" er ikke alle fordelene ved Solidaritetspassene klare, så her vil det komme oppdateringer!Gi litt ekstra - få litt ekstra
I lista over 'perks' til høyre ser du en oversikt over premier du kan
 få for ulike bidrag. Disse kan plukkes opp i infoboden under 
festivalen. Du kan selvsagt også gi penger uten å velge en perk. Pengene 
vi samler inn vil blant annet gå til: 

Flere internasjonale gjester (Du blir smartere)

Større scene med bedre lyd (Du blir gladere) 

Annonsering (Du hjelper oss å nå alle som burde komme på Popvenstre, men som ikke har hørt om det enda)

Andre utgifter:


  Reiseutgifter til gjester fra utlandet Lydutstyr og tekniske fasiliteter
Telt og sitteplasser
 Honorarer til artistene som skal opptre
Sikkerhet



Hva går pengene ikke til? First House, lønnsøkning til festivalledelsen, valgkampen til Donald Trump. 
Hva om vi ikke når innsamlingsmålet? 
Da blir festivalen dårligere. Nøyaktig hvor mye er litt vanskelig å si, men vi har gjort et forsøk: Når vi målet, vil festivalscenen se omtrent sånn ut:
Om vi IKKE når målet, derimot, vil scenen se omtrent sånn ut: 
Sånn cirka. 
  Andre måter å bidra på
 Popvenstre lykkes ikke uten hjelp fra grasrota. Derfor er det mange måter du kan bidra på. Vi trenger økonomisk drahjelp, men også hjelp til å gjøre festivalen kjent, særlig utenfor Oslo. Kanskje du vil sette opp buss fra din hjemby?   Meld deg som frivillig under festivalen: Send oss en epost på popvenstre@roedt.no
Meld deg til å henge opp plakater i ukene før festivalen: Send oss en epost på popvenstre@roedt.no
 Invitér dine venner og kjente til Facebook-arrangementet
Send oss et valgfritt beløp på kontonr: 7878 05 75416. Merk betalingen med 'Popvenstre'.

Vipps oss et valgfritt beløp på Vipps-nummer 10303. Husk å skrive 'Popvenstre' i meldingsfeltet.

story:
Short Summary

I was awarded a scholarship to take a class at Arrowmont School of Arts and Crafts in Gatlinburg, Tennessee. However, I need your help to get there! With the cost of gas, registration and material expenses I need approximately $600. Any gift, big or small, will help more than you know. Thank you for your support.

If you don't know me already, I am BOIBOY, I am an interdisciplinary artist currently based Kansas City, Missouri. Working primarily as an installation, performance and video artist. While at the Kansas City Art Institute I have participated in The West 18th Street Fashion Show, a solo show at Undergrads Underground in the Leedy Voulkos Art Center, and a Performance Art Symposium hosted by The Charlotte Street Foundation. As well I have interned with MYARTS (Metropolitan Youth Arts and Technology for Students), Peggy Noland and Plug Projects.

My work explores ideas related to home, religion, and dissociative moments of transcendence expressed through a dogma of symbolism and color. The work is influenced by New Wave Queer Cinema and Club Kid culture with references to Catholic iconography and cinematic narrative structures.

After recently graduating from The Kansas City Art Institute I want to make sure I continue to grow as an artist. This means reaching out and exploring new communities of national artist such as the diverse community of artist Arrowmount will provide.

This workshop will expose me to a new material and process as well , Fosshape (see description of class below)


The Class

Transforming the 2D Surface to 3D with Fosshape taught by Leisa Rich

Students will transform a revolutionary 2D material called Fosshape -- a unique, low melt synthetic polyester fiber that when exposed to heat and pressure easily hardens -- into rigid, 3D forms. They will learn simple methods of construction including hand/machine stitching to create and build shape, methods of fusing pieces together for temporary hold, distressing to create texture, cutting away and stretching to transform mass, and molding to create form over objects. Before being heated (still soft and 2D) and after being heated (hardened and 3D) students will apply simple, non-toxic dye/paint techniques using DyeNaFlow non-toxic, permanent dyes to add saturated color and contrast. Acrylic spray paint and brushed on acrylic applications will add definition. Hand embroidery and mixed media will further transform your personal creative vision- use it to enhance existing projects, embellish surfaces, add depth through built-up texture and more applications. Turn your pieces into sculptures, vessels, representational forms or wearable art. Unlimited sculptural applications such as maquettes and bases for other art/craft disciplines, an armature for structural felting, theatrical applications such as set pieces and costumes, and more suit a variety of art needs that can be utilized after the workshop in your own art practice.

The Cost

The Drive 

THANK YOU

Any and all contributions help, I appreciate all of you who can help financially and those who can't, but still support me everyday.

- BOIBOY

story:
Short Summary

Joseph Hayes is a Bronx-born painter, chef, creative consultant, and cultural provocateur. Hayes has made a name for himself displaying public art throughout Manhattan and curating shows, as well as using the culinary world as a vehicle for his raw and authentic form of expressionism. The Bronx native has turned heads with his solo shows and curated exhibitions. Whether it is his past history with Interscope Records, being brand manager for fashion designer Brian Wood, or his extensive work in the culinary arts, Hayes has his hand in a variety of artistic mediums which fuels his primary focus in the fusion of painting, street art, and cooking. All mediums reveal his deep understanding of love, struggle, pain, intense emotion and human experience. In combination with his artist ambitions, Hayes is also an advocate for community development, working with public school students around NYC on an ad-hoc basis.

What We Need & What You Get

This campaign is particularly important because it supports Joe's first international summer residency with PremArts in Berlin, Germany. Funds are going straight to resources like canvas and paint supplies, so your help is making a direct impact. We could break it out by how many paintbrushes, tubes of paint, or canvas's will be bought but what we think is most important to know, is that every single dollar raised is going to the creation of artwork. It's not going to rent or transportation or food costs. This is like farm to table but for visual art! Your support is making a direct impact on the creative development in this project. 

Please check out the perks to see what kind of incredible incentives are available. 

Joe x Joe Tote Bag
with Black Unicorn print

HYPE t-shirts
various prints

Jay Electronica
(approx. 1x1.5 ft)

 

Local People
(approx 3x5ft)


 

Manifest Destiny
(approx. 6x8ft)

 

Mr. Rager
(approx. 3x5 ft)

 

Read Fine Print
(approx. 4x6ft)

 

4 West Chelsea
(approx 4x3ft)

 

Golden Ratio
(approx 3x5ft)

 

Haze
(approx 3x4ft)


 

Untitled
(approx 3x4ft)

 

Rolex (#3 of 6, last one available)
(already framed - 3x3.5ft)

The Impact

We live in a time of enormous and rapid change, a time that needs the wild thinking and making of artists. We live in a time inundated by images: pictures, language, videos, stories, bodies. Majority of these images are made for one reason: to get you to buy something. Artists are responsible for that tiny sliver of images that can be made for every other possible reason: cultural, spiritual, political, emotional. Art and entertainment do different things - entertainment distracts our attention and art focuses it and highlights/questions it.

HYPE address youth and media culture. The overwhelming need to be popular on social media, to “be cool” and to buy the trendiest clothing has a serious impact on youth and taken commercialism to a new height. Hypebeasts are people who obsess about the latest brand or trend in fashion, and will do whatever it takes to obtain that desired hype. However, not everyone that wears these brands are hypebeasts. HYPE addresses the impact of this trend on youth culture, while hyperbolizing the fine line between being a slave to the brand and the brand abusing hype-culture.

Risks & Challenges

Being an artist is not an easy profession in our current socio-political climate -- not finding funding support or reaching the needed goal is always a risk. The good news though, is that artists are creatives, so we inherently know how to make the most out of any opportunity. Joe is going to Berlin with whatever funds are raised from this campaign. If the financial goal here isn't met, Joe will find ways to be creative with whatever funding is available.

Other Ways You Can Help

Awareness is just as important as raising money, so if you're unable to make a monetary contribution towards our project but would still like to help, please share our crowdfunding page and help us reach our goal!
