story:
Fifth Times a Charm

Things are different this year. For the first time in a very long time I feel completely committed to my studio practice. While I don't have the predictable support of a day job, it's freed me up to make my work my primary focus again. The last few years have had many ups and downs, but I finally feel like I'm headed in the right direction. I have made an entirely new body of work that will be debuting at SIERAAD, with only a select number of pieces available here in this fundraiser.

I'm also head-over-heels for Ben Smasher, and he's coming with me to help assist with sales, be my cheerleader, and bring me sandwiches when I forget to eat so I don't get cranky at customers.

Travel for Two Ain't Cheap!

We will be gone for nearly a week and a half, with two days devoted to preparation and set up for the fair, four days of sales, and just a little bit of recovery time before heading home.  We've made this trip as cheap as we possibly can thanks to a lot of generosity and support from my SIERAAD family. We are lucky enough to stay with the delightful Linda Ezerman, an amazing jewelry maker based outside of Amsterdam, who is also splitting a booth with me. Still, airfare for two, food for 11 days, as well as the cost of the fair itself add up. We've only been able to plan this by tying up what little capital I had, as well as multiple credit card balances. This is how artists and small business owners grow in a culture that has little support for either. 

Yes, I hope to make money back at the fair, but there is never any guarantee. And being away from home, trying to focus on sales while wondering if there's enough in the bank account to cover bills is a nightmare. We don't want handouts!  What we've done is use this as an opportunity to collaborate in the studio, working together to try some experimental documentation as I create the new work for this year's fair. The resulting photos have been used to generate what I hope is charmingly quaint merchandising for more affordable donations. The one of a kind pieces available in this fundraiser have never been exhibited before, and were especially selected from work heading to the fair. If you cannot make it to Amsterdam for SIERAAD, or you don't want to wait to try and choose your favorite there, then this is your chance to get these pieces before anyone else! 

Why Do I Keep Going Back?

I've been lucky enough to attend SIERAAD since 2012, making this my fifth year exhibiting at the fair. The first time I was invited, I waved it off thinking it was too daunting. I only finally agreed when I was beginning to feel that I needed some guiding event on my calendar to keep me motivated.  I had no idea that over the next five years SIERAAD would become the guiding event during the most difficult period in my life. Many personal losses left me all but inactive in the studio for long stretches, with only the looming excitement of my friends in Amsterdam and the crowd at SIERAAD rousing me for a period of the year before the fair. The automatic work of it helped keep me from feeling completely adrift, and the organizers, colleagues, and collectors were profoundly patient with me.

In 2012, I was the first American to travel from the US to participate.

In 2013, I brought 9 friends from the US to exhibit with me and helped support many others by documenting my experiences. I have continued to help get the word out to more makers, both in the US and abroad, ever since. I cannot speak highly enough of this event. It has been the cornerstone of my practice, introducing my work to new galleries and new collectors every year. The cost of participation is well worth it, with the fee going toward the building of a custom display space that helps emerging artists present at their best. Sales are handled by the fair, the publicity is unbelievable, and rigorous security ensures a level of professionalism and comfort that no other event offers. Though it is not cheap, it is an unbelievable deal. How could I not go back one more time to celebrate my fifth year just as SIERAAD celebrates its fifteenth?

 

All we need is a little support to help us put our best face forward. Give us a little breathing room by supporting us on this trip, and get yourself a little special treasure in the process.

story:
English follows...

 

 Qui je suis

Je suis Hélène Marchis, française habitant au Canada, dans la jolie ville de Montréal. :) 
Illustratrice en freelance et dev tester pour Rainbow 6 en même temps, j'essaie de coinçider les deux jobs ! Ma formation artistique a été faite chez ESMA Montpellier (sud de la France) avec en poche une licence en Histoire de l'Art et Archéologie. Durant mon parcours, j'ai touché à plusieurs secteurs: jeu vidéo, film d'animation, publicité et architecture. 

  Who am I

I'm Hélène Marchis , a Frenchie  living in Canada, in the beautiful Montreal City. :)Freelance Illustrator and dev tester for Rainbow 6 at the same time , I try to match the two jobs ! My artistic training was done at ESMA Montpellier ( South of France ) with a Art and Archaeology History license. During my journey, I hit several areas: video game, animation, advertising and architecture.


  Le Projet

L'expo tournera autour du sujet des ''Freaks'' et Monstres au café Ludique La Récréation de la semaine du 8 août au 8 octobre. Le vernissage (le big party) sera fait le samedi 20 août.
Pourquoi ce sujet là?
C'est une catégorie de personnages sur laquelle les illustrateurs, artistes 3D, scénaristes et autres peuvent se lâcher et s'exprimer complètement. Ils doivent surement représenter un aspect, un caractère de l'Homme pour le créateur de la bestiole choisie. De se concentrer sur une façade de l'humain et de l'illustrer en un personnage, c'est plutôt super inspirant et libérateur en fait (regardez ceux de Guillermo Del Toro). Certains monstres présents durant l'exposition sont aussi des icônes d'enfance comme par exemple (SPOIL, et ça sera le seul et l'unique) Mercredi Addams.

   The Project

The exhibition will revolve around the subject of ''Freaks and Monsters’’. It will take place at La Recréation during the August 8 to October 8 weeks . The opening ( the big party ) will be made Saturday, August 20.Why this topic?It is a characters category on which illustrators, 3D artists , writers and others, can let go and fully express themselves. They surely must represent one aspect, a human character of the creator#artist. To focus on a human’s facade and illustrate a character is in fact rather super inspiring and liberating (look those of Guillermo Del Toro ) . Some monsters present during the exhibition are also some childhood icons such as ( SPOIL , and it will be the one and only ) Wednesday Addams .


  Mais Pourquoi Tu Fais Ça?

Illustratrice depuis quelque temps à mon compte, j'hésitais à me lancer dans l'aventure d'une exposition personnelle pour présenter mon travail. Finalement, une opportunité s'est présentée grâce au bouche-à-oreille chez le Café Ludique La Récréation (qui est tout beau maintenant rénové d'ailleurs) !
Il fallait maintenant trouver un thème à cette exposition, et c'est vers le genre d'univers ''préféré'' vers lequel je me tournais: le dark-fantasy: démons, sorcières, fées, etc... Le Seigneur des anneaux a du joué un grand rôle dans tout ça quand j'y réfléchis bien ! :D
Ce projet compte beaucoup à mes yeux car il est le premier à montrer un ensemble de mon travail personnel (et surement pas le dernier) ! J'attends d'ailleurs les critiques avec impatience, qu'elles soient bonnes ou mauvaises.
Le montant du financement servira à aider pour les dépenses telles que les cadres, les cartes d'invitations imprimées, les canvas, les impressions, le vernissage qui sera à ma charge et les supers cadeaux donnés en contreparties. Ces derniers seront des illustrations, reproductions ou non des tableaux exposés, certains seront même personnalisés si vous êtes assez fous !! L'imprimeur sera Studio Anto, présent au boulevard St-Laurent à Montréal.
Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint les fonds iront quand même à l'exposition mais celle-ci ne sera pas entièrement complète et super over méga attrayante ! 

   But Why Do You Do That?

Illustrator since some years on my own, I was reluctant to get into the adventure of a solo exhibition to present my work. Finally, an opportunity came through word-of-mouth at the Café La Recreation (now renovated, the café is awesome)!Now we had to find a theme to this exhibition, and it is one of my favorite universe I chose: dark-fantasy !demons, witches, fairies, etc... The Lord of the Rings has played a big role in all this when I really think about it! :DThis project means a lot to me since it is the first time I show a set of my own work (and surely not the last)! I also expects forward critics, whether good or bad.The amount of funding will be used to help expenses such as frames, invitations printed cards, canvas, prints, opening (vernissage) and the great gifts given by counterparties ! These will be illustrations, reproductions of the exposed paintings, some will even be customized if you are crazy enough !! The printer will be Anto Studio, now at St. Laurent Boulevard in Montreal.If the goal is not reached, the funds will go anyway to help the exhibition but it not be fully will complete and super over mega attractive!



 L'impact

Grâce à cette exposition, à sa publicité, bouche-à-oreille et articles peut-être (?!), mon portfolio aura plus de visibilité. Cela aidera à avoir une plus grande présence dans le milieu de l'illustration à Montréal et ça sera le début d'une longue série de super projets !!
Un projet précédent avec Les Pixelles (organisme sans but lucratif dédié à appuyer les femmes qui veulent faire et changer les jeux) a d'ailleurs été une de mes premières expositions à Montréal. L'idée était de faire un jeu en 6 semaines (4 pour moi), avec l'aide d'ateliers et de mentors. J'avais choisi d'en faire un autour du livre de Paolo Coelho ''L'Alchimiste'' ! Vous pouvez trouver le résultat ici >>> https://mneu.itch.io/the-alchemist.

  The Impact

Through this exhibition, advertising, word-of-mouth and newspaper article (?!), my portfolio will get more visibility. That will help to have a bigger presence in the illustration’s world of Montreal and it will be the beginning of a long series of great projects !!
A previous project with the Pixelles (non-profit organization dedicated to supporting women who want to make and change games) was my first exhibition in Montreal. The idea was to make a game in 6 weeks (4 for me) with the help of workshops and mentors. I chose to make a round of the Paolo Coelho’s book '' The Alchemist '' ! You can find the results here >>> https://mneu.itch.io/the-alchemist.


 Risques et Défis

Le défi ULTIME: TOUT FINIR À TEMPS ! :D
Cela va bien sûr être fait mais la dernière semaine risque d'être très intense !! Mais si ça ne l'était pas, ça aurait été moins drôle et motivant évidemment ! L'autre défi est bien-sûr que les tableaux ressemblent à quelque chose de sympa à regarder et interpréter (pour les plus zélés), qu'ils soient liés et correspondent au thème.

 Risks and Challenge

The ULTIMATE challenge is to finish all the paintings !! : D
This will be done, of course, and the last week is gonna be very intense !! But if it wasn’t, it would have been less funny and obviously less motivating! The other challenge is the link between the paintings: they have to be related and fit the theme.


 D'autres façons d'aider
En partageant sur twitter, fb et autres réseaux sociaux ou en parlant autour de soi ! Vous pouvez aussi venir faire un tour à l'exposition pour faire un coucou et nous soutenir ! ;)

  Other Ways To Help

Sharing on twitter, fb and other social networks or talking about this project around you! You can also come and visit the exhibition to say hello and support us! ;)


UN GROS MERCI ! A HUGE THANK YOU ! <3
story_txt:
English follows...   Qui je suisJe suis Hélène Marchis, française habitant au Canada, dans la jolie ville de Montréal. :) 

Illustratrice en freelance et dev tester pour Rainbow 6 en même temps, j'essaie de coinçider les deux jobs ! Ma formation artistique a été faite chez ESMA Montpellier (sud de la France) avec en poche une licence en Histoire de l'Art et Archéologie. Durant mon parcours, j'ai touché à plusieurs secteurs: jeu vidéo, film d'animation, publicité et architecture. 
  Who am II'm Hélène Marchis , a Frenchie  living in Canada, in the beautiful Montreal City. :)Freelance Illustrator and dev tester for Rainbow 6 at the same time , I try to match the two jobs ! My artistic training was done at ESMA Montpellier ( South of France ) with a Art and Archaeology History license. During my journey, I hit several areas: video game, animation, advertising and architecture.
  Le ProjetL'expo tournera autour du sujet des ''Freaks'' et Monstres au café Ludique La Récréation de la semaine du 8 août au 8 octobre. Le vernissage (le big party) sera fait le samedi 20 août.
Pourquoi ce sujet là?C'est une catégorie de personnages sur laquelle les illustrateurs, artistes 3D, scénaristes et autres peuvent se lâcher et s'exprimer complètement. Ils doivent surement représenter un aspect, un caractère de l'Homme pour le créateur de la bestiole choisie. De se concentrer sur une façade de l'humain et de l'illustrer en un personnage, c'est plutôt super inspirant et libérateur en fait (regardez ceux de Guillermo Del Toro). Certains monstres présents durant l'exposition sont aussi des icônes d'enfance comme par exemple (SPOIL, et ça sera le seul et l'unique) Mercredi Addams.   The Project
The exhibition will revolve around the subject of ''Freaks and Monsters’’. It will take place at La Recréation during the August 8 to October 8 weeks . The opening ( the big party ) will be made Saturday, August 20.Why this topic?It is a characters category on which illustrators, 3D artists , writers and others, can let go and fully express themselves. They surely must represent one aspect, a human character of the creator#artist. To focus on a human’s facade and illustrate a character is in fact rather super inspiring and liberating (look those of Guillermo Del Toro ) . Some monsters present during the exhibition are also some childhood icons such as ( SPOIL , and it will be the one and only ) Wednesday Addams .

  Mais Pourquoi Tu Fais Ça?
Illustratrice depuis quelque temps à mon compte, j'hésitais à me lancer dans l'aventure d'une exposition personnelle pour présenter mon travail. Finalement, une opportunité s'est présentée grâce au bouche-à-oreille chez le Café Ludique La Récréation (qui est tout beau maintenant rénové d'ailleurs) !
Il fallait maintenant trouver un thème à cette exposition, et c'est vers le genre d'univers ''préféré'' vers lequel je me tournais: le dark-fantasy: démons, sorcières, fées, etc... Le Seigneur des anneaux a du joué un grand rôle dans tout ça quand j'y réfléchis bien ! :D Ce projet compte beaucoup à mes yeux car il est le premier à montrer un ensemble de mon travail personnel (et surement pas le dernier) ! J'attends d'ailleurs les critiques avec impatience, qu'elles soient bonnes ou mauvaises.
Le montant du financement servira à aider pour les dépenses telles que les cadres, les cartes d'invitations imprimées, les canvas, les impressions, le vernissage qui sera à ma charge et les supers cadeaux donnés en contreparties. Ces derniers seront des illustrations, reproductions ou non des tableaux exposés, certains seront même personnalisés si vous êtes assez fous !! L'imprimeur sera Studio Anto, présent au boulevard St-Laurent à Montréal.
Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint les fonds iront quand même à l'exposition mais celle-ci ne sera pas entièrement complète et super over méga attrayante ! 
   But Why Do You Do That?
Illustrator since some years on my own, I was reluctant to get into the adventure of a solo exhibition to present my work. Finally, an opportunity came through word-of-mouth at the Café La Recreation (now renovated, the café is awesome)!Now we had to find a theme to this exhibition, and it is one of my favorite universe I chose: dark-fantasy !demons, witches, fairies, etc... The Lord of the Rings has played a big role in all this when I really think about it! :DThis project means a lot to me since it is the first time I show a set of my own work (and surely not the last)! I also expects forward critics, whether good or bad.The amount of funding will be used to help expenses such as frames, invitations printed cards, canvas, prints, opening (vernissage) and the great gifts given by counterparties ! These will be illustrations, reproductions of the exposed paintings, some will even be customized if you are crazy enough !! The printer will be Anto Studio, now at St. Laurent Boulevard in Montreal.If the goal is not reached, the funds will go anyway to help the exhibition but it not be fully will complete and super over mega attractive!

Grâce à cette exposition, à sa publicité, bouche-à-oreille et articles peut-être (?!), mon portfolio aura plus de visibilité. Cela aidera à avoir une plus grande présence dans le milieu de l'illustration à Montréal et ça sera le début d'une longue série de super projets !!

L'idée était de faire un jeu en 6 semaines (4 pour moi), avec l'aide d'ateliers et de mentors. J'avais choisi d'en faire un autour du livre de Paolo Coelho ''L'Alchimiste'' ! Vous pouvez trouver le résultat ici >>> https://mneu.itch.io/the-alchemist.  The Impact

That will help to have a bigger presence in the illustration’s world of Montreal and it will be the beginning of a long series of great projects !!A previous project with the Pixelles (non-profit organization dedicated to supporting women who want to make and change games) was my first exhibition in Montreal. The idea was to make a game in 6 weeks (4 for me) with the help of workshops and mentors. I chose to make a round of the Paolo Coelho’s book '' The Alchemist '' ! You can find the results here >>> https://mneu.itch.io/the-alchemist.

story:
I am a veterinarian. I like using medical procedures based on traditional medicine. I will go to China to study a bit more Traditional Chinese Medicine.

I also like painting. If you would like to support me as an express of gratitude I would love to draw a nice picture for you in China. I will paint classical paintings but I will also try techniques similar to traditional Chinese brush paintings.

If you would love to just get a nice picture from China this project is also great for you. I will draw nice things, flowers and landscapes. The pictures will be sized as a postcard. You can choose the small postcard (ca. A6 11 × 15cm; 4.3 x 5.9in) or double size (ca. A5 15 × 21cm; 5.9 x 8.3in). For the safety of the picture and to secure delivering to you, all pictures will not be send as postcard but they will be send as a letter.

For $7 I will send you a foto of a picture I will draw in China on your email. Do not forget to write your email address if you want to get it.

In case you are a patron of art there is also something for you. I will paint a very big postcard (ca. A4 21 × 31cm; 8.3 x 12.6in). This opportunity is ready only for one patron. The person who will first make a contribution of $ 499 will receive this image. For its safety this picture will be send from Europe.

I hope you like my art. Thank you for considering contributing. By supporting this project you will also support animals’ health.

story:
It's a flurry of work, here at the Fortress of Figuretude!

As we had hoped, with our work on the mannequins—covering them with my life-long action figure collection—each character is taking on quite a personality of their own! We have work parties several times a week and everything seems to be on schedule!

What has astonished us is new people seeing the project. They will notice a particular figure and their eyes light up: "I use to have a Gumby and Pokey!" and they are suddenly transported to positive, fun memories from their childhood…or their kids' childhood! It has added a whole new dimension to the experience... And to think, this will be happening all week long to thousands of people at Burning Man! Yippee!!! Let's go!

But we do have the line item of transportation yet to fulfill...

We have received a generous grant from Bring Man Arts, we've raised over $2,000 at a wonderful FUNdraiser party, and our first campaign has done well. What’s left is covering the costs of getting the Action Figure Family to and from the playa:

$ 1,500.  /  10x10' Rental Truck (renting for 2 weeks)
$    900.  /   Fuel (about 1600 miles round trip)
$    600.  /  Accommodations there and back again.
$    800.  /  Last minute / emergency costs.
$ 3,800  /  Total

This wild and wonderful adventure has only just begun. Please join us for the journey and the fun!

Backstory

(No exploding planets, radioactive critters, or mysterious jewelry involved)

Remember the joy you got from playing with action figures? How those small toys of plastic and metal fired your imagination beyond the confines of your mundane world? Imagine coming upon a life-sized family, standing in the playa, colorful and poised for adventure. Coming closer, you see that they are literally covered with the imaginary friends (and some foes) of your childhood. And not only can you move their joints, you find that they hide secret delights within each full-sized superhero. This is the Action Figure Family.

2017 will be my 20th consecutive year attending Burning Man, and somewhat arbitrarily, I have decided to let go of my extensive action figure collection. I've always wanted to do something artistic with their exit from my life. Oddly enough, unbeknownst to me, my father (a skilled wooden toy maker) spent the last couple of decades going to garage sales and picking up hundreds of Happy Meal toys. So when he died last year (almost simultaneously with Burning Man 2016) and I found trunks full of these little figures, it felt like a calling to combine these collections into something greater. From this came the idea for the Action Figure Family—an unexpected collaboration with my father.

This 2nd campaign still has kewl schwag for you!

T-shirts, Medallions, and Schwag, Oh My!
First, you receive the deep gratitude of myself and the crew for helping us fund our project. But we also have stickers, T-shirts, and (my personal favorite) a specially-designed metal medallion with the Action Figure Family logo on the front and a personal message of thanks on the back! (Check out the photo of past medallions I have designed!) Each level of support also gets you all the perks of the lower levels.

For 19 years, I have taken photos at Burning Man, recording memories for myself and my campmates. It is now my honor and a pleasure to share them with you! For a $250 contribution, you will not only help get the AFF to Black Rock City (and back!), you’ll receive a thumb drive or a Dropbox folder with hundreds of beautiful photos from nearly two decades of Burning Man to explore and enjoy! 

Did you know I’m a sexologist? (No, this is not a non sequitur. Well, not quite.) Yeah! It’s a crazy wonderful life. I teach grad students, conduct weekend workshops, and maintain a private practice in Palm Springs—as well as online. I’d so enjoy supporting you in your sexual health as well. For your support of $1,000, you will receive a 2-hour Sexual Health Assessment, with tips and strategies to take your sexuality to the next level. I’m proud to have facilitated client’s transformation out of paralyzing shame and fear into the kind of sexual health they’ve always wanted to enjoy. More info here: http://www.doctorrix.com/perscons.html

Finally, for the person who can support the project with a $4,000 donation, I will create a special workshop/discussion experience for up to XX people on a sexuality topic of your choosing, to be facilitated in North America at your event: dinner party, Burning Man Camp, or corporate event. Want to see just how effective I can be in front of a group? Check out my latest performance piece: http://cometrueproductions.com/stake/

Risks & Challenges

This ain't my first rodeo. Back in 2005, I created "Reflective Shade" (pictured) with my collection of 250 laserdiscs. My crew of friends who are also veteran Burners - we have experimented with various modes of attachment to keep the action figures firmly connected (sounds more like couples therapy than art). As suspected, some are best glued, while others are screwed, and still others are zip-tied, and some, all of the above. They ain't goin' anywhere! And we are building these critters ALREADY in the desert weather of Palm Springs (windy, dry, and hot). Therefore, we will have weather proofed them well before we ever get to Black Rock City (Burning Man).  For the most part, they will be completed and ready to go, and we'll just have to set them up once we hit the playa. One way or another, we will make this project blossom, and it's gonna be beautiful, interactive, and fun — damn it!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a few minutes to spread the word:
- Tell your friends about the project
- Post the campaign video on Facebook, Twitter and Tumblr
- Like our Facebook page: Action Figure Family at Burning Man 2017

Contribute your own action figures to the project (and do it right away)

We will be building the AFF in Palm Springs California all summer, and we would so enjoy having you stop by and glue a few figures on our mannequins. Stay connected with us on Facebook for updates and images. Get on our special local "work/play" list to be notified when we'll be working on the project. https://www.facebook.com/actionfigurefamilyatbu...

Thanks you so much!

story:
The Tesla Coils are a project in continuous development by Sextant since 2014, bridging the gap between art and science at Burning Man and beyond. The sparks between the two 32 ft tall towers are a point of reference for all the citizens of Black Rock City, navigating them home from the deep Playa.

In 2017 Sextant debuted with a midi keyboard to let people interact with the Coils. By controlling the spark discharge rate we can generate a range of audible frequencies from the spark as it rapidly heats and cools the air. While we’ve been limited to monophonic low frequency tones in the past,  our next-generation solid-state driver will be able to modulate power through the full audio spectrum and change everything. This campaign will allow Sextant to perform the upgrade and bring the Tesla Coils back to Burning Man 2018 for a new amazing experience.

Aching to learn how we plan to do it? Read all the juicy tech specs below.

About Sextant

A Sextant is a navigational instrument. It represents the guiding principles that bring us together on and off of the Playa to do great things together. 
Sextant is a collaborative group building big art that gathers us and encourages us to look up, see what’s out there, dream big, and go exploring together. 

Sextant is Hard Science, Hard Engineering, and Hard Sexy.

Tesla's legacy 

Nikola Tesla believed that harnessing electrical power would allow humanity to reach its full potential. His exploration of high-voltage phenomena held the promise of delivering power to the world. Sextant has used Tesla’s most advanced systems as inspiration to continue his work, started in 1891, with the goal of bringing passion and excitement for science and engineering to everyone.

More about the Tesla Coils: tech specs

We drive our resonant primary circuit with 800 V and 1200 A (nearly a megawatt of instantaneous power) at 64 kHz using our water-cooled IGBT H-bridge. To control the system, we send signals to the onboard microcontroller over a fiber optic line, which keeps the keyboard (and the person playing it) safely isolated from the high voltage system. Everything is powered by a 25 kW generator, which provides 3-phase 240 V power. We use a step-up transformer (“Lucifer’) and 3-phase diode bridge to charge the 20mF link capacitor bank (the ‘Spark of the Covenant’) to 800 VDC, which acts as the power source for the inverter.

The resonant circuit consists of the primary capacitor bank (the ‘Flux Capacitor’), the air-core transformer (the ‘Trans-raver’), the two resonator coils, and the 8-ft diameter toroids.

Each resonator is approximately quarter-wave resonant at 64 kHz, so the series combination of the two resonators and toroids is half-wave resonant at the same frequency, and presents a nearly-real impedance to the transformer at this frequency. The transformer and primary capacitor were designed to drive the resonators with a nearly-real but significantly lower impedance. The benefit of this arrangement is that the majority of the voltage increase occurs within the resonator coils (rather than in the transformer), reducing voltage stress and corona around the transformer and allowing tighter coupling. The resonators and transformer secondary use a 3-layer winding structure that reduces proximity effect resistive losses by increasing the spacing between conductors without increasing the overall coil length, resulting in a higher resonator quality factor (Q). Aluminum wire was used to reduce the system weight. Because the system is a half-wave dipole, no Earth ground connection is necessary.

Once the electric field strength at the toroid breakout points reaches the dielectric breakdown of air (in the general range of a million volts), an arc discharge grows between the toroids, creating a bright glow and a loud sound as the air rapidly heats and expands. By controlling the spark repetition rate, we are able to generate a range of audible frequencies (and more specifically, create man-made thunder that sounds like Daft Punk).

Up to now, here is how our Tesla Coils sound. 

 

We are now developing a new generation of control board using a faster controller. The new board will then be able to "simultaneously" and accurately generate multiple sound frequencies and hence produce a smooth sound that can play any music with high fidelity.

How your support makes an impact

To make the Tesla Coils upgrade a reality, test and troubleshoot the new system, transport and fire our Tesla coils to Burning Man, we need your help to raise funds of approximately $15,000.

Your donations will help us secure:

  • Materials for the high-current circuit
  • Circuit assembly 
  • Generator rental for testing purposes
  • Custom Capacitor Bank elements 
  • Transportation from Oakland to Black Rock City and back

What we have to offer at Burning Man 2018

This year, Sextant will be back and brighter, better, and louder than ever. By contributing, you’ll help us bring the best:

  • The 52 ft tower with crows nest (best view of Burning Man on playa)
  • 350 ft zipline from Esplanade all the way to A street
  • vünderbar, the bar of the sky, with the best view of our fair city
  • The Tesla Coils, with bigger, better, louder, and more musical sound.

Unique perks for our donors

To thank you for your support, Sextant offers unique perks, all made for you by us with sparkling love. 

For very special donors, you can invite the Tesla Coils to your next big event(wedding, party, business, etc.). Reach out to sextantcamp@gmail.com so we can figure out how to bring lightning to your event.

The adventure year-round can continue thanks to you

All funds raised will go to the upgrade, maintenance, and operation of the Tesla Coils, to be shown in the greater Bay Area during the rest of the year for educational purposes.

Tesla Coils are science. Tesla Coils are art. Sextant is excited to announce that the Tesla Coils will do their appearance for the fist time ever on the international scene to the event Beakerhead, a Spectacle of Art, Science, Engineering in September in Canada [https://beakerhead.com].

Thank you for your support!

You can also help by sharing our Tesla Coils campaign with others! If you like to connect with our creative team, please reach out via our Sextant Facebook page www.facebook.com/sextantcamp/ or by email at sextantcamp@gmail.com

A huge thank you to Jessica Wise [http://www.wiseyesmedia.com], Joshua King [http://www.weldmediapro.com] and Aleksey Bochkovsky [http://www.dandelionair.com/], who filmed and edited our campaign video.
story_txt:
The Tesla Coils are a project in continuous development by Sextant since 2014, bridging the gap between art and science at Burning Man and beyond. The sparks between the two 32 ft tall towers are a point of reference for all the citizens of Black Rock City, navigating them home from the deep Playa.In 2017 Sextant debuted with a midi keyboard to let people interact with the Coils. By controlling the spark discharge rate we can generate a range of audible frequencies from the spark as it rapidly heats and cools the air. While we’ve been limited to monophonic low frequency tones in the past,  our next-generation solid-state driver will be able to modulate power through the full audio spectrum and change everything. This campaign will allow Sextant to perform the upgrade and bring the Tesla Coils back to Burning Man 2018 for a new amazing experience.Aching to learn how we plan to do it? Read all the juicy tech specs below.About SextantA Sextant is a navigational instrument. It represents the guiding principles that bring us together on and off of the Playa to do great things together. Sextant is a collaborative group building big art that gathers us and encourages us to look up, see what’s out there, dream big, and go exploring together. Sextant is Hard Science, Hard Engineering, and Hard Sexy.Tesla's legacy Nikola Tesla believed that harnessing electrical power would allow humanity to reach its full potential. His exploration of high-voltage phenomena held the promise of delivering power to the world. Sextant has used Tesla’s most advanced systems as inspiration to continue his work, started in 1891, with the goal of bringing passion and excitement for science and engineering to everyone.More about the Tesla Coils: tech specsWe drive our resonant primary circuit with 800 V and 1200 A (nearly a megawatt of instantaneous power) at 64 kHz using our water-cooled IGBT H-bridge. To control the system, we send signals to the onboard microcontroller over a fiber optic line, which keeps the keyboard (and the person playing it) safely isolated from the high voltage system. Everything is powered by a 25 kW generator, which provides 3-phase 240 V power. We use a step-up transformer (“Lucifer’) and 3-phase diode bridge to charge the 20mF link capacitor bank (the ‘Spark of the Covenant’) to 800 VDC, which acts as the power source for the inverter.The resonant circuit consists of the primary capacitor bank (the ‘Flux Capacitor’), the air-core transformer (the ‘Trans-raver’), the two resonator coils, and the 8-ft diameter toroids.Each resonator is approximately quarter-wave resonant at 64 kHz, so the series combination of the two resonators and toroids is half-wave resonant at the same frequency, and presents a nearly-real impedance to the transformer at this frequency. The transformer and primary capacitor were designed to drive the resonators with a nearly-real but significantly lower impedance. The benefit of this arrangement is that the majority of the voltage increase occurs within the resonator coils (rather than in the transformer), reducing voltage stress and corona around the transformer and allowing tighter coupling. The resonators and transformer secondary use a 3-layer winding structure that reduces proximity effect resistive losses by increasing the spacing between conductors without increasing the overall coil length, resulting in a higher resonator quality factor (Q). Aluminum wire was used to reduce the system weight. Because the system is a half-wave dipole, no Earth ground connection is necessary.Once the electric field strength at the toroid breakout points reaches the dielectric breakdown of air (in the general range of a million volts), an arc discharge grows between the toroids, creating a bright glow and a loud sound as the air rapidly heats and expands. By controlling the spark repetition rate, we are able to generate a range of audible frequencies (and more specifically, create man-made thunder that sounds like Daft Punk).Up to now, here is how our Tesla Coils sound. 

 
We are now developing a new generation of control board using a faster controller. The new board will then be able to "simultaneously" and accurately generate multiple sound frequencies and hence produce a smooth sound that can play any music with high fidelity.
How your support makes an impactTo make the Tesla Coils upgrade a reality, test and troubleshoot the new system, transport and fire our Tesla coils to Burning Man, we need your help to raise funds of approximately $15,000.Your donations will help us secure:
Materials for the high-current circuit
Circuit assembly 
Generator rental for testing purposes
Custom Capacitor Bank elements 
Transportation from Oakland to Black Rock City and back
What we have to offer at Burning Man 2018This year, Sextant will be back and brighter, better, and louder than ever. By contributing, you’ll help us bring the best:
The 52 ft tower with crows nest (best view of Burning Man on playa)
350 ft zipline from Esplanade all the way to A street
vünderbar, the bar of the sky, with the best view of our fair city
The Tesla Coils, with bigger, better, louder, and more musical sound.
Unique perks for our donorsTo thank you for your support, Sextant offers unique perks, all made for you by us with sparkling love. For very special donors, you can invite the Tesla Coils to your next big event(wedding, party, business, etc.). Reach out to sextantcamp@gmail.com so we can figure out how to bring lightning to your event.The adventure year-round can continue thanks to youAll funds raised will go to the upgrade, maintenance, and operation of the Tesla Coils, to be shown in the greater Bay Area during the rest of the year for educational purposes.Tesla Coils are science. Tesla Coils are art. Sextant is excited to announce that the Tesla Coils will do their appearance for the fist time ever on the international scene to the event Beakerhead, a Spectacle of Art, Science, Engineering in September in Canada [https://beakerhead.com].Thank you for your support!You can also help by sharing our Tesla Coils campaign with others! If you like to connect with our creative team, please reach out via our Sextant Facebook page www.facebook.com/sextantcamp/ or by email at sextantcamp@gmail.comA huge thank you to Jessica Wise [http://www.wiseyesmedia.com], Joshua King [http://www.weldmediapro.com] and Aleksey Bochkovsky [http://www.dandelionair.com/], who filmed and edited our campaign video.

story:
Golden Guy 2018

THANK YOU to all who have supported us so generously in building this thing in the desert we call Golden Guy.  We have felt an outpouring of love from our community and you have made all the hard work so rewarding.  This year we were able to take some of the bars to Decompression, LoveBoat, and Unscruz.  It takes a village to make it happen, so thank you!!  We look forward to bringing Golden Guy back to Playa this summer, at 7:15 & B and we're asking for your help one more time!

In addition to our 5 original bars (Pickle & Eggs, ShangHIGH Sailor, Slinky Kitty, Random Service, and Crow Bar) we are excited to debut these 13 new bars:

White Dragon Noodle Bar - Take off your mask, dust off your fur, and soak in the atmosphere as you enjoy a bowl of steaming ramen served with fresh sake.  Join us in our Blade Runner homage as we pay tribute to I, Robot at Burning Man 2018.

MoonShine Bar - Inspired by the full moon rising on playa this year, the MoonShine Bar looked to the Cosmos for inspiration and a backwoods still. Think moon tracking, night gazing, moonwalking contests and so much more ...the skies the limit (pun intended). 

Blank Slate - Psychic Taxi's second pop up bar.  Instead of the fully white Random Service, Blank Slate will surround you with black walls, awaiting guest bartenders to take over and transform the space nightly.

Magic Treehouse- Inspired by the beloved children's novel... Golden Guy's first bar to build a second story!

World's Smallest Disco - Get your HeartBeats on!

Speakeasy - Ssssh...If you don't tell, we won't.

Skull Bar - Under Construction!

The Borehole - Digging for subterranean leisure and pouring crude cocktails. Inspired by your generator, the business of luxury hole digging, and the class of the open pit lounge. The party has gone underground again. 

Your donations will go towards building the Torri gate, construction, art projects and transportation costs.  We are seeking $3,000.  Thank you for contributing and spreading the word!!  We can't wait to share magical moments together in the alleyway this summer.  See ya in the dust!

story:
Internationally recognized tile artists, Kim Salander and Georgette Wirth of Wirth Salander Studios, Inc. in Wilton, Connecticut, have been creating custom tile and ceramic art for kitchens, baths, foyers and living areas for over 15 years. Their work has appeared in the pages of the leading Home and Decorating Magazines and their clients include top architects, interior designers and celebrities. 

 

They have agreed to bring their talent to our very own Calf Pasture Beach! They have designed a mural for one of the walls at the beach depicting the leisure of fun in the sun. While the city of Norwalk has committed $5,000 towards the projects and materials have been donated, much more is needed to bring this beautiful, permanent tile art to our public space. 

 

There will be 2x6 tiles running in two lines along the top and bottom of the mural. Individuals can put their names on one for only $100!

 

Four lucky corporate sponsors will receive corner brackets with their names inscribed for $2500 each. There are only two center medallions, yours for only $3,000. 

 

The benefits of this project are endless:

*Help to beautify our public beach 

*High visibility with high traffic

*Contribute to our community

*This project is UV and frost proof!

*Long-term exposure - 10 year minimum! Great long term return on investment!

* Your name is in good company with the Norwalk Parks & Recreation and the Norwalk Board of Realtors.

story:
art | adventure | collaboration | documentation

(fly-on-the-wall dialogue overheard when first discussing the project) 
Q. What is Bikini Lines?
A. Bikini Lines is a proposal to create the world's largest street painting using the Cactus Dome as a Canvas.

Q. What is the Cactus Dome?
A. The Cactus Dome is a 107m (350ft) wide dome in the Marshall Islands (South Pacific) that looks like the disk section of the USS Enterprise. 

Q. Is this dome famous?
A. Yes, in a way. Actually, it's infamous. It was built between 1977-80 to contain the radioactive debris from Bikini & surrounding atolls. 

Q. Ahh, so that's why it's called Bikini Lines. Why are you painting it?

A. So that we can film an awesome feature length documentary that includes elements of travelogue, adventure and art. The project is huge and the location incredibly interesting yet under represented in popular media.

Q. Anything else you can tell us about the documentary?
A. Indeed! We will release this documentary to broadcasters  & the general public with 100% (one hundred percent!) of the profits, now & forever, being donated to the Ashinaga Foundation for the benefit of children orphaned in the Japanese 3.11 disasters. 

Q. Wow, sounds cool! Can I get involved?
A. If course! In fact, there are 7 ways you can get involved. Pick one, or pick all!
1. Consider skipping Starbucks & donating a minimum of $5 to our IndieGoGo campaign to make this happen. Bikini Lines relies on public donations, and for each level of donation you give, we'll give you an awesome reward.
2. Upload a design that you would like to see painted on the Dome! Yep, that's right, we're taking submissions from artists & designers as to what we should actually paint on the dome. Think of it; your art painting for all the world to see in Google Earth. That would look pretty sweet on a resume!
3. Upload some videos for a chance to become our official documentary director. (seriously!)
4. Upload some photographs for a chance to become our official on-site photographer!
5. Upload a written proposal for a chance to become our official blogger!
6. Or, try your hand at our wildcard spot if you're an adventurer without artistic ability :)
7. Lastly, *crush it* on social media. Blog about us, Tweet us, spread the word by Facebook or G+ or even Linkedin. Become Bikini Lines ambassadors in your local niche or scholastic ecosystem. Get your friends & family involved artistically and financially. $5 man, that's it!

Oh, one more question.
~shoot
Can you give me a detailed rundown of everything ever?

Yep, here we go~!

BIKINI LINES is a proposed massive, mixed media installation inspired by the lack of standardized nuclear disaster reporting, in particular the panic that set in over Tokyo following the March 2011 Earthquake, Tsunami and subsequent meltdown. (Check out our sexy webpage!)

Our main focus is on creating the World’s Largest Painting on an historically significant & sublimely remote Pacific Island (no, seriously!), using the Cactus Dome as a canvas (!!). The Cactus Dome was built between 1977-80 to house the radioactive debris from Bikini & surrounding atolls (!!!). We're using this awesome setup as an excuse to film a great documentary: we feel that 20+ strangers living on a desert island in the middle of the Pacific working together to create a piece of art viewable in Google Earth has an inherent excitement to it. And you know what? When this movie is finished, we plan on selling it, but instead of collecting any $, 100% of the profits will be donated to the Ashinaga Foundation, an NGO that helps children orphaned in Natural Disasters. We basically want to help Fukushima children that were orphaned in the March 2011 Japanese disasters, you dig?

Before you read on, though, please understand that none of this happens without your generosity. Also, if you're an artist, you're gonna really like what's coming up!

Largely forgotten, the Cactus Dome has long been declared safe but was off limits until now: with special permission from the Marshallese government we invite you to participate in this crowd sourced adventure as financier and potential participant & documentarian, because really, you’re as much a part of it as we are. 

To clarify:  we’re giving you a chance to have your design painted on the dome; to direct our documentary; to be our official on-site photographer & writer. (!!!!). No, really. We're taking online submissions from artists, videographers, photographers and writers. The crowd decides the winners in each category! And you know what, it's free to enter. I mean, we do hope that you're interested in donating some money to the campaign (your choice), but again: this all hangs on your generosity. We need donations to make the painting to justify the video to help the children, so yes, as Mike Tyson said after taking out Robocop with a swift uppercut: "won't you please think of the children!"

We even have wildcard spots for people who want a chance to join but don't have an artistic bone in their body! That's right, anybody can tweet #bikinilines at any time to tell us, in 140 characters or less, why you should join. We'll scour the tweets daily and handpick the awesomest answers. 

Consider this a new type of crowd-funded reality media built on art, adventure, collaboration and documentation, but with much higher stakes. The people of Fukushima will only be helped through great collaboration, and this is our way of giving back, so join us as we converge on the Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands where we will collectively spend December 2012 living on the secluded desert island of Runit ritualistically cleaning and painting the Cactus Dome, turning it into a monument. Conscientious & participatory art, adventure and reality media.  Only you can make this happen.

Impact
We really want this project to be a benefit to everybody involved. The artists (designer, videographer, photographer and writer) who earn a chance to join us by winning the design, videography, photography or writing aspects of the contest will hopefully achieve instant recognition for their work and benefit from greater career options afterwards. The Marshall Islands will gain more recognition from international media & hopefully see a boost in tourism. Most importantly, though, Fukushima orphans will benefit from media sales. Again, 100% of the sales of our documentary will be donated to the Ashinaga Foundation, which helps orphaned children achieve an education. 

What we need & what you get
$200,000 allows us to run operations without cutting too many unforeseen corners. Paint alone will cost between 25K and 50K depending on the quality used. Boat and airplane charters will run another 25K. Getting artists (designers, videographers, photographers and writers) & the standard production team (3-4 people on site) to Enewetak from their hometowns will cost 4-5K each. Food, fresh water, survival gear and island infrastructure will run upwards of 20K. These major points will use up 75% of our budget; it would be nice to have extra cash on hand in order to ensure a higher level of quality and safety. Post-production marketing will be solely reliant on the amount of reserve cash we have. We will also be asking for corporate funding to help ensure safety & success, though their presence will be minimal. This won't be like Burning Man, well, not with regards to branding!

Note: we will be running 2 consecutive campaigns. The fundraising goal for each campaign is $100,000 USD. This is because we can begin gathering supplies and planning logistics over the course of a longer campaign, and it gives artist's time to prepare, submit and market their proposals. We know that many campaigns benefit from shorter, immediate pushes, but feel that ours has to be quite long to really give artists a chance to properly prepare and market their work. 

Campaign One: February 1st until April 30th 2012
Campaign Two: May 1st until July 31st 2012

But what happens if we don't reach our funding goals?

We can't proceed if we don't reach a minimum target of $75,000. In this case we will personally return monies to all people who donated more than $100 to our campaign. As we are still committed to helping children orphaned in the Fukushima disaster, any leftover monies will be donated to the Ashinaga foundation. The production team will keep nothing aside from dashed dreams!

$75,000 - $125,000; The Skeleton Crew
The following people will be brought to the Dome: two producers, director, photographer and extra local Marshallese members. The writer will be asked to join if it's within budget; the wild card will not be able to join. The artist will not join but will still receive credit for their design. A modified, paint-economical version of the official design will be painted on the dome. The film will still be produced and all other rewards honored, including those who paid a deposit to join us on-site. Accommodations and entertainment will be minimal. 

$125,000 - $200,000; The Zombie Crew
The following people will be brought to the Dome: two producers, director, photographer, writer, wild card and extra local Marshallese members. The artist will be asked to join if it's within budget; as per above, their proposal might have to be made more economical from a paint perspective. Again, accommodations and entertainment will be minimal.

$200,000; The Standard Crew
The adventure will commence as planned!

And what if we surpass our goals?

$250,000+
An extra photographer and wild card will be brought (as selected from the short listed nominees). More money will be spent on developing the local infrastructure. Accommodations will be more comfortable & entertainment more entertaining. 

$350,000+ (The Party Crew)
An extra photographer, writer and 2+ wild cards will be brought (as selected from the short listed nominees). We'll also send out an invite to bands who may want to perform live. Accommodations will be as good as they get; rice will turn into BBQ, water into beer. More money will also be allocated to the film's post-production (editing, marketing, etc). We will populate the Dome with more & more Wild Card members depending on how much we raise.

How you can help
We've tried to incentivize this project for artists ("artists" = designers, videographers, photographers and writers) by giving you a free opportunity to submit & market your respective proposals for a chance to join us on site; again, we feel that this is a great project to help out young artists! We would love it if 10,000+ artists submitted proposals and asked their family and friends to vote for them! Of course, we would love it if you & your family also donated some money to the campaign since this project won't happen without your work, but also your generosity. All you have to do is upload your proposals to Flickr (photography & design proposals), Userfarm (video proposals) or Scribd (writing proposals), and then market your work! We will shortlist 10-20 proposals in each artistic category based on the amount of "favorites" & positive commentary you receive from your friends and fans. Instructions on how to upload and market each type of proposal are easily found at www.bikinilines.net. 

This is also a great opportunity to consider the other rewards and prizes we're offering through IndieGoGo. We've tried to make them personal, so that you really feel as if you're part of this epic adventure! Some are pretty cool, like the chance to become an associate producer or own a relic from on-site; others are more down to earth, like pre-purchasing the finished documentary or a handsome giclée print of the final design. 

But you know what? Even if you don't have an artistic bone in your body there is still a chance to win a "wild card" spot to join us on site! This is actually pretty cool: you see, because we want to make this adventure open to everybody, we're giving you a chance to Tweet "@bikinilines" why you should join us. Again, check out our homepage for full deets. 

Lastly,
...if you get an A-list celebrity to tweet us, we'll give you a "digital media consultant" credit in the finished film :)

We've got a pretty extensive FAQ, so head on over if you have any questions. 

Bikini Lines really is about art & adventure for a really good cause, so help us spread the word today!

Thanks for reading,

The Bikini Lines Production Team




FREE! Tweet "#bikinilines" (one word!) why you should join us on site. We'll scour the tweets daily and pick our favorites. If we pick you, it means that you have a chance to join us on site, all expenses paid. You know what, if you wanna do us a proper solid, tweet #bikinilines #

FREE! Get an A-list celebrity to tweet this IndieGoGo proposal and we’ll give you a Digital Media Consultant credit on the finished film. Or, if this describes you and you want to help out, ask your people to contact our people, which is us :)

FREE! Elementary schools, middle schools and high schools are encouraged to leave a message for us in the digital archive. Teachers only, please! Submissions can be uploaded here.
Estimated Delivery: now!

We basically want to help Fukushima children that were orphaned in the March 2011 Japanese disasters, you dig?

Before you read on, though, please understand that none of this happens without your generosity. Also, if you're an artist, you're gonna really like what's coming up!

Largely forgotten, the Cactus Dome has long been declared safe but was off limits until now: with special permission from the Marshallese government we invite you to participate in this crowd sourced adventure as financier and potential participant & documentarian, because really, you’re as much a part of it as we are. 

To clarify:  we’re giving you a chance to have your design painted on the dome; to direct our documentary; to be our official on-site photographer & writer. (!!!!). No, really. We're taking online submissions from artists, videographers, photographers and writers. The crowd decides the winners in each category! And you know what, it's free to enter. I mean, we do hope that you're interested in donating some money to the campaign (your choice), but again: this all hangs on your generosity. We need donations to make the painting to justify the video to help the children, so yes, as Mike Tyson said after taking out Robocop with a swift uppercut: "won't you please think of the children!"

We even have wildcard spots for people who want a chance to join but don't have an artistic bone in their body! That's right, anybody can tweet #bikinilines at any time to tell us, in 140 characters or less, why you should join. We'll scour the tweets daily and handpick the awesomest answers. 

Consider this a new type of crowd-funded reality media built on art, adventure, collaboration and documentation, but with much higher stakes. The people of Fukushima will only be helped through great collaboration, and this is our way of giving back, so join us as we converge on the Enewetak Atoll in the Marshall Islands where we will collectively spend December 2012 living on the secluded desert island of Runit ritualistically cleaning and painting the Cactus Dome, turning it into a monument. Conscientious & participatory art, adventure and reality media.  Only you can make this happen.

Impact
We really want this project to be a benefit to everybody involved. The artists (designer, videographer, photographer and writer) who earn a chance to join us by winning the design, videography, photography or writing aspects of the contest will hopefully achieve instant recognition for their work and benefit from greater career options afterwards. The Marshall Islands will gain more recognition from international media & hopefully see a boost in tourism. Most importantly, though, Fukushima orphans will benefit from media sales. Again, 100% of the sales of our documentary will be donated to the Ashinaga Foundation, which helps orphaned children achieve an education. 

What we need & what you get
$200,000 allows us to run operations without cutting too many unforeseen corners. Paint alone will cost between 25K and 50K depending on the quality used. Boat and airplane charters will run another 25K. Getting artists (designers, videographers, photographers and writers) & the standard production team (3-4 people on site) to Enewetak from their hometowns will cost 4-5K each. Food, fresh water, survival gear and island infrastructure will run upwards of 20K. These major points will use up 75% of our budget; it would be nice to have extra cash on hand in order to ensure a higher level of quality and safety. Post-production marketing will be solely reliant on the amount of reserve cash we have. We will also be asking for corporate funding to help ensure safety & success, though their presence will be minimal. This won't be like Burning Man, well, not with regards to branding!

Note: we will be running 2 consecutive campaigns. The fundraising goal for each campaign is $100,000 USD. This is because we can begin gathering supplies and planning logistics over the course of a longer campaign, and it gives artist's time to prepare, submit and market their proposals. We know that many campaigns benefit from shorter, immediate pushes, but feel that ours has to be quite long to really give artists a chance to properly prepare and market their work. 

Campaign One: February 1st until April 30th 2012
Campaign Two: May 1st until July 31st 2012

But what happens if we don't reach our funding goals?

We can't proceed if we don't reach a minimum target of $75,000. In this case we will personally return monies to all people who donated more than $100 to our campaign. As we are still committed to helping children orphaned in the Fukushima disaster, any leftover monies will be donated to the Ashinaga foundation. The production team will keep nothing aside from dashed dreams!

$75,000 - $125,000; The Skeleton Crew
The following people will be brought to the Dome: two producers, director, photographer and extra local Marshallese members. The writer will be asked to join if it's within budget; the wild card will not be able to join. The artist will not join but will still receive credit for their design. A modified, paint-economical version of the official design will be painted on the dome. The film will still be produced and all other rewards honored, including those who paid a deposit to join us on-site. Accommodations and entertainment will be minimal. 

$125,000 - $200,000; The Zombie Crew
The following people will be brought to the Dome: two producers, director, photographer, writer, wild card and extra local Marshallese members. The artist will be asked to join if it's within budget; as per above, their proposal might have to be made more economical from a paint perspective. Again, accommodations and entertainment will be minimal.

$200,000; The Standard Crew
The adventure will commence as planned!

And what if we surpass our goals?

$250,000+
An extra photographer and wild card will be brought (as selected from the short listed nominees). More money will be spent on developing the local infrastructure. Accommodations will be more comfortable & entertainment more entertaining. 

$350,000+ (The Party Crew)
An extra photographer, writer and 2+ wild cards will be brought (as selected from the short listed nominees). We'll also send out an invite to bands who may want to perform live. Accommodations will be as good as they get; rice will turn into BBQ, water into beer. More money will also be allocated to the film's post-production (editing, marketing, etc). We will populate the Dome with more & more Wild Card members depending on how much we raise.

How you can help
We've tried to incentivize this project for artists ("artists" = designers, videographers, photographers and writers) by giving you a free opportunity to submit & market your respective proposals for a chance to join us on site; again, we feel that this is a great project to help out young artists! We would love it if 10,000+ artists submitted proposals and asked their family and friends to vote for them! Of course, we would love it if you & your family also donated some money to the campaign since this project won't happen without your work, but also your generosity. All you have to do is upload your proposals to Flickr (photography & design proposals), Userfarm (video proposals) or Scribd (writing proposals), and then market your work! We will shortlist 10-20 proposals in each artistic category based on the amount of "favorites" & positive commentary you receive from your friends and fans. Instructions on how to upload and market each type of proposal are easily found at www.bikinilines.net. 

This is also a great opportunity to consider the other rewards and prizes we're offering through IndieGoGo. We've tried to make them personal, so that you really feel as if you're part of this epic adventure! Some are pretty cool, like the chance to become an associate producer or own a relic from on-site; others are more down to earth, like pre-purchasing the finished documentary or a handsome giclée print of the final design. 

But you know what? Even if you don't have an artistic bone in your body there is still a chance to win a "wild card" spot to join us on site! This is actually pretty cool: you see, because we want to make this adventure open to everybody, we're giving you a chance to Tweet "@bikinilines" why you should join us. Again, check out our homepage for full deets. 

Lastly,
...if you get an A-list celebrity to tweet us, we'll give you a "digital media consultant" credit in the finished film :)

We've got a pretty extensive FAQ, so head on over if you have any questions. 

Bikini Lines really is about art & adventure for a really good cause, so help us spread the word today!

Thanks for reading,

The Bikini Lines Production Team




FREE! Tweet "#bikinilines" (one word!) why you should join us on site. We'll scour the tweets daily and pick our favorites. If we pick you, it means that you have a chance to join us on site, all expenses paid. You know what, if you wanna do us a proper solid, tweet #bikinilines #

FREE! Get an A-list celebrity to tweet this IndieGoGo proposal and we’ll give you a Digital Media Consultant credit on the finished film. Or, if this describes you and you want to help out, ask your people to contact our people, which is us :)

FREE! Elementary schools, middle schools and high schools are encouraged to leave a message for us in the digital archive. Teachers only, please! Submissions can be uploaded here.
Estimated Delivery: now!
campaign_city: Enewetak Atoll, CACTUS DOME!, Marshall Islands

story:
Rupert was his name.

Rupert the rabbit.

He came to nibble at my thoughts and heart, tickling and tickling until I finally turned my full attention to him, to learn what he had to say.  And WOW!  - was I ever surprised!

It was never my intention to write a children's book, but it was certainly his intention to have me teach children about the Wheel of the Year.  And so I have.  We started with Beltane, my furry friend and I, then we worked our way throughout the seasons and Sabbats.  And when I was done, I shared his stories everywhere. 

To my great surprise, many wanted to know where they could buy these stories for themselves.  It was with even greater surprise - if that was possible -  that within one hour of submitting his stories to Schiffer Publishing, the president of the company himself wrote and asked me for more!

That, however, was not the end of the surprises.  Oh no - not at all!  Very soon after that, an artist by the name of Tonia hopped into our lives and presented me with the picture you see above, showing me exactly what our delightful friend looked like.

And so were the first three Rupert's Tales titles created.  The first book tells stories of Beltane, Litha, Lammas, and Mabon.  The second has tales about Samhain, Yule, Imbolc, and Ostara.       

             

And our third title is an Activity Book with pictures to color from both of these books.

                                 

But this is not where our story ends.  Oh no!  Not at all!  Rupert has much, much more to teach us all, I can tell you that!

We have just released "Rupert's Tales: Rupert Helps Clean Up" which has four stories in which Rupert learns about reducing, reusing and recycling:

                         

If that isn't enough, you should know we will have a brand new book in 2014 with four bedtime stories in it.  And that, my friends, is why the time has come to be able to have your very own Huggable Rupert - so you can hold and hug him while you read about Daragon the dragon, Brody the bat, Rachael the raccoon, Marissa the mermaid, Ulna the Unicorn and many more of Rupert's new friends - and their adventures in learning how important it is that you get a good night's sleep, and how you can control your own dreams so they are sweeter than ever before.

 

Cost of making Huggable Rupert:

First, you should know there are federal safety regulations regarding the manufacture of children's toys which made some of the options I had considered impossible, and the rest of my options very expensive.

Not all rabbits look like Rupert, as you can see:

         

 

One of the MOST-important parts of the entire process is to make sure the "Huggable Rupert" looks like our Rupert. A sample must be created first - one to my specifications.

And there are minimum order requirements which must be met.  One of the potential manufacturers requires a minimum of 900 pieces, the other requires 500, but has a substantially higher per-piece price.

Our goal of $9,000 is the bare minimum we will need in order to get the project completed and includes:

  • Sew-on tags
  • Shipping Allowance
  • Agent Fees (Customs)
  • Production Fees
  • Safety Regulation Compliance
  • Sample Creation Development (with unlimited revisions)
  • Taxes for Funds Received
  • PayPal, Credit Card, and IndieGogo Fees
  • Shipment of Perks - Including Huggable Ruperts

Average completion of the design and manufacture process is 12 weeks - once the order has been placed and payment has been made.

 

You Asked for Rupert

And Oh - how we want to bring him to you!

By contributing $25 or more, you are actually purchasing your own Huggable Rupert in advance.  It's really that simple.

This is my own Huggable Rupert - a very well-loved model from which we are creating a new plush toy for generations of children (and grandchildren!) to come! 

     

 

        

Although this one is smaller than ours will be, this picture should give you a good idea of what we intend to create so (you and) your child can have a furry friend of their own with which to enjoy reading Rupert's Tales.  There many more adventures to come as we look forward to "Rupert Learns about Making Magick," "The Nature of Elements," "Celebrate Being You," and more!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We relalize some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help.  Please share our campaign with your friends, and family members, and even with those organizations and groups who have folks in them who you know would be interested in having their own Huggable Rupert!

And while you're waiting for yours to hug and hold while you drift off to sleep, maybe this song will help you on your way to sweeter dreams:

Hug Your Rupert

 

Thank you for being a Friend of Rupert!!

 

You Rock!!

 

                                 

 

An Important Update: 

                          

We are pleased to announce we are donating $1 to Circle Sanctuary for every Huggable Rupert sold (or pre-ordered) for as long as they are sold.  We hope that will be a very, very long time to come!  We are delighted to be contributing to an organization which we feel beautifully represents what Rupert brings to the world: acceptance, education, advocacy,understanding.  For more information about the exhaustive listing of what THEY bring to the world, please visit their website here: https://www.circlesanctuary.org/

 

Friends of Rupert Website

Friends of Rupert Facebook

Friends of Rupert YouTube Channel

Friends of Rupert TV Show

For questions and comments, you can drop us a note at friendsofrupert@yahoo.com

story:
Grievances Vision

Grievances is a zine for revolutionaries publishing art and writing from contributors around the U.S. and globally.

  • My name is Lorna Festa, and I am a writer living in North Carolina. I created Grievances and published the first issue in April of last year. The literary and art zine was originally intended to be a quarterly publication, but since it is an independent and out-of-pocket publication, time and resources did not allow volunteers to continue full swing.
  • The campaign for Grievances will allow us to have a greater reach, thus soliciting submissions from people all over the world and with a variety of opinions on all imaginable subjects. This artist collective will encourage new perspectives, help put an end to ignorance, as well as publicize up-and-coming as well as established writers and artists.

Our Mission & Your Reward

The creators and volunteers for Grievances hope to:

  • Print 500 copies for consignment at shops around the southeastern U.S. At Fed-Ex/Kinkos, this will run about $700 for a 32-page all black and white zine.
  • Set up a website & blog so Grievances can be available online.
  • Send money to contributing artists and writers so they can print copies of Grievances and distribute them in their areas.
  • Any money over our $3,000 goal will be used to start a small scholarship program for writers and artists that submit a project proposal and need funding for time or expenses needed to fulfill their goal.
For your $5 donation, you will receive one copy of Grievances Issue 2, when it comes out in November 2015.
For your $20 donation, you will receive 2 copies of Grievances Issue 2 and a Grievances poster.
Your $50 or higher donation gets you: 2 copies of Grievances Issue 2, one limited edition copy of Grievances Issue 1, a poster, and sticker.

The Bigger Picture

We hope to make a difference in the lives of our readers and our artists! Originally a free publication, we now ask for a small donation for every copy "sold" in order to pay for the cost of the printing and insure future issues can be made. Cheques will be mailed to contributing artists in order to pay them for their work as well as provide  funding for them to print copies of Grievances in their home state or country.

Eventually, we would love to have several small scholarships for our artists so they can have a sort of stay-at-home residency and complete the work they really need to give their attention to.

Risks & Challenges Help Us Grow!

The world of publishing isn't what it used to be. With attention spans at an all-time low due to accessibility of various media on the internet, reading isn't even what it used to be. We realize that the printed publication might not get into the hands of the widest public yet, but our goal is to get it into the hands of the right people, whether that be people who want to join our creative collaborative mission, people that need a new perspective, or people that need to commiserate with a similar point of view. 

Other Ways to Contribute

Submit art or writing to airyourgrievances@gmail.com in pdf jpeg or word document format by 31 October for consideration for Issue 2 of Grievances.

Contact the editor, Lorna Festa (also via airyourgrievances@gmail.com) to volunteer to help judge submissions, layout, or printing the zine.

Please visit lornafesta.com/future-projects for more information. If this link doesn't work, please see the links below. v V v (facebook, YouTube video, website) v V v
