story:
You can still contribute to Damascus Walls. The money I raise that exceeds the goal will go directly into donation.

About Me:

My name is Dima Karout, I live in Montreal and recently the simple question “where do you come from?” became too complicated to answer.

I was born in Damascus. At the age of 23, I left home to discover the world. In my baggage, a Diploma in Visual Communication from the Fine Arts University of Damascus, Masters Degree in Contemporary Arts and New Media from Paris VIII University and a Certificate in Creative Writing from Concordia University.

I studied and worked in Damascus, Paris and Montreal. I have experience in graphic design, communication, art research and teaching. I am impressed by creativity and its limitless nature, I love art, photography and writing, and I live out of a suitcase.

 

About My Project:

Damascus Walls is an art expression born under attack. Inspired by a novel in progress, this exhibition combines photography, creative writing and installation artwork to explore the metaphor of Walls as barriers surrounding our life.

The Damascus Walls exhibition is divided into three parts; first two parts explore two fictional characters who are travelling, looking for answers and struggling with their walls, and the third part is an installation that combines true stories and images coming from Syrians facing the conflict in their country:

She – who left before the conflict

He – who left during the conflict

We – who are spread across the planet

 

With Damascus Walls - triggered by my own sense of displacement, I aim to express the human side of the crisis in Syria, one that often gets lost in the ongoing reporting of events. By giving a voice to those who have suffered, I wish to raise awareness and to create a place of sharing. As this project grows, I want to continue working on it and keep creating “in the hope of lighter baggage”.

 

About Your Contribution:

Your contribution will help me achieve a project I believe in and have worked on for three years and present my first solo exhibition in Montreal. It will help me voice Syrian stories and share with the world our feelings and experiences as human beings struggling to face the big Wall introduced in our life in 2011.

I started to organize the Damascus Walls exhibition and I am almost there. The MAI – Montréal, arts interculturels is hosting the show, and the opening will be on December 10, 2014.

I will cover half of the production costs, and I hope you can support me to cover the other half. Your money will help me with: frames, printing and installation materials (wires, fabrics, glass).

During the exhibition, I will put all my artwork for sale, and when the exhibition is over, I will donate all profits to a Syrian association that operates in the city of Homs – Almoukales Center.

And if this campaign exceeds its goal, I will donate the extra money too.

 

About You:

By being part of this project, you are empowering art over war in a complicated situation.

  

What You Get:

-       My endless gratitude.

-       Your name will be on the Thank You Wall during the seven-day show. A photo of this Wall will be on The Walls Project website forever to thank you for making it happen.

-       If you are planning to visit Montreal in 2015, your coffee experience is on me. I know the top five coffee shops.

-       You can have a 30 minutes Skype call with me, and then I will write a short story about you inspired by our conversation.

-       If you are interested in Graphic Design or Photo Retouching and you are coming to Montreal in 2015, I can teach you a 5-hour class on either Photoshop or Illustrator. I am “an awesome and fun teacher” by one of my students. And your coffee is on me.

You can also purchase one of the printed perks with a photo of Old Damascus, the oldest inhabited capital in the world, and have it in your home or offer it to a friend. This piece will remind you that you made a difference.

All the printed perks are designed and produced by me. They assemble photos of Old Damascus (textures and details) and creative handwritten pieces (paragraphs from my stories).

-       Postcards (photos of Old Damascus + creative handwritten pieces available in three languages: English, French and Arabic).

-       Reproductions of the photos presented at the exhibition in smaller format (8.5x11 inches).

-       Some of the artwork presented at the exhibition.

 

Make sure to send me your full name, e-mail and postal address, and I will make sure to ship them once the exhibition is over – by December 20, 2014. All prices include international shipping.

 


I can’t post images of the artwork since it is not finished yet, but I will be posting the work in progress during the campaign. I will update images of the opening and the final artwork when the exhibition is over.

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

-       If you have a story to share about a Wall in your life, please submit to the Participate page on: wwww.wallsproject.com

-       If you live in Montreal or know people who do, please come to the exhibition and invite them. Free admission to all events during the show.

-       Please spread the word. Share this campaign with your entourage and encourage them to participate and purchase something, every single gesture matters.

-       Invite everyone to join the Facebook page of the event:

https://www.facebook.com/events/1481912228742629


Details:

The project website is: www.wallsproject.com

The project Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/1481912228742629

My personal website is: www.dimakarout.com

 

Almoukales Center is a Syrian association with a brave team who decided to stay in the city of Homs, the first city destroyed by the conflict. They are recreating a community, helping Syrians in need regardless their religions or political affiliation. Trying to provide food, medicines and hope. Their most important work, to my eyes, is the educational role they are playing with the neighborhood’s children who were forced to leave their destroyed schools. The center currently hosts more than 800 boys and girls of all faith including activities for disabled children, and their project is extended to other areas to help more than 3.000 children today. You can see them and follow their amazing work on their Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/almoukales.center

 

For questions please contact me: contact@dimakarout.com

Thank you for your support!

story:
“HOME”

                                               “Art in public space is a live experience”

                                                       On July 25-29th 2015

                                              Historical Center of Ermoupoli

                    3D installation & video projection on neoclassical buildings

     Home is love, Home is where our story begins, Home is where your heart is!


Greece experiences a major crisis, however culture does not pause. The team of Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015 - "HOME"* tirelessly prepares with dedication to highlight the beauty of the island of Syros, to bring the neoclassical buildings to life and do something magical using digital art over the canvas of public space.

But we do need all the support we can get, and we need your help to complete this project. A small financial contribution would make a huge difference, and that's why we invite you to be part of our effort and part of the "Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015" experience.


Thank you very much!
*=Home is love, Home is everywhere.



But, Why Support Eye's Walk Digital Festival?

Becasuse Eye’s Walk Festival was a phenomenon, a surprise of 2014!

With a minimal budget, we managed to become the one innovative festival in Greece and the Balkans that connect video art, painting, cinema, architecture and experience design. All of that taking place in the cultural capital of Cyclades, in the Aegean Sea.










Why is Eye's Walk digital festival 2015 / HOME held in Ermoupoli?

Because Ermoupoli (Hermoupolis) - the capital of Syros island - provides the perfect space to accommodate a dreamy set-up.

The light, movement and colors of video installation art on old, historical buildings of the city trigger the senses unexpectedly and truly awaken the spectator!

Ermoupoli is “home” for so many people from various backgrounds (religious, social, national). Its buildings have their own stories to tell for decades now.

Eye’s Walk Digital Festival connects the unique architectural legacy of Syros with public space and the community of the island, through the most modern art, video installation art.






The inspiration behind this year’s Eye’s Walk Digital festival is “Home”.

·  July 25, 21:30

Nine [9] international artists are inspired and create 3d video installations & projection mapping that will be projected on exterior walls of neoclassic buildings of Ermoupoli.

Our artists:

Aliki Arnaouti, Angelina Voskopoulos, Οlga Βrouma and Ayis Kelpekis from Greece, Vladimir Necakov from Serbia, Sophie Leddick from the USA, Katy Kavanaugh from Germany and Arjang Omrani from Iran.

Public space in Ermoupoli will come alive, and people that find themselves in the city at the night of July 25th will walk from each stop of our festival to the next one, interact with the buildings, learn about their stories, access their secrets and immerse themselves in the experience we have designed for them.

1st Stop: Apollon Theatre

2nd Stop: Lyceum of Greek Women

3rd Stop: Catholic Nursing Home ,Square Tsiropina

4th Stop:  Androulla Hall, Protopapadaki Street

So let’s make this happen together, because Home is Everywhere!








·  July 25-29

"Velissaropoulos Mansion*" opens its doors for the first time ever and welcomes the contemporary art installation "Home? Sweet littlest home". Created by the "En Dynamei" team, this project was first introduced at the Macedonian Museum of Contemporary Art, in Thessaloniki [2/2015].

* Velissaropoulos Mansion, a listed three stories neoclassical building, was built in the nineteenth century, during the prime of neoclassicism in Greece. It is renowned for its unique ceiling and wall murals.

Why is home the title and theme of our festival this year?

What “HOME” means to us.

“Home” maybe be our own skin, but it may also be a favorite person; the country we live in or the country we left behind. “Home” is the ugly duckling turning into a swan. It is the cozy feeling of morning coffee.

“Home” – “When you focus with your soul’s eyes, you will see home in many places.”






The participating artists explore the meaning of “Home” through their video installation art.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVAnAQrrtpg&feature=youtu.be  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9zlGbQFRxU&feature=youtu.be




The Eye’s Walk Digital Festival team also explores the meaning of “Home” in Syros.

Through our photographic project “Inside Out” that we unveil photo by photo on our Facebook page, different people live their personal notion of familiarity or intimacy, their “HOME,” in public spaces around the island. How authentic can we really be outside our familiar space, our home? How open are we to let the public space become an extension of our sense of “Home” and take a different meaning in our daily stories?

Everywhere is Home, Here, There, Everywhere, Somewhere, Home.






Who we are:

Founder & Corporate Manager: Filia Milidaki

Multimedia Specialist: Spyros Koudounas

Experience Designer & Communication Director: Eirini Tzavara

Administration: Christos Petkidis

Production  & Social Media Manager: Io Kyriakati

Photographers: Maria Merkou, Katerina Preka, Maria Rigania

Video:Tatiana Kasimati

Internships: Marianna Kampianaki, Giorgos Laftsis Skretas

Volunteers: Viveta Karpondini & undergraduate, graduate students of DPSD (Department of Product and Systems Design Engineering) in Syros., Xristina Kachrimani, Virna Natsi, Olina Kintzonidi, Ioanna Giannoula, Chrysa Zikoudi




We are innovative, but we also want to be able to materialize our vision to the fullest. Here is what we need your help for:

·  Creation of our official web page, according to principles of accessibility so that we can reach everyone easier: 2.000 €

·  Expenses for the stay and transportation in Syros for our production team and participating artists during the days of the festival: 400 €

·  Creation of a making of video for our big night, July 25, so that you do not miss a second of it: 400 €

·  Printing posters, maps, banners and all sorts of printed material that we need to promote our festival: 500 €






                                            Eye’s Walk Digital festival in Ermoupoli

                                                                         “HOME”

                                        “Art in public space is a live experience”

                                                    25-29 Ιουλίου 2015

                                           ΙστορικόκέντροΕρμούπολης

             3D installation & video projection on neoclassical buildings

  Home is love, Home is where our story begins, Home is where your heart is!


Η Ελλάδα βιώνει μια μεγάλη κρίση. όμως ο πολιτισμός πρέπει να προχωρήσει.Το  Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015/Home*  ετοιμάζεται  να αναδείξει την ομορφιά της Σύρου , να ζωντανέψει τα νεοκλασικά της κτήρια και να κάνει αυτό το μαγικό  δημόσιο χώρο καμβά για τις ψηφιακές τέχνες.


Χρειαζόμαστε τη βοήθεια όλων σας για να καταφέρουμε να φέρουμε σε πέρας το έργο μας.
Η μικρή οικονομική συμβολή σας θα κάνει μία μεγάλη διαφορά, και γι'αυτο σας καλούμε να γίνεται μέρος  της προσπάθειάς μας, και κομμάτι της εμπειρίας του Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015.


Σας ευχαριστούμε πολύ 

*Home is love, Home is everywhere.



To 2014 ήμασταν το φεστιβάλ φαινόμενο, η έκπληξη!

Με ελάχιστο προϋπολογισμό γινόμαστε Ένα καινοτόμο φεστιβάλ μοναδικό στην Ελλάδα και στα Βαλκάνια που συνδέει τη Video art, τη ζωγραφική, τον κινηματογράφο, την αρχιτεκτονική & το design εμπειρίας στο ιστορικό κέντρο της Ερμούπολης, στη μέση των Κυκλάδων.







Γιατί το Eye΄s Walk digital  festival 2015, “HOME” διεξάγεται  στην Ερμούπολη;

Γιατί  η Ερμούπολη αποτελεί τον ιδανικό χώρο ενός ονειρικού σκηνικού σε χρόνο παρόν! Με την video installation art  [φως, χρώμα, κίνηση] παλαιά, ιστορικά κτίρια γοητεύουν αναπάντεχα τις αισθήσεις του θεατή και ξυπνάνε το βλέμμα μας! Η Ερμούπολη είναι το «σπίτι» για πάρα πολλούς ανθρώπους  από διαφορετικά μέρη, θρησκείες, κοινωνικά υπόβαθρα. Τα κτήριά της λένε ιστορίες εδώ και δεκάδες χρόνια. To “Eye’s Walk digital festival” συνδέει τη μοναδική αρχιτεκτονική κληρονομιά της Σύρου, το δημόσιο χώρο και την κοινότητα του νησιού  με την πιο σύγχρονη τέχνη, τη video installation art. Καλλιτέχνες από όλο τον κόσμο παρουσιάζουν  έργα τους.



H έμπνευση του φετινού Eye’s Walk Digital festival: “Home”.

·  25 Ιουλίου, 21:30

 Εννέα [9] διεθνείς καλλιτέχνες  εμπνέονται από το “HOME”  & δημιουργούν  3d video installations & projection mapping, τα οποία θα προβληθούν σε εξωτερικούς τοίχους νεοκλασικών της Ερμούπολης.

Οι καλλιτέχνες μας:

Αλίκη Αρναούτη [Ελλάδα], Αγγελίνα Βοσκοπούλου[Ελλάδα], Vladimir Necakov [Σερβία], Sophie Leddick [ΗΠΑ], Katy Kavanaugh[Γερμανία], Arjang Omrani [Ιράν], Όλγα Μπρούμα [Ελλάδα], Άγης Κελπέκης [Ελλάδα].

Και ο δημόσιος χώρος της Ερμούπολης ζωντανεύει καθώς ο κόσμος ξεκινάει από την 1η Στάση και αλληλεπιδρά με τα παλιά κτήρια, μαθαίνει τις ιστορίες τους, μπαίνει στα μυστικά τους γίνεται ο ίδιος μέρος του video installation art πάνω σε αυτά.

1η στάση: Θέατρο Απόλλων

2η Στάση:  Λύκειο Ελληνίδων

3η Στάση: Καθολικό Γηροκομείο, Πλατεία Τσιροπινά

4η Στάση: Μέγαρο Ανδρουλή, Οδός Πρωτοπαπαδάκη

Ας ξεκινήσουμε λοιπόν…γιατί Home is Everywhere!









·  25-29 Ιουλίου

Το «Αρχοντικό Βελισσαρόπουλου*» ανοίγει για πρώτη φορά τις πόρτες του και υποδέχεται το art installation «Home?- Το μικρό- μικρό σπίτι» της Ομάδας «Εν Δυνάμει»,  που παρουσιάστηκε για πρώτη φορά στο Μακεδονικό Μουσείο Σύγχρονης Τέχνης της Θεσσαλονίκης [2/2015].

*Το Μέγαρο Βελισσαρόπουλου, τριόροφο νεοκλασσικό, διατηρητέο του 19ου αι. με  μοναδικές τοιχογραφίες και οροφογραφίες είναι έργο της περιόδου ακμής του νεοκλασικισμού στην Ελλάδα.

Γιατί ο τίτλος του φεστιβάλ είναι  “HOME” ;

Τι είναι για εμάς “HOME”;

Σπίτι μπορεί είναι το δέρμα μας, αλλά και ένας αγαπημένος άνθρωπος, Σπίτι είναι η πατρίδα που έχουμε  και αυτή που αφήνουμε, Σπίτι είναι το ασχημόπαπο που γίνεται κύκνος, Σπίτι είναι η οικειότητα του πρωϊνού καφέ, Σπίτι είναι…

“Home” – “When you focus with your soul’s eyes, you will see home in many places.”



Οι καλλιτέχνες που συμμετέχουν διερευνούν μέσω του video installation art την έννοια  “HOME”...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVAnAQrrtpg&feature=youtu.be

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9zlGbQFRxU&feature=youtu.be 



Η ομάδα του Eye’s Walk digital festival αναζητά και αυτή ταυτόχρονα την έννοια του “HOME” στη Σύρο το 2015.

Με το φωτογραφικό project "Inside Out" που παρουσιάζεται στη σελίδα μας στο facebook, διαφορετικοί άνθρωποι της Σύρου ζουν τη δική στους «προσωπική και οικεία» στιγμή σε εξωτερικούς χώρους του νησιού. Πόσο αυθεντικοί είμαστε έξω από τα όρια του «οικείου σπιτιού» , πόσο  χώρο αφήνουμε στο δημόσιο χώρο να αποτελέσει κομμάτι οικείο μας, κομμάτι της καθημερινής μας ιστορίας;

Everywhere is Home, Here, There, Everywhere, Somewhere, Home.






Ποίοιείμαστε:

Founder & Corporate Manager: Φιλία Μηλιδάκη

Multimedia Specialist: Σπύρος Κουδουνάς

Experience Designer & Communication Director: Ειρήνη Τζαβάρα

Administration: Χρήστος Πετκίδης

Production  & Social Media Manager: Ηώ Κυριακάτη

Photographers: Μαρία Μέρκου, Κατερίνα Πρέκα, Μαρία Ριγανιά

Video:Τατιάννα Κασιμάτη

Internships:Μαριάννα Καμπιανάκη, Γιώργος - Λαυτσής Σκρέτας

Volunteers: Βιβέτα Καρποντίνη & προπτυχιακοί φοιτητές, μεταπτυχιακοί φοιτητές του Πανεπιστημίου Αιγαίου, Τμήμα Μηχανικών Σχεδίασης Προϊόντων και Συστημάτων στη Σύρο,  Χριστίνα Καχριμάνη,Βίρνα Νάτση , Ολίνα Κιντζονίδη, Ιωάννα Γιαννούλα, Χρύσα Ζηκούδη.

Γιατί χρειαζόμαστε την υποστήριξή σας.

Είμαστε Καινοτόμοι, θέλουμε να είμαστε και Δυνατοί για να  φτάσουμε στην πλήρη υλοποίηση των φετινών μας στόχων.

·  Δημιουργία του επίσημου δικτυακού τόπου του φεστιβάλ σύμφωνα με τις αρχές της προσβασιμότητας  για να είμαστε κοντά σε όλους χωρίς περιορισμούς, 2.000 ευρώ.

·  Έξοδα διαμονής  και μετακίνησης παραγωγής & καλλιτεχνών στη Σύρο,  400 ευρώ.

·  Δημιουργία making of video της μεγάλης βραδιάς για να μη χάσετε ούτε λεπτό από αυτό που θα συμβεί στην Ερμούπολη, 400 ευρώ.

·  Ολοκλήρωση των εκτυπωτικών μας αναγκών για τη δημιουργία αφισών, χαρτών , banners & επικοινωνιακού υλικού, 500 ευρώ.
story_txt:
“HOME”
                                               “Art in public space is a live experience”
                                                       On July 25-29th 2015
                                              Historical Center of Ermoupoli
                    3D installation & video projection on neoclassical buildings

     Home is love, Home is where our story begins, Home is
where your heart is!Greece experiences a major crisis, however culture does not pause. The team of Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015 - "HOME"* tirelessly prepares with dedication to highlight the beauty of the island of Syros, to bring the neoclassical buildings to life and do something magical using digital art over the canvas of public space.But we do need all the support we can get, and we need your help to complete this project. A small financial contribution would make a huge difference, and that's why we invite you to be part of our effort and part of the "Eye's Walk Digital Festival 2015" experience.
Thank you very much!*=Home is love, Home is everywhere.

But, Why Support Eye's Walk Digital Festival?Becasuse Eye’s Walk Festival was a phenomenon, a surprise of
2014!
With a minimal budget, we managed to become the one
innovative festival in Greece and the Balkans that connect video art, painting,
cinema, architecture and experience design. All of that taking place in the cultural
capital of Cyclades, in the Aegean Sea.

Why
is Eye's Walk digital festival 2015 / HOME held in Ermoupoli?
Because Ermoupoli (Hermoupolis) - the capital of Syros
island - provides the perfect space to accommodate a dreamy set-up.
The light, movement and colors of video installation
art on old, historical buildings of the city trigger the senses unexpectedly
and truly awaken the spectator!
Ermoupoli is “home” for so many people from various
backgrounds (religious, social, national). Its buildings have their own stories
to tell for decades now.
Eye’s Walk Digital Festival connects the unique
architectural legacy of Syros with public space and the community of the
island, through the most modern art, video installation art.The
inspiration behind this year’s Eye’s Walk Digital festival is “Home”.

Σπίτι μπορεί είναι το δέρμα μας,
αλλά και ένας αγαπημένος άνθρωπος, Σπίτι είναι η πατρίδα που έχουμε  και αυτή που αφήνουμε, Σπίτι είναι το
ασχημόπαπο που γίνεται κύκνος, Σπίτι είναι η οικειότητα του πρωϊνού καφέ, Σπίτι
είναι…
“Home” – “When you focus with your soul’s eyes, you will see home in
many places.”Οι
καλλιτέχνες που συμμετέχουν διερευνούν μέσω του video installation art την
έννοια  “HOME”...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WVAnAQrrtpg&feature=youtu.behttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O9zlGbQFRxU&feature=youtu.be Η ομάδα του Eye’s
Walk digital festival αναζητά και αυτή ταυτόχρονα την έννοια του “HOME” στη
Σύρο το 2015.
Με το
φωτογραφικό project "Inside Out" που παρουσιάζεται στη σελίδα μας στο facebook,
διαφορετικοί άνθρωποι της Σύρου ζουν τη δική στους «προσωπική και οικεία»
στιγμή σε εξωτερικούς χώρους του νησιού. Πόσο αυθεντικοί είμαστε έξω από τα
όρια του «οικείου σπιτιού» , πόσο  χώρο
αφήνουμε στο δημόσιο χώρο να αποτελέσει κομμάτι οικείο μας, κομμάτι της
καθημερινής μας ιστορίας;
Everywhere is Home, Here, There, Everywhere,
Somewhere, Home.Ποίοιείμαστε:
Founder & Corporate Manager: Φιλία Μηλιδάκη
Multimedia Specialist: Σπύρος Κουδουνάς
Experience Designer & Communication
Director: Ειρήνη Τζαβάρα
Administration: Χρήστος Πετκίδης
Production  & Social Media Manager: Ηώ Κυριακάτη
Photographers: Μαρία Μέρκου, Κατερίνα Πρέκα, Μαρία Ριγανιά
Video:Τατιάννα Κασιμάτη
Internships:Μαριάννα Καμπιανάκη, Γιώργος - Λαυτσής Σκρέτας
Volunteers: Βιβέτα Καρποντίνη & προπτυχιακοί φοιτητές, μεταπτυχιακοί
φοιτητές του Πανεπιστημίου Αιγαίου, Τμήμα Μηχανικών Σχεδίασης Προϊόντων και
Συστημάτων στη Σύρο,  Χριστίνα
Καχριμάνη,Βίρνα Νάτση , Ολίνα Κιντζονίδη, Ιωάννα Γιαννούλα, Χρύσα Ζηκούδη.
Γιατί
χρειαζόμαστε την υποστήριξή σας.
Είμαστε
Καινοτόμοι, θέλουμε να είμαστε και Δυνατοί για να  φτάσουμε στην πλήρη υλοποίηση των φετινών μας
στόχων.

· 
Δημιουργία του επίσημου δικτυακού
τόπου του φεστιβάλ σύμφωνα με τις αρχές της προσβασιμότητας  για να είμαστε κοντά σε όλους χωρίς
περιορισμούς, 2.000 ευρώ.
· 
Έξοδα διαμονής  και μετακίνησης παραγωγής & καλλιτεχνών
στη Σύρο, 
400 ευρώ.
· 
Δημιουργία making of video της
μεγάλης βραδιάς για να μη χάσετε ούτε λεπτό από αυτό που θα συμβεί στην
Ερμούπολη, 400 ευρώ.
· 
Ολοκλήρωση των εκτυπωτικών μας αναγκών
για τη δημιουργία αφισών, χαρτών , banners & επικοινωνιακού υλικού, 500
ευρώ.

story:
Amarant Design Collective

Amarant Design Collective is a Detroit-based installation art organization that invites people to experience familiar spaces in new and unexpected ways.

Following a successful inaugural year, Amarant is looking forward to finding news spaces and new collaborators in 2016.

Our first project of the year will take place at the Howell Opera House in Howell, Michigan.  The Opera House was built in 1881 and was an active performance venue for 46 years.  It currently serves the community as the home of the Livingston Arts Council, which hosts a full season of arts events.

LIGHT will be Amarant's second project in this magnificent space.  Last year’s project, RED, served as the backdrop for concerts and arts events in the opera house.  This year we hope to invite artists and performers - dancers, musicians, actors - to respond to the historic theatre as experienced through our installation.  Their response to the space will merge with ours making the audience and the performers the central focus of the art piece - and, in doing so, bring performance back to a venue that has been dark for 90 years.


Our Goal!

With your help, our goal is to cover the material and production costs of the Installation.  Thus far, we have been self-funded and our work has been built out of found or recycled materials.  The funds raised in this campaign will allow us to expand the range of materials we use and allow us to invest in reusable technology for this and future projects.

Your contributions will help cover the following:
   •   Materials for the installation
   •   Transportation of crew members to and from Howell during the load-in and installation process
   •   Per diem for our installation crew during load-in and installation
   •   Printing publicity materials

Our projects usually cost between $1000-$1500 for all the items listed above. We are asking for $3000 from this campaign so that we can make this our most ambitious, collaborative and inclusive project yet.

Even if we do not reach our goal, every dollar truly does help. We are artists who love to explore the world and how art can affect our daily lives. This is our goal and commitment: we will keep making art and we invite you to come along for the adventure!

Thank you everyone for coming to the Opening Gala! We really appreciate your support. If you cannot support us financially please spread the word: Facebook, Instagram, Email, share our work with family and friends! Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

Help Get Sal Garcia's Art to NYC by June! Greetings!  I am Sal Garcia, an artist in the San Francisco Bay Area raising funds for a solo gallery exhibition in New York City.  A gallery has offered me a show that will open in late June in SoHo NYC.  I am excited about this opportunity to share my work with a New York audience but the gallery does not pay for shipping.  I spent most of my career doing community based work, so the opportunity to show in a New York gallery is big and wonderful…. but the cost of shipping the work is daunting.  Please support my campaign to get this unique body of work to New York City!

What is this about blue jaguars?  I am a California artist with strong connections to the San Francisco art community and a history of activism.  Many of my paintings contain images that draw on the Chicano experience, pre-Columbian cosmology, and shamanic visions.  The Jaguar is a shamanic symbol in various cultures, and in pre-Columbian culture blue is the color of the sacred.  I have included blue jaguars and other magical creatures in many of my paintings for the last twenty years.  I want to bring some of these creatures to New York and set them loose!  

New works on paper!   I am also very excited to let you know that I will show a number of works on paper including prints and collages in New York. I will share a number of newer abstract collages in New York that are meditations on color and composition. Some people have seen these in the studio but this is the first time that they will be exhibited publicly. I will also show some other new pieces such as "Rolling the Bones" a fantastic collage piece full of skeletons, fire, and luck and some screen prints such as "Three Seeds for Your Birthday" featuring a poem by San Francisco Poet Laureate Alejandro Murguia.

Who Is this Sal Garcia guy?  I have been making art since I was a child.   I grew up in the Central Valley of California and was introduced to art at a very young age by people who took an interest.  I was mentored by a number of very early Chicano artists, studied art at the California State University and also had the opportunity to study at the Taller Siquieros, the art school in Mexico founded by the great Mexican muralist.  I have been blessed with some success and my work is in a number of museums and private collections including that of Carlos Santana.

My youth coincided with the Civil Rights Movement and the Chicano Rights Movement and I was very active as a young artist working with art groups that would produce posters, murals, logos, screen prints, banners, and t-shirts for non-profits, marches, and the community at large. I made art to support Cesar Chavez's United Farm Workers and logos and posters for many community organizations such as Radio Bilingue which today operates across the Southwestern United States.  I worked on staff at Galeria de la Raza, a premier community art gallery in San Francisco's Mission District for nine years.  

My work has been inextricably linked to my community and my experience but I do not feel that it should be in any "box": my vision is global and my art is transcendental. My painting, works on paper, sculpture, and even my wearable art, such as my amulets, come from a place whose inspiration is universal.  They contain color, light, and movement and have a special energy. I hope you can see some of that in the images I have loaded onto this site. 

Art is meant to communicate, to inspire, to be seen. Art is not useful packed away in a studio.  I have shown my work across California and have participated in national and international group exhibitions.  I have had solo exhibitions in California where thousands of people have been able to see large numbers of my pieces together.  However, this would be my first opportunity to have a solo show in New York City.  Please help make it happen!


What We Need & What You Get

My Indiegogo campaign will make this art show happen!  The gallery where I will be showing does not cover shipping and framing of the art work … and unfortunately shipping and framing art is quite costly.  This Indiegogo campaign will allow the show to go forward by providing the funds to actually move the art from the San Francisco Bay Area to New York and back.  It will also cover the framing of from 12-20 of the new works on paper.  Finally, it will cover my travel costs so that I can support the installation of the show and attend the opening celebration. We have received bids from a number of art shipping companies that will professionally wrap and move the work from the San Francisco Bay Area to New York City and back.  We have also scoped out the costs of exhibition framing for the works on paper.  Our budget includes the following rough elements:

BUDGET

  • $7,800. Packing and shipping the art via a professional art moving company from San Francisco, to New York City, and back  
  • $3,200. Framing of up to 20 art works on paper
  • $1,500.  Ticket to New York and Lodging

Total budget:  $12,500. 

STRETCH BUDGET

If we can raise $12,500, a fairly large show of my work will go forward, but I would be thrilled if we could exceed that. I have a stretch budget in mind which, if we can exceed our goal, would allow me to make some giclee prints of the new collage work on acid free paper that would be available at reasonable prices at the gallery.  

  •  $4,000 giclee prints

TOTAL STRETCH BUDGET BEYOND GOAL:  $16,500

If we do not achieve our full budget of $12,500, funds will still go towards the show, but the show will be smaller.  We will shift gears and send a much smaller amount of work to New York City,  and show fewer of the collages that require framing.  

Join Us!!!   We hope you will join us in bringing this special work to NYC.  We have some great thank you gifts if you can join us. And when we make our Indiegogo goal, we hope you will attend the opening!! 

Fantastic Thank You Gifts!!!  Cards, Prints, Spirit Bags, Blue Jaguars!

We have already prepared some wonderful thank you gifts for those of you who are able to join us in bring the blue jaguar(s) to New York City.  We are excited to share these items with our supporters. 

For donating any amount:  I am grateful!  You receive our sincere thanks and your name on an acknowledgement poster on the gallery wall at the opening of the show.

$25 up to $50:  I am touched and thankful!!  You receive three blank greeting cards featuring images of my work with my signature on them.

$50 up to $100:  I amazed at your generosity! You receive a pack of three blank greeting cards featuring my work and one signed digital color print of my collage work (there are two to choose from "Frida" or "Our Lady of the Butterflies"). 

$100 up to $250:  I am so thankful that I want to give you something delicious! You receive both of the signed digital color prints of my collage work ("Frida" and "Our Lady of the Butterflies") and a copy of my secret molé recipe so that you can make some magic in your own kitchen! 

$250 up to $450: That is so wonderful!  You will receive a pack of a dozen blank greeting cards featuring my work, two signed digital color prints of my collage work ("Frida" and "Our Lady of the Butterflies") and a copy of my secret molé recipe so that you can make some magic in your own kitchen while writing out cards to your best friends telling them about the show!


$450 up to $1,000: My gratitude is overflowing.  You will receive a limited edition 13 color silk screen print entitled “Jaguar with 2 Dragons".  This from an edition of 100 and printed on italian paper. This is a fantastic print suitable for a special place in your home.  A blue jaguar holds a heart that radiates power while the feathered serpents or 'dragons' encircle it and flames and incantations pour forth.  You will love this!

$1,000 or more:  I am overwhelmed with gratitude.  You will receive a hand made beaded “spirit pouch.” These are similar to the amulets that I make for Carlos Santana. Carlos commissioned several pieces that are similar to these (but more elaborate) for his recent HBO special “Corazon”.  These are petite squares of leather stitched to form a pouch and covered on one side with beads and embellished on the second side where the pouch is secured by a small flap (see the photo below, the one with the round button is the back side of a spirit bag while the other pieces in the photo show the beaded fronts).  Many of them have a hand carved zuni fetish, representative of animal spirits, at the center.

The Impact

Our campaign is not just about bringing more art to New York City, it is about bringing a unique body of work by a Chicano artist to New York City.  At a time when we need dialogue, healing, and magic in our lives, the door is still closed to many artists and the beautiful work they have to share.  I have been fortunate to have people see my work in some parts of the country but have only shown a small number of pieces in group shows in New York over the years.  I believe that by reaching a new audience in New York, my work will become more visible and I will be more likely to reach a national audience.  

I have done a number of solo shows in California and they have been very successful with many people attending, excellent press, and openings that were celebrations of art and community.  My dream is that something similar will happen in New York.

I hope you can be part of this campaign and that you can see my work In New York City!

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges to this project revolve around the short timeline.  The time from the conclusion of the Indiegogo campaign to the date the work needs to be shipped to NYC is short.  I will need to frame the works on paper in that time to be shipped to NYC.  Shipping via professional art moving companies also requires that the art leave California a number of weeks in advance.  I have done the background research and set up framer and shipping company. However, if the budget is not fully achieved, we will have to modify our plans and ship a smaller show to New York.  I have a great deal of experience working with galleries and museums and, though the timing will be tight, I am confident that I can make the timeline work however the campaign turns out.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate that is okay.  It would be great if you could let others know.  You can post this on Facebook or on other social media.  And you can use the Indiegogo share tools to help me get the word out.  

Thank you for your support!  On to the BIG APPLE!!!

story:
In 2013 we had a vision: to create a handmade, homegrown lantern festival, and to convince the rest of Prince Edward County they should join us! Guess what? We’ve succeeded in creating a truly beautiful community festival in which everyone can – and does - participate. The Firelight Lantern Festival has doubled in size every year; in the last 3 years we have taught 900 people how to make their own handmade paper lanterns, and we’ve been dazzled by the enthusiastic crowds who have come together to parade through the streets and dance the night away.

Meet your festival co-directors:

Krista Dalby is a playwright, director and producer; recent productions include 'The Tale of a Town: Prince Edward County', 'Unjustly', 'The Monster of Lake on the Mountain', and 'The History of Shadows'. She is the co-director of the Firelight Lantern Festival and Board Member of the Prince Edward County Arts Council. Her pride and joy is Small Pond Arts, an art farm that hosts artists in residence, her husband Milé Murtanovski’s art gallery, and many joyous creative events, including the annual Scarecrow Festival.

Susanne Larner is a Prince Edward County native who draws inspiration for her paintings and creative projects from her idyllic surroundings. Growing up rurally, her creative family gave her the encouragement to study visual art in Toronto and Vancouver where she discovered a love of mixed media and the playfulness of craft. Returning to her rural roots, Susanne brought with her a passion for creative event-building, art education and fusing fine art with craft. She is co-director of the Firelight Lantern Festival, a founding member of the Picton Comix Jam, a participant in local art shows, and a volunteer artist with Puppets Without Borders.

What we’ve got up our sleeve

Starting in October 2016, we'll be touring the County with our mobile lantern-making workshops, and working hard to create a stunning festival on November 12. Join us for our lantern parade, music from the fabulous Dave Clark & the Woodshed Orchestra, a special performance from Electric Hoopster, and lots of surprises created just for you! As always, we offer our workshops and admission to our festival at a very minimal cost in order to remain accessible to all.

Why we need your help

This is our first crowdfunding campaign. In the past we’ve been successful at securing substantial funding from a provincial organization. This year we didn’t receive this grant, simply because it is an extremely competitive program to which only 1 in 3 applicants is successful. However, we do have a small amount of funding already in place, and we are determined to create another beautiful, magical festival for our community.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $7500. We have trimmed expenses wherever we can (artists are really good at pinching pennies!), and this amount represents approximately half of this year’s budget.

We’re thrilled that our community has stepped up with their support, and we're able to offer you so many awesome perks to choose from in exchange for your donation!

The Impact

This is the only festival of its kind in Prince Edward County, and we want to keep it going! So many participants have told us how much the festival means to them. Here’s what a few of them had to say:

“We had so much fun participating in your Firelight Lantern Festival! We came to your final workshop at the town hall and instantly loved the atmosphere - no grumpy people do this kind of stuff - just friendly faces of all ages working away, loving all the colours and glue and stuff… We told our friends and neighbours about you two and the workshops and the procession and the goings-on at the Crystal Palace... What a wonderful community event you've created - thank you SO much for all that you give to make it happen. We are truly appreciative beneficiaries of your generosity.”

“It was magical! Your vision inspired our entire community!”

“So GOOD!! Thanks so much, we are beyond grateful.”

“It was magical, spectacular and so lovely!!!”

“Magical, heartfelt, exhilarating and beautifully surreal. Plus I danced my ass off! Thank you for letting us into your imagination.”

“It was great fun participating in the Lantern Parade and Shadow Puppet Production ... thanks to all those Creative Lantern Makers ... what a whimsical evening for little folk and big folk too!!!”

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial donation at this time, you can help by sharing our campaign on social media.

You can also contact us if you are interested in volunteering; we have many opportunities available both prior to and during the festival: krista@smallpondarts.ca
story_txt:
In 2013 we had a vision: to create a handmade, homegrown lantern festival, and to convince the rest of Prince Edward County they should join us! Guess what? We’ve succeeded in creating a truly beautiful community festival in which everyone can – and does - participate. The Firelight Lantern Festival has doubled in size every year; in the last 3 years we have taught 900 people how to make their own handmade paper lanterns, and we’ve been dazzled by the enthusiastic crowds who have come together to parade through the streets and dance the night away.
Meet your festival co-directors: 
Krista Dalby is a playwright, director and producer; recent productions include 'The Tale of a Town: Prince Edward County', 'Unjustly', 'The Monster of Lake on the Mountain', and 'The History of Shadows'. She is the co-director of the Firelight Lantern Festival and Board Member of the Prince Edward County Arts Council. Her pride and joy is Small Pond Arts, an art farm that hosts artists in residence, her husband Milé Murtanovski’s art gallery, and many joyous creative events, including the annual Scarecrow Festival.
Susanne Larner is a Prince Edward County native who draws inspiration for her paintings and creative projects from her idyllic surroundings. Growing up rurally, her creative family gave her the encouragement to study visual art in Toronto and Vancouver where she discovered a love of mixed media and the playfulness of craft. Returning to her rural roots, Susanne brought with her a passion for creative event-building, art education and fusing fine art with craft. story:
What's Perphone?

Perphone is a fashion and fragrance accessory, designed around the only object that we carry always: our smartphones. Not only is it fashionable, but it also comes to one’s rescue in daily situations.

Perphone is the perfect gadget- it can be paired and matched with whatever you are wearing, can be used by everyone in all situations, and it is ideal whenever a quick refreshment is needed before a business meeting, a date, when traveling, or simply to regain a comfortable feeling. We all need to be continuously refreshed throughout the day, every day.

We aim to replace the old-fashioned, rarely used 2-ml. testers we are given by famous brands with our new containers. They are small, light, and attached to your phone, which ensures that they will always be with you when needed. Moreover, they give a new look to the smartphones, with a large variety of colors and designs. Most people already buy covers and casings to protect and accessorize their smartphones- why not buy one that is practical as well as fashionable?

The Patent

We registered a patent in Germany and filed an international application with the Patent Cooperation Treaty (aka PCT) back in 2011 (see below), to protect our idea and its investors, as well as to reserve potential developments of it in other fields of applications that we are yet studying, like self defense with pepper spray, bad breath remedies, etc.

PCT-EP2011-063741 – German Patent Office DEGD-112092.9

Market

We have already been testing Perphone with renowned luxury and fashion brands in Milan, Paris, Düsseldorf, etc. We were delighted to witness their initial surprise, pleasure, and interest while trying out the product and going through a brain storming on its potential application fields. One of the most recurring questions was, “How did you guys come up with that?”

Why you need it…

The most striking thing about Perphone is its simple necessity. While going about your day, be it at work or university, after a meal, or moving from place to place running errands, don’t you ever feel the need to get refreshed? What if you feel the need to refresh yourself before an important meeting or date, and you don’t have time, or you forgot your perfume or breath freshener? What if you have a small purse, or simply don’t want to carry around a bulky, heavy perfume bottle? What if you are traveling and cannot carry liquids with you? Not only can Perphone refresh you throughout the flight, but you can also carry enough small, light refill containers for the entirety of your trip! And since the liquid is contained in your phone cover, you will always have it with you!

Project's Current Status and Next Steps:

We are working extensively on the designs while testing our prototypes. We aim to release 10-ml. containers. Our next step will be developing the PVC (full product) and Carbon Fiber (cases only).

The already- defined prototypes will reach the market this April, if we are able to complete the tooling process and packaging on time.

 

 

What we need the money for?

Tooling and packaging are the most expensive stages. We need help in building the molds for the product parts and the different packages we have enlisted in our catalogue and on the offered perks options.

About Us

Maria Del Padre is our Product Manager. She has experience in the fashion industry, and ran a wide "demand campaign" from which we received exciting results. She is responsible for market segmentation, and, together with our designer, they are actively looking into a 360 exploitation of our patents.

Our designer, Sergio Mattia, is currently residing in Italy. He has been working with 3D CAD/CAM software for about 20 years, and enjoys playing the guitar. His motto is “if after a good glass of red wine, and a homemade “antipasto” (appetizer), you still think the same, stop thinking (finish your wine) and make it real!”

Sergio Milstein is an organized computer freak with a passion for smartphones. His family is comprised of IT folks, with roots in both the former USSR and Italy. He is an extensive shopper in all northern and central Italian outlets. He is creative, innovative, and comes up with brilliant new ideas every day.

Kirill Kapranov is a young, talented, Moscow-born PR and Sales Manager that received his secondary education at Munich International School, and has studied at the university-level at Sciences Po Paris in France, as well as in the Middle East. He is an extensive traveler who speaks English, Russian, German, French, and Arabic, and is focusing on our sales pipeline execution.

We would like to thank everyone who has helped us! Our virtual team is quite large, young, experienced, and altogether is fluent in 6 languages (English, Italian, German, French, Russian, Arabic), because we understand the importance of communication, and wish our product to succeed internationally.

Risks and Challenges

-financial capacity vs. high demand
-potential delay in production

story:
The contemporary artist Tatsuo Miyajima internationally renowned for his works adopting the LED digital counters will be producing “Sea of Time in Tohoku” for the repose of souls of victims from the Great East Japan Earthquake. We are calling out for supporters from around the world to lay the foundation for this project that will continue to be produced for 10 years.

Miyajima will be installing his major work with 3000 LED gadgets flashing in a giant pool at a corner of the Oshika Peninsula located in Ishinomaki City, Miyagi facing the Pacific Ocean to "repose of the victims" and "commemorate an unprecedented disaster" of the Great East Japan Earthquake for posterity.

I knew immediately I had to do something when the Great East Japan Earthquake hit.

First I began on the second day since the earthquake by suggesting TV Asahi to turn off the lights of my work "Counter Void" (on the wall of　the TV　Asahi Corporation building) installed as a Public Art at Roppongi Hills, Tokyo. I assume people have once seen the giant wall of light with digital numbers counting from 9 to 1.

On the fourth day post the earthquake, I went to the Tohoku University of Art and Design (Yamagata) where I served as the Vice President at the time, to encourage the students. After this I engaged in activities such as removing mud in Ishinomaki  as a volunteer, and participating in the AAFJ (a fund-raising project supported through selling drawings) hosted by the students and alumnus of the university by drawing pictures myself.

Ishinomaki City (2011)

The "Counter Void" in Roppongi has since then been turned off with the purpose of the repose, and after 5 years from the earthquake it had been relighted as the "Relight Project" for 3 days beginning from March 11th, 2016 to prevent the fading of memories and to have the young generations who have never seen the work know about the project.


"Counter Void" (Roppongi Hills, TV Asahi) Taken on March 11th, 2016 for the relighting.

To this day I have held exhibitions in more than 260 sites in 30 countries, with over 70 museums with my works in their collection. But the fundamental idea I have in myself is that above anything, art should be shared for "people who live the present time" and moreover "exists for the people."

The "Sea of Time" with counting LED gadgets spread all over is my debuting work from 1988.

The numbers count from 9 to 1, and without the 0, it starts over counting from 9 to 1. The time being counted represents "life" and the time of darkness "death," showing the "life" and "death" repeating eternally.

Setting the time of LEDs (Pre-exhibition, 2016)
Model of “Sea of Time in Tohoku” (Pre-exhibition, 2016)

In Buddhism this is regarded as Reincarnation, which teaches the eternity of life. "Death" is not the end of a life, but a part shown together with "life" which is the preparatory period of the next "life."

Again, the counting speed is set individually for each gadget in my work, showing the individuality of each life.

Post the disaster I have decided to produce my new work “Sea of Time in Tohoku” at an appropriate site for the "repose of victims" as well as to "remember Tohoku" and to "remember the unprecedented disaster."

This was when Mr. Koichi Watari of the WATARI-UM invited me to participate in the "Reborn-Art Festival" in Ishinomaki.

Ishinomaki City, around the Oshika Peninsula (Provided by: Google map)

This is a "Festival" being held at Oshika Peninsula as the main venue with the cooperation of Miyagi prefecture and Ishinomaki City, having the musician Takeshi Kobayashi (Managing Director of ap bank) as the chairperson of the production committee, and the anthropologist Shinichi Nakazawa and film director Shunji Iwai as production committee members.

Information of the Reborn-Art Festival
July 22nd (Sat) - September 10th (Sun), 2017
http://www.reborn-art-fes.jp/

I have visited Ishinomaki several times since 2015, walking and interviewing in person: "What do you think about artists making work here?" and "How are victims of the disaster feeling right now?"

As a result this outlined the reality of the people trying to move forward, and at the same time their wish not to be forgotten. And to my surprise I did not encounter any person who detested the ocean that deprived them of everything. This experience reenforced my decision to produce “Sea of Time in Tohoku.”

The concept of “Sea of Time in Tohoku” is to be completed with placing 3000 LED gadgets in a giant pool scaling 30m x 50m. To do so, this project would cost a hundred millions altogether, with which would surpass the supporting fund by the festival and Miyajima's personal funding invested together.
Here we call out for supporters through crowdfunding with the aim of 300 LED lights which is 1/10 of the project as a beginning for this year, and seek to complete the project in 10 years by adding the number of LED lights each year. We would like to broadly collect supporters through this crowdfunding for production as "Support Artists."

Venue in Oshika Peninsula planned to install the project (Photo by Tatsuo Miyajima, 2015) 

As a matter of fact, this crowdfunding holds an important meaning.
First of all, by widely calling out for funds, we can have a large number of people recognize the intent of this project, and turn their attention to Tohoku. Each LED gadget can be produced with 10,000 JPY so I would like to have each funder find their chance to actually visit Oshika Peninsula as participants of the work production as "Support Artists." 

For the victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake in Tohoku, I will have each person set their timing of the LED lights to have them leave their "light of life" to their loved ones.

This means that each LED gadget would be coupled as a pair by the victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake in Tohoku who will set the time of "life and death," and the "Support Artists" who have supported through crowdfunding that undertakes the production cost.

I am planning to continually upload these couplings and the thoughts of the victims and supporters on the website.
※　Here is the open advertisement for the victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake in Tohoku. Applications are accepted till the end of May.

There is a long way ahead to complete this project, and the fund for elements other than the LED such as the construction costs of the giant pool is necessary, so I hope to collect the support of as many people as possible.

Sketch for "Sea of Time"

Moreover, there are usually appropriate rewards for participants of funding, and for this project with the aspect of funding itself being an "art expression," people who have become "Support Artists" would be issued a "Certificate" with Tatsuo Miyajima's autograph to verify the person is a collaborative artist of "Sea of Time."

Sample of "Certificate" (For the "Sea of Time '98" produced in Naoshima)

The 6th year since the disaster in 2017 may be where we can consider to draw a line  as the year in which the Buddhist memorial is held as the sixth anniversary of one's death. It is also a milestone marking three decades since I have first announced the concept of "Sea of Time."

I hope to install “Sea of Time in Tohoku” in Oshika Peninsula facing that ocean as a kind of topos. I wish for the approval and participation of everyone from the bottom of my heart.

January 2017
Tatsuo Miyajima

Risks & Challenges

* The production of “Sea of Time in Tohoku” is planned to proceed little by little over several years. This is the challenge of this project, but please note that the completion would take time.
* Supporters are responsible for their own transportation fee to visit Tohoku to give aid or appreciate works.
* In regard of copyright license, please participate upon approving the reprinting and publishing of messages and photo involved in this project.
 

For victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake


Victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake may participate in this project as "Collaboration Artists." Participants will take part by setting the time of the LED gadget produced with the support of crowdfunding, and leaving their "light of life" for love ones. Please see the enrollment form here. Applications are accepted till the end of May.

* Participation in the time setting may be made from people living anywhere at the present.
* Participation in the time setting for LED gadgets by victims of the Great East Japan Earthquake may be made without supporting the crowdfunding.

story:
Pilot episode based on the "New York Effect" blog by Juan L. Rivera.

The series tells the story of Juan who recently moved to NY and his neverending search for love in the city that never sleeps! Between his friends, random hookups, and his drag inner diva, the search for companionship is easier said than done. 

This story will boost the hispanic gay presence in the media and will definitely give a glimpse of what the gay latino community is like in Upper Manhattan. We need more diversity in the press and education is vital for the communities to increase acceptance within the hispanic community.

story:
Short Summary

The efforts to bring Pedal Powered Bumper Cars to the Playa are at full speed. Our crack team of fungi-neers have been designing and constructing a fleet of six stylized, pimped out, bumper cars for races at our arena.

We have in the past been located on the Esplanade and hope to get PRIME real estate this year - WE ARE part of RED NOSE DISTRICT!

Our team has been bringing MAJOR Art and entertainment to the playa for 16 years!!! 

As you know, projects that benefit everyone cost money! We are efficient and we know how to make things happen on a shoestring budget! But we need your help! PLEASE DONATE!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will cover the cost of the six "public" bumper cars which includes the base pedal carts, the constructed bumpers and an original design to make each car unique. This fleet will reside at our installation for open hours of hosted hilarity for all to enjoy (first come first serve...)

We also need enough funds for materials to build the Arena (a 60‘x90’ circus tent with a wooden plywood track with guard rails) and transport everything from LA to BRC and back! (it takes a big truck to haul all of this!).

Beyond the six ready made cars, we will offer the open source instructions for you DIY maniacs who wish to build your own personal car to decorate to your heart's desire.

Note: Your personally built cars will be welcomed to our installation during public race times provided they meet the bumper requirements set forth in the easy to follow design. 

The Impact

By donating to our research, design and construction project you will be part of a first time, interactive project of this nature: Never before has there been a bumper car installation on the Playa (that we know of...) Sanctioned, safe (?) CRASHING, BUMPING, SMASHING, THRASHING and many other 'ings! PEDAL to the METAL! 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is a community-based project, the blueprints to build your own PedalBump will be online, we want to promote free redistribution and access to the Pedalbump design.

Even if you cannot donate, help us spread the word to those who might! 

LIKE US ON FACEBOOK! stay updated regarding our R&D process and feel free to comment and contribute on the design!

story:
A Black and White TV Pin?

I'm an artist and I also make things like pins, buttons, stickers, and patches. One day, I bought a black-and-white tv at the thrift store and plugged it into my first-generation Roku player. Netflix totally worked and I was able to stream "The Twilight Zone". So, I tweeted about it and it kind of went viral.

I plugged my black and white tv into an old Roku. pic.twitter.com/YHDiUiGXD6

— Ellingson (@ellingson) June 19, 2019

Above: My actual 1975 General Electric model 12XB9104V TV

It's a handsome television so, naturally, I decided to make a lapel pin of my 1975 General Electric model 12XB9104V TV. However, it couldn't be just any old General Electric Model 12XB9104V hard-enamel pin. No, this TV pin GLOWS IN THE DARK!

Also, I'm working with Factory Two, (a great maker-space in Flint, Michigan) to print clear vinyl stickers so that the image on the screen can change to one of several different options. The clear stickers stick on top of the glow-in-the-dark enamel to light up the image after it's exposed to light. Right now, I have a small batch of the TV pins ready to go, but I need your help with production costs for the packaging, sticker packs, and shipping supplies. I'd also like to pay for another run of pins and stickers so that they can be available to everyone.

What's The Plan?

I hope to raise at least $500 to cover the cost of the current batch of TV pins, another run, stick-on screen decals, clever packaging, and shipping supplies. The perks are thus:

  • TV Pin With Sticker Pack
    This is the standard set that I've been excited about offering. You get the glow-in-the-dark TV pin with the stick-on screen decals in clever packaging, mailed to your door in packaging that you helped fund!
     
  • TV Pin 2-Pack (save $2)
    You love this idea so much that you want to share it with a friend! You get two sets of TV pins w/sticker packs, the clever packaging, and the little padded mailer that you helped to fund with your contribution!
     

  • New! TV Pin 3-Pack (save $3)
    You get three sets of TV Pins w/stick-on screen stickers for five dollars less!

  • New! 7 TV Pins
    This pack is perfect if you want a dedicated TV pin for each of the sticker designs. You get seven pin sets w/sticker packs. You're a completist, you have loads of space on your denim battle vest. You can't get enough GLOW.

  • Donation only 
    You don't need more pins but you want to help by keeping me caffeinated and crazy with coffee money.

 

This is a flexible campaign and all funds will go one-way-or-another to getting these pins into your hands, regardless of whether or not the $500 goal is met. Please don't make me put this on my credit card. I already have too many frequent flyer miles.

Want To Make Your Own?

It's inevitable that this design is going to get bootlegged, so they might as well have the right artwork. Here's a link to a scalable SVG vector file so you can print the artwork as large as you like. I recommend making a cardboard cut-out and putting it in front of your microwave. The popcorn channel is the best channel.

Binging my favorite show. pic.twitter.com/BcwXVGcePW

— Ellingson (@ellingson) July 24, 2019

 

Thank You

Your support means a lot to me. I love making things and sharing what I've learned with the world. I tweet, 'gram, blog post, and talk people's ears off about random things that I find fascinating and/or absurd. If you value this kind of enthusiasm, please consider supporting the artwork that's fueled by it. Did I think I'd be making an enamel pin of my thrift store television this year? No, but look! It happened! Let's make it as interesting as possible. Thanks again.

Website
http://ellingson.cc

Instagram
Personal posts at @ellngsn
Portfolio posts at @ellingson.cc

Twitter @ellingson

story:
Delivering ice cold drinks & snacks to artists out in open playa pre-event.  (No booze, just hydration).  Hot coffee, cocoa & soup at night.  Plus cool water misters to refresh artists.

Artists at Burning Man work long days in blazing heat & high winds, often without shade.  Dehydration & sun exhaustion is common.  This is after months of hard work to get the art to the dessert. They often don’t have time to set up camp, make meals, sleep enough, etc.

Then we appear with ice cold juice, water & tasty snacks.  Or hot coffee & food at night when they’re exhausted, but need to keep going…

Fund Art H2O and YOU bring this support to the artists.

This project started after several artists from my camp went to the ER for IV hydration and spent the first days of Burning Man sick in their tents from working in extreme conditions.  Let’s prevent that & help our artists.  

Any contribution is welcome.  $5 buys 5 gallons of water.  $6 = 2 bags of ice.  $10 buys oranges, snacks & water for a group of artists...

Come find us on playa to donate bottled water & Gatorade too.  Check playa info for Art H2O.

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD about ART H2O

Please forward this.  Art H2O is special because we focus on serving drinks as well as food.  There are only a couple of projects serving food to artists, but there are over 300 art projects in open playa.  Your contribution WILL make a difference.  

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

(yes, this is what I wanted to say in my video, but I have far too many nerves while on camera)

Hello everyone! Greetings from Berlin, I hope that everyone is happy and healthy in the new year! I’m speaking to you through the magic of the internet because I’m excited to share one of my current projects, titled “The way is not in the sky.”  This is a solo exhibition at Mila Kunstgalerie here in Berlin, and it opens on June 20th. This will be my first solo show in Europe, and it’s especially exciting that it’s taking place in Berlin, where I am working hard to establish myself in the art scene. If you know my artwork, you know that it’s labor-intensive and materially expensive. The gallery consists of two rooms, which you can see here behind me, for which I plan to make installations that consist of floor pieces made from both contact paper and carpet squares, and video projections on painted walls – with possible added architectural elements. I am very grateful for this enormous opportunity, and I want to make the most of it. Which is why I’m asking you to also become involved and support me and my project, support my first real entry into the Berlin art scene, and help me establish myself here while still remaining close to my roots and my wonderful community abroad. More details about me, my background, my project, and how you can get involved are available below. I look forward to working with you and staying in touch about the development of this project and my new life in Berlin...


More Details...

So most of you know me, but for those of you who are meeting me now for the first time, I am an artist (and teacher, gardener, cat mom) who, after spending eight wonderful years in Minneapolis, recently relocated to Berlin to follow my dreams to live in Europe. My artistic practice is site-specific, often taking into account both the architectural details of the site and its history, and create opportunities for the viewer to be truly present in the moment and in that space. More about my practice can be read further below and on my website. Berlin is an incredibly exciting place for me to continue my research and to locate my artwork, as both the history and the architectural landscape here speak to my interests and intentions.

As I briefly mentioned in the video, my campaign is in support of my first solo exhibition in Berlin at Mila Kunstgalerie, which opens on June 20th of this year. This project is large-scale, transforming the two rooms of the gallery with floor works and video projections, therefore requiring a considerable amount of material (including, but not limited to: contact paper, carpet tiles, paint, and other building materials) and dedicated studio time, as my work is very slow and precise. The concepts will be in line with the work I produced last year, revolving around the relationships between our selves and our environment, the exchanges between the body and the mind, and the tensions between real and perceived time. Please see samples of my recent floor installations by clicking the "Gallery" tab above.

This campaign is important to me because I want to make the absolute most of this opportunity and use this show to help establish myself in the Berlin art scene, which will lead to a sustainable life and studio practice in Berlin. Alone, I do not have the resources to make this exhibition exactly as I imagine it to be, and conversely, it would be a very difficult situation if I were not able to live up to the occasion – for myself and for those who are offering the show, as I am building a reputation through my artwork and my actions. With a successful solo show in Berlin, I will be able to gain new exhibition opportunities, forge new relationships with curators and collectors, and build new contacts for employment.

I have always been a hard worker, juggling my artistic practice with teaching and my various other jobs and activities, while also trying to participate in and support my community. Continuing this pace in Berlin is a challenge that I take on voluntarily and gladly, but it is nevertheless proving to be a task that requires me to reach out to my community to assist me in a moment when the timing and scope of my artistic opportunities have gone beyond my individual means during this period of transition. Some of you are familiar with an earlier campaign that I launched before my artist residency in Bad Ems, which I was thankful to be able to cancel because of a generous and unexpected last-minute grant.

This is a different time and a different set of circumstances; even more crucial, I would say, as it truly is my chance to establish a long-term place for myself and my practice here in Berlin. It would sincerely mean a lot to me to be able to create this project with your participation and support, as I do feel that it is because of all of you - my friends, family, and colleagues - that I have achieved what I have and am on this incredible path, personally and professionally, in Berlin today.


What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise a minimum of $4000 for this project. Here's a break-down of expenses that comprise my Goal:

Materials (contact paper, carpet squares, paint & building supplies, 2 DVD players, etc) = $2500

Studio Time (to compensate for my inability to work a second job, especially during installation, as I still have to feed myself and pay bills) = $700

Other expenses (such as public transportation to research materials & concepts, needing to have something made, etc) = $400

Cost of making & sending Perks = $400

Expenses after reaching Goal:

Amount after fees to indiegogo = approx. $3720

$3720 equals approx. 2723 Euro

If I don’t reach my entire goal, I will still use the funds towards the project, and will continue to search for other ways to raise or borrow money.

What you get: PERKS!

See the selection of Perks (located on the right) ranging from digital images, to actual pieces of the project in Berlin, to a catalog of my floor pieces produced while at the Balmoral Residency.

Corporate sponsorship is welcome! If your company is interested in supporting my project, I would be happy to mention the sponsorship in press materials and on my website - the more support, the more ways I can advertise your company... I won't get a tattoo with your logo, but I am sure we can work out something reasonable.


The Impact

We all want to see each other succeed – when one of us is lifted up, we are all lifted up. I also know that you all feel the importance of the arts in our society, while, as you also know, support for the arts and for individual artists is in decline. My feeling is that, when we can, we all want to pay it forward – since we all have moments when we can give and moments when we need support. Your involvement is not just in this one exhibition, but it’s part of the larger, ongoing ways that we have been connected personally and professionally.

We all know this will be a success. I enjoy a good reputation for making the best of opportunities, whether it be an exhibition or a job, and absolutely took advantage of the amazing fortune I had last year with the grant and artist residency. The first few months in Berlin were spent researching, networking, and preparing for my residency in Bad Ems. While at the residency, I produced new work for five group exhibitions within six months’ time. Not a moment was wasted. You will see in my portfolio and CV (by clicking the "Gallery" tab above) that my experience supports my ability to carry out this project. As much as I want to establish myself here in Berlin, and in Europe, it is still important to me to remain close to my friends, family, and colleagues in the States. I fully believe in this show and my future in Berlin; I hope that you can feel my enthusiasm and share in the excitement with me.


Other Ways You Can Help

I realize that funding every project isn’t possible for all of us,  but there are other ways that you can support my project, such as helping to spread the word through private and public platforms – whether it be forwarding my e-mail to your friends, family and colleagues who might be interested, or promoting my project on Facebook and other websites that have a wider audience.

There are tools to share my project built into the indiegogo platform, please feel free to use these tools to further spread the word!

into the indiegogo platform, please feel free to use these tools to further
spread the word!

story:
Kato is the reason I ventured into the steampunk relm!
She's my hero and inspired me with her creativity, beauty, geekery and individuality and I want so much to be a part of that alongside her!

She contacted me at the start of this year to be a model for her but at the time I wasnt able to afford the trip and due to moving to San Diego... Well, lets face it, money still doesnt allow it to happen so I'm asking for your help!

I want to reach a goal I've had for 2 years and I need your generosity to do exactly that! Help me get to Oregon to shoot with Kato within these next 2 months and get some cool stuff along the way!

story:
UPDATE: Wednesday February 4, 2015

Hello Everyone! We wanted to give you an update on raising funds for our mural! A lot has happened since Dec. 2014 when we launched this indiegogo campaign. So, here we go: 

1) We have classroom and event space donated to us generously by the Dedalus Foundation. This means we do not have to rent classroom and event space. We are still looking to rent art studio space though.  

2) We had our community mural launch party on Saturday January 24, 2015 at the Dedalus Foundation. It was a huge success! We brought in cash donations and our Mural Arts Team sold their artwork. 
3) So, we now have a NEW GOAL to RAISE! And that is $15,000.00. Even though this indiegogo campaign ends on Friday Feb. 6, 2015, we will still be raising funds.
So please contact us: 

Moana Niumeitolu, cell: 917-564-9158

***THANK YOU FOR BEING ON THIS JOURNEY WITH US***

------------------------------------------------------------------
Our team of independent artist/educators is thrilled to announce the launch of

“WE COME FROM THE FUTURE”

a new community mural project in Sunset Park, Brooklyn

Sunset Park is a diverse community comprised largely of immigrants and indigenous peoples.  We believe in their journey and, with this mural, strive to convey that the future is a blank canvas with limitless possibilities. With a focus on the female experience, we will gather stories from grandmothers, mothers, and their daughters creating a public, permanent mural that honors their lives, families and the community they are forging in Sunset Park.

We are also committed to providing training and opportunities for the young women of Sunset Park. Classes in mural making will be offered that also develop skills for community building and leadership. As we move forward into this exciting future together, our team needs your support. No contribution is too small, and we believe that with your help this project will come to life. Your time, consideration, and contributions are immensely appreciated.

ALL DONATIONS ARE FULLY TAX-DEDUCTIBLE.

For the last fourteen years, our lead muralist, Vaimoana Niumeitolu, has served as a teaching artist for in-school artistic residencies with Ping Chong + Company, a theatre company that addresses civic and social issues both on stage and in the community. We are so grateful that Ping Chong + Company has agreed to serve as our fiscal sponsor and therefore all donations are fully tax-deductible!

CONTRIBUTIONS AND PERKS

On this page, you will find incentives ranging from the $25 giving level up through $5,000. Contributions at every level make you a part of the story of this mural.      To acknowledge any and all contributions, your name will be listed in the Thank You section of our Facebook page and blog site! You may, of course, elect to remain Anonymous in your donations as well. Thank you in advance for supporting us in reaching our fundraising goal!

THE BUDGET BREAKDOWN

$17,000 - Secure the lease of an Art Studio for the duration of the year (that’s close to $50/day). All painting for the mural will take place indoors in our studio on parachute cloth and will then be transported onto the exterior wall upon completion. This Art Studio will be our home in Brooklyn. We are looking ahead and we want to continue to paint murals within Brooklyn communities- this is just the first!

$25,000 - Pay four full-time salaries for our primary muralists to plan and complete the mural in addition to teaching classes to youth in the community from January to May 2015.

$2,500 - Cover the cost of art supplies, office supplies and equipment. (i.e. paint, primer, sealer, parachute cloth, brushes, etc.)

$2,000 - Rent scaffolding required for the final installation of the mural.

$2,500 - Pay fees for www.indiegogo.com campaign, PayPal and other transactions.

$6,000 - Cover our estimated taxes. We know we must pay taxes!

TOTAL = $55,000

THE IMPACT

Help us build a future where we listen to each other's stories and celebrate our roots. Help us build a future where we stand united as a community. Help us build a future where young artists share their creativity and learn the skills to grow as leaders and strengthen the communities around them. We know that art not only transforms public spaces but also transforms lives.

OUR PARTNERS

Of course, there is a great deal of planning, preparation, and partnership that goes into a project of this scale. We feel privileged to have received fiscal sponsorship from Ping Chong + Company and to have already established community partnerships with three incredible organizations in Sunset Park: The Dedalus Foundation, Turning Point, and Uprose Brooklyn. Our mural will be on the front facade of Turning Point's main office building, where they offer various services for the homeless population, including primary medical care, mental health services, warm showers and a laundry program. Learn more about these amazing organizations and their positive impact by visiting their websites (listed below). We look forward to expanding our list of community partners- you could be next!

Ping Chong + Company : www.pingchong.org

The Dedalus Foundation: http://dedalusfoundation.org/

Turning Point: http://www.tpbk.org/

Uprose Brooklyn: http://uprose.org/

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

We thank you for taking the time to learn about our mural and would love for you to help us spread the word! Please forward our fundraising page to your coworkers, friends and family and encourage them to do the same! We wish you a joyous holiday season, a prosperous New Year and a future glowing with possibilities.

TOGETHER, WE ARE CAPABLE OF BUILDING THE FUTURE WE DREAM OF.
