story:
If you don't already know me, I am an artist and educator living in Minneapolis. I am presently working toward a PhD in Art and Media at Plymouth University in the U.K.

My theoretical focus is on the quality of interference, which I explore through the medium of Display Holography. There are many different types of holograms, from the one on your driver’s license to holographic projections, which is basically video projected onto a special transparent screen or a suspension of vapor. I am working with both the Holopro Screen and emulsion based holographic transfers. 

I have been invited to present my research; “Display Holography in Art Practice: An Exploration of Interference” at The Image Conference at Berkeley this fall. As part of my research I have the opportunity to also work at one of the best holographic studios in the country the end of April at Ohio State. 

But the portion of my research for which I am liquidating my prints, is to present at the Symposium on Display Holography in St. Petersburg Russia at the end of June. The conference is held every three years and each year they invite more artists to present their research. This year it is at ITMO (National Research University of Information Technologies, Mechanics and Optics.) Russia's MIT, (which is where it was last held in 2012.) So, as well as being at the center of art and science, this opportunity is essential to my research in particular and I hope it further enables me to contribute to epistemological theory as well as social change.

The reason I need to have this fundraising initiative completed by the end of April is because I am leaving mid-May to conduct research in the U.K. for 6 weeks.

Budget - Airfare – 1158.29, Lodging – 106.49 (7 days in a yoga hostel)  

Since I'm not asking for donations beyond those who wish to acquire a 'perk,' my goal of 1100.00 is based on how many prints I have to 'perk' out. I may lower perk prices as the deadline draws near because even if my goal is not met, anything will help defray costs. 

Prints (and a couple of water colors,) can be viewed at this website: http://s1179.photobucket.com/user/artlindajoy/library/?sort=2&page=1

Click on the image to see the size, medium and price. Then you can page through them by clicking the arrow on the right. In order to secure your print send me an email or FB me with the number of the print and I will remove it asap, then you can remit perk payment on Indigogo. (Don't pay any attention to the option for ordering cards at the bottom of the Photobucket site.)

All prints will be sent out by mid-July (after I return from abroad.) If you have any questions about funding please message me on FB or email me at arlindajoy@gmail.com.

I certainly understand that not everyone will be interested in the 'perk' prints offer, but it will be a great help if you can share my Indiegogo proposal with others who may be interested, see the Indiegogo share tools. And of course moral support is appreciated beyond words, especially from mid-May to July 4th while I am out of the country. 

This project will ultimately produce a display holographic exhibit, which viewers from Minneapolis and Plymouth UK can take an interactive part in through open source formatting. The opening will be announced sometime in 2016.

(A special thanks to my grown kids for watching my house and animals for me while I am away.)

story:
Almost there!

My thanks to all who have contributed up to now. The first perks will be mailed over the next couple of days, and the gift vouchers will be emailed to the various recipients when the campaign closes.

I have added one more perk, a knife that is very special to me as it is my first attempt at creating a natural looking surface in steel. Scroll down and take a peek...

Short Summary

My name is Tiaan Burger, I create small scale artwork in metal as well as organic materials.

 

Much of my work is done under magnification, in the past an "optivisor" was good enough, but over the past two years I have become far-sighted. Looking through my +4 optivisor is now the equivalent of what I could see without any visual aids. In addition my work has become more intricate as I learnt new techniques.

I need to purchase an engraver's microscope, which is a stereo microscope with a wide field of view and a long focal distance, which will allow me to continue carving with hammer and chisels and do even finer work than I am currently capable of.

Your contributions will allow me to continue doing the work I love.

What I Need & What You Get

My funding goal is US$1200, which will be used for the purchase of a stereo microscope. Any funding received above this goal, or left over after the purchase of the microscope will be used to buy another set of tools as my daughter wishes to learn how to carve.

If I do not reach my entire goal then I will buy the tools needed to teach, and save up until I have enough to buy a microscope.

In exchange for the funding received I have a collection of outstanding perks. These are all handmade, true once-off, one-of-a-kind pieces.



I also have vouchers as perks, should you wish to have something made to order.

The Impact

Your contribution will change the way I work, and that will change the products I make and sell. This will impact on my family in that I will be able to be a better provider.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on Facebook, like my facebook page and use the Indiegogo share tools!

You can also follow and comment on my blog

story:
Thank you!

Thank you so much for a successful campaign ! We reached our goal and beyond and we are eternally grateful to you all. Heres to the 1000 hours of empowerment and creating memories for our kids touched by cancer !


Why focus on Art? Why not Research?

Research will someday find more effective ways to treat cancer. But until that day arrives, according to National Cancer Institute, “Cancer is the leading cause of death by disease among U.S. children between infancy and age 14". 

"Each year around 13,500 children are diagnosed with cancer in the US, that’s more than a classroom of kids a day".

Every child and family have to go through chemotherapy and other extended treatment protocols that are physically and mentally debilitating.

We at Kids & Art are here for every single one of these children and families while they are braving through cancer. 


Our Goal is to focus on the NOW and create memorable experiences through their journey because Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!

 Why Kids & Art?

Only 4% of money goes towards childhood cancer research and substantially less than that goes towards any Art, Music and Wellness programs for childhood cancer patients and families.

Whether we like it or not, kids do get cancer. We might not be able to take their cancer away but we can definitely be there for them through their journey, through art as an outlet and an escape. This is what we at Kids & Art offer these children, their families and their care circle.

Our hope is that Kids & Art will create healing, peace, and lasting memories for every family touched by cancer. Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!

The Founders Journey

Why is my story important or different from anyone else. My voice matters because I am a mom whose child was diagnosed with cancer at the age of 3. My voice matters because I'm a mom who has lost a beautiful child to cancer after 6 years of on again and off again treatment and a chemo induced relapse.

Once the family gets the diagnosis their life is turned upside down. They do not have time to focus on themselves or let alone think about supplementing and balancing their child's already strained life.

When I saw that my son Amaey, felt relief and peace from doing art in his hospital room, whether it was during short or long stays for chemo, and when playing on his keyboard and creating music, it was then that I realized the power of art. I realized what art was doing for him. It was giving him a chance to escape and create a life he liked. 

For him cancer was an inconvenience but art was an escape, into a world he controlled and created.  

(left) Amaey creating art in 2009 at our very first art workshop in Pixar's big art room. (right) With Artist Alex Puvilland of DreamWorks in 2010.

Help us give 1000 hours of empowerment and create memories!

  • All we ask for is $25. From 500 people, we can make our goal! It takes a village to raise a child, so let's gather the village and continue to empower through art! 
  • For the price of a mani-pedi or a nice business lunch, these kids would be able to get hours of creativity and a chance to be a child and forget about their cancer
  • Free workshops for the families. We will bring in amazing artists, musicians, wellness practitioners, and all art supplies and utilities

What is the value for these kids who are trapped in the continuous cycle of treatment to escape for an afternoon?

Just $25 for one hour!

What is the cost for 1 day of hospital stay for pediatric cancer patient?

$40,400

Why do we need your support?

We have been invited to expand our program to Family House! 

Family House in San Francisco, serves as a home away from home for families of children with cancer and other life-threatening illnesses by providing physical comfort and emotional support, free from financial concerns. 

Family House has invited us to bring our Art Workshops, Music Therapy, Breathing and Mindfulness Workshops for their 40 room facility.

This program is on top of our already existing workshops.


Our stories:




Read more testimonials from our artists, families, and volunteers.

75% of our families are referred to us by their hospital social workers

  • Our primary target population are children touched by cancer from 3-18 years of age.

  • We create with children who are in-treatment, survivors, siblings, best friends, as well as children of parents who are undergoing cancer treatment.  

  • We also support families who are in hospice, as well as bereaved families through special art workshops. Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!

  • 85% of our families come from Bay Area Hospitals like Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital. 15 % of families are from Kaiser, CPMC, and UCSF. (this ratio will change in the coming years)

  • We've created workshops at Google, Dreamworks and Pixar Studios. As well as local schools, local Artists’ studios, Redwood City Art Center, Peninsula Museum, and Los Gatos Museum, to name a few.

    • Our 2014-15 Focus 

    Along with our new program at Family House, we will continue offering wonderful creative opportunities to our families through our monthly art workshops. We will grow from 8 workshops from last art season to 14 workshops for this art season. 

    Cancer Sucks. Art Heals, Music Rocks and Mindfulness is not just for the sick child!

    If you support this statement then Give the Gift of Presence, healing the family as a whole through treatment, remission and even bereavement. Help us Empower our kids and families.


    What can you do beyond donating money?

    • Help steer the focus away from only curing the cancer and start working towards curing the child at #cancersucksartheals.

    • If you believe that Cancer Sucks. Art Heals! Then create a video of your own and share it on social media.

    • Online Shoppers: Do your shopping from Goodshop.com at more than 2,800 participating stores (from Amazon to Zazzle) and a percentage of what you spend will be donated to your cause at no cost to you.

    • Stay connected and Follow Kids & Art on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to follow our journey towards EMPOWERMENT!

    Facts about Pediatric Cancer Incidence and Mortality:

    • Each year around 13,500 children are diagnosed with cancer in the US, that’s more than a classroom of kids a day.
    • 35,000 children are currently in treatment for cancer.
    • On average a treatment for childhood cancer diagnosis is two years.
    • The average age of death for a child with cancer is 8, causing a child to lose 69 years of expected life.
    • Cancer kills more children than AIDs, asthma, diabetes, cystic fibrosis and congenital anomalies combined.
    • Cancer treatment can cause serious side effects that may last a lifetime
    • Research on the emotional impact of childhood cancer finds that parents and siblings report even greater long term emotional impacts than the diagnosed child.
    • The death of a child is one of the most traumatic events a family might face.
    • Families who have lost children are often financially and emotionally depleted.

      Facts about Pediatric Cancer Survivors:

      • 74% of childhood cancer survivors have chronic illnesses, and some 40% of childhood cancer survivors have severe illnesses or die from such illnesses.
      • Radiation to a child’s brain can significantly damage cognitive function, or if radiation is given at a very young age, limiting the ability to read, do basic math, tell time or even talk.
      • Physical and neurocognitive disabilities resulting from treatment may prevent childhood cancer survivors from fully participating in school, social activities and eventually work, which can cause depression and feelings of isolation.

      Kids & Art Perks:

      We have received many inquiries about making straight donations without perks. YES, you have the option of donating without getting a perk.



       

      Is this campaign international?

      Yes! 

      Can I donate from outside the USA?

      Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, and bank or debit cards which have the visa/mastercard logo.

      Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?

      If you would like to donate $10,000 or more then please become our matching partner to help us create more momentum. Let us know and w e will connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.

      Is shipping included?

      Yes. (additional international shipping costs may apply)

      Does international shipping cost extra?

      Indiegogo does not include shipping in the contribution process for the time being, But you can add an extra amount for shipping within the US or outside of the US when you make your contribution. This will help us tremendously!

      Can we leave special instructions?

      Contributors will not be able to leave a note with their contribution but can definitely leave a comment on our campaign's comment tab or send us a direct message. 

      Campaign Update: Dec 14: The Self Portrait & #choosemust with Elle Luna

      Elle Luna opened up her amazing studio for our families. Our art workshop was an out of this world experience. This video captures some snippets of our time with Elle.

Research will someday find more effective ways to treat cancer. But until that day arrives, according to National Cancer Institute, “Cancer is the leading cause of death by disease among U.S. children between infancy and age 14". 
"Each year around 13,500 children are diagnosed with cancer in the US, that’s more than a classroom of kids a day".
Every child and family have to go through chemotherapy and other extended treatment protocols that are physically and mentally debilitating.
We at Kids & Art are here for every single one of these children and families while they are braving through cancer. 

Our Goal is to focus on the NOW and create memorable experiences through their journey because Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!


 Why Kids & Art?
Only 4% of money goes towards childhood cancer research and substantially less than that goes towards any Art, Music and Wellness programs for childhood cancer patients and families.
Whether we like it or not, kids do get cancer. We might not be able to take their cancer away but we can definitely be there for them through their journey, through art as an outlet and an escape. This is what we at Kids & Art offer these children, their families and their care circle.

Our hope is that Kids & Art will create healing, peace, and lasting memories for every family touched by cancer. Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!



The Founders Journey

Why is my story important or different from anyone else. My voice matters because I am a mom whose child was diagnosed with cancer at the age of 3. My voice matters because I'm a mom who has lost a beautiful child to cancer after 6 years of on again and off again treatment and a chemo induced relapse.
Once the family gets the diagnosis their life is turned upside down. They do not have time to focus on themselves or let alone think about supplementing and balancing their child's already strained life.
When I saw that my son Amaey, felt relief and peace from doing art in his hospital room, whether it was during short or long stays for chemo, and when playing on his keyboard and creating music, it was then that I realized the power of art. I realized what art was doing for him. It was giving him a chance to escape and create a life he liked. 
For him cancer was an inconvenience but art was an escape, into a world he controlled and created.  

(left) Amaey creating art in 2009 at our very first art workshop in Pixar's big art room. (right) With Artist Alex Puvilland of DreamWorks in 2010.



Help us give 1000 hours of empowerment and create memories!


All we ask for is $25. From 500 people, we can make our goal! It takes a village to raise a child, so let's gather the village and continue to empower through art! 
For the price of a mani-pedi or a nice business lunch, these kids would be able to get hours of creativity and a chance to be a child and forget about their cancer
Free workshops for the families. We will bring in amazing artists, musicians, wellness practitioners, and all art supplies and utilities


What is the value for these kids who are trapped in the continuous cycle of treatment to escape for an afternoon?
Just $25 for one hour!
What is the cost for 1 day of hospital stay for pediatric cancer patient?
$40,400






Why do we need your support?


We have been invited to expand our program to Family House! 
Family House in San Francisco, serves as a home away from home for families of children with cancer and other life-threatening illnesses by providing physical comfort and emotional support, free from financial concerns. 
Family House has invited us to bring our Art Workshops, Music Therapy, Breathing and Mindfulness Workshops for their 40 room facility.
This program is on top of our already existing workshops.






Our stories:







Read more testimonials from our artists, families, and volunteers.


75% of our families are referred to us by their hospital social workers

Our primary target population are children touched by cancer from 3-18 years of age.
We create with children who are in-treatment, survivors, siblings, best friends, as well as children of parents who are undergoing cancer treatment.  




We also support families who are in hospice, as well as bereaved families through special art workshops. Cancer Sucks. Art Heals!
85% of our families come from Bay Area Hospitals like Lucile Packard Children’s Hospital. 15 % of families are from Kaiser, CPMC, and UCSF. (this ratio will change in the coming years)
We've created workshops at Google, Dreamworks and Pixar Studios. As well as local schools, local Artists’ studios, Redwood City Art Center, Peninsula Museum, and Los Gatos Museum, to name a few.





Our 2014-15 Focus 
Along with our new program at Family House, we will continue offering wonderful creative opportunities to our families through our monthly art workshops. We will grow from 8 workshops from last art season to 14 workshops for this art season. 










Cancer Sucks. Art Heals, Music Rocks and Mindfulness is not just for the sick child!
If you support this statement then Give the Gift of Presence, healing the family as a whole through treatment, remission and even bereavement. Help us Empower our kids and families.



What can you do beyond donating money?

Help steer the focus away from only curing the cancer and start working towards curing the child at #cancersucksartheals.
If you believe that Cancer Sucks. Art Heals! Then create a video of your own and share it on social media.
Online Shoppers: Do your shopping from Goodshop.com at more than 2,800 participating stores (from Amazon to Zazzle) and a percentage of what you spend will be donated to your cause at no cost to you.
Stay connected and Follow Kids & Art on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to follow our journey towards EMPOWERMENT!






Facts about Pediatric Cancer Incidence and Mortality:

Each year around 13,500 children are diagnosed with cancer in the US, that’s more than a classroom of kids a day.
35,000 children are currently in treatment for cancer.
On average a treatment for childhood cancer diagnosis is two years.
The average age of death for a child with cancer is 8, causing a child to lose 69 years of expected life.
Cancer kills more children than AIDs, asthma, diabetes, cystic fibrosis and congenital anomalies combined.
Cancer treatment can cause serious side effects that may last a lifetime
Research on the emotional impact of childhood cancer finds that parents and siblings report even greater long term emotional impacts than the diagnosed child.
The death of a child is one of the most traumatic events a family might face.
Families who have lost children are often financially and emotionally depleted.


Facts about Pediatric Cancer Survivors:

74% of childhood cancer survivors have chronic illnesses, and some 40% of childhood cancer survivors have severe illnesses or die from such illnesses.
Radiation to a child’s brain can significantly damage cognitive function, or if radiation is given at a very young age, limiting the ability to read, do basic math, tell time or even talk.
Physical and neurocognitive disabilities resulting from treatment may prevent childhood cancer survivors from fully participating in school, social activities and eventually work, which can cause depression and feelings of isolation.




Kids & Art Perks:
We have received many inquiries about making straight donations without perks. YES, you have the option of donating without getting a perk.





 


Is this campaign international?

Yes! 
Can I donate from outside the USA?
Absolutely! Indiegogo only accepts international credit cards, and bank or debit cards which have the visa/mastercard logo.
Large Contributions - How can I make a contribution over $10,000?
If you would like to donate $10,000 or more then please become our matching partner to help us create more momentum. Let us know and w e will connect you with a specialist at Indiegogo who will assist you with the contribution transfer process.
Is shipping included?
Yes. (additional international shipping costs may apply)
Does international shipping cost extra?
Indiegogo does not include shipping in the contribution process for the time being, But you can add an extra amount for shipping within the US or outside of the US when you make your contribution. This will help us tremendously!
Can we leave special instructions?
Contributors will not be able to leave a note with their contribution but can definitely leave a comment on our campaign's comment tab or send us a direct message. 


Campaign Update: Dec 14: The Self Portrait & #choosemust with Elle Luna
Elle Luna opened up her amazing studio for our families. Our art workshop was an out of this world experience. This video captures some snippets of our time with Elle.

story:
Who we are:
We started Resistance Gallery 6 years ago with very little money but a lot of positive thought power & ideas, with the aim to have a safe, interesting multi-functional creative events, arts, performance & home base for Lucha Libre in London.

We have been part of, in some way shape or form, many exciting projects which have led to trend setting movements.

We have created new events, given our space to others where doors have been closed to them, nurtured other people’s babies/projects, as if they were our own & tried our best to provide the most comfortable, safe & cool environment for all of our friends, extended families & widespread communities to enjoy!

From Iconography of mask to the London festival of Japanese rope bondage!

Debbie club to London School of Lucha Libre.

Hail to the King: A tribute to Jack Kirby to This is So Wrong.

Beauty in Decay to Late night shop to Kinky Salon to Fangtasia London to Sink the Pink to Trans Kabaret Maxximus to Baby Lame to Mexican Siniestro to Domo to Till art do us part to Peer Rope London, Flabbergast theatre, Monsters & Ink, Loading, Where the nights are Blue & Electric, Fetishistas, Skirt, ZigZag Samstag, Bizarre magazine artist of the year, Bitchslap!, Bad Reputation, Abasement of Dolls, Mutiny: On Trial series, FU Baby TV, Trannies with Fannies, Blitzhaus, Super Satanic Saturdays, Mariah & Friends, Pornceptual, State of Bliss, Lucha Britannia… and the list goes on:

What happened and what are we asking for:

It’s been a beautiful journey which has come to an abrupt halt due to vandals setting fire to our bins & almost destroying ResGal!
With your help we will be able to not only continue our odyssey, but also grow into something much more, enabling many others to have the opportunity to expand, explore & create.

We need to raise at least £15k to do the essential repairs, replacing & upgrades needed to not only survive but also thrive and continue providing a safe unique venue for thousands of peoples throughout the years.

Kick ass Club nights, challenging art exhibitions, private parties, birthdays, weddings, political forums, ground breaking cabaret shows, sexual expression platforms, fetish events, cake making classes, photoshoots, latex workshops, fitness classes, Cabaret Siniestro,  Neo Burlesque, comedy nights, fringe theatre shows, filming location: All of this can only continue with your amazing support!

Please Share our cause as wide and far as possible, give where you can & remember our maxim: Create Destroy Recreate!!!

Big Love to you all!

What you will receive:

Our immense gratitude and the knowledge of you have help lots of peoples dreams.

These are some or our goodies with much more to follow:

Paper cut wrestlers

Lucha cut out masks

Lucha Britannia zine

Hand made doll by Izaskun Gonzalez (sold)

Marnie Scarlet TinSoldier outfit

New Lucha Britannia T-shirt

Resistace Gallery Love T-shirt

China Hamilton

China Hamilton

One custom made Ghoulia's Peculiars Wig.

Sebastian by Ian Ward

story:
Israel is at war. Citizens around the country are running for shelter. The losses are mounting.

But amidst the turmoil, the unity in Eretz Yisrael is growing strong.

And now, Bnei Hashraah, an Anglo youth movement in Ramat Beit Shemesh, under the auspices of HaRav Yaacov Haber, has been mobilizing to make a difference and to build bridges between religious and secular Israelis. 

In the last two weeks, as a show of achdus (unity) and chesed (kindness), the Bnei Hashraah boys dyed over 320 white tzitzis to khaki color for secular soldiers stationed in Gaza, who had requested this because white tzitzis can be seen through army uniforms. The boys also visited wounded soldiers at Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital, singing songs and expressing their gratitude to the soldiers and their families for their sacrifices. As the adults rally to buy food and toiletries for those on the front lines, the boys have also found themselves engaged in important tasks. As a result, they feel a part of something greater than themselves. 

These experiences have made an impression.

And this is what Bnei Hashraah is all about.

In a world filled with so many distractions, Bnei Hashraah strives to bring Torah to life and to connect the boys to their heritage and the holiness of Eretz Yisrael. It gives them a context in which to treasure their Jewish identity. It unites them with other types of Jews. 

With Bnei Torah serving as their role models, the boys, ages 8-14 yrs, gather weekly for fun and inspiration. A stroll through the Bar Kochva caves to learn about the Chanukah story, a treasure hunt through the Old City to learn about Jerusalem and its history, a late night kumzitz and barbeque, archaeological digs, an oneg Shabbos with divrei Torah and singing, making sling shots in Tel Azaka, discussing Dovid and Goliath — these are just a few of the many fun and educational activities Bnei Hashraah has organized.

What a rare opportunity for religious boys in Israel! As they grow and mature into young adults, these experiences are crucial in helping to shape their outlook and their passion for Hashem and the Jewish people.

Beit Shemesh is the first city in Eretz Yisrael to host such a movement. But it will not be the only one. 

Over 120 boys have already joined Bnei Hashraah. With your support, many more boys will have the opportunity to join a movement that stretches them beyond themselves, building them to be leaders of the next generation. 

Especially during this time of war, your financial support is needed and appreciated. It enables Bnei Hashraah to continue the activities that bring so much solace to the soldiers and personal growth for our young boys.

story:
What is the temple?

The Temple of Introduction is an art piece designed to create a sacred space within the Interfuse regional burn. It is named "Introduction" because it is designed to be a transformative and introspective gateway for participants new to this element of Burning Man culture. While Temple's have been around for a long time at Burning Man, Interfuse has been without one for some time. This is an opportunity to introduce (or reintroduce) this community to temple culture while also allowing each individual the opportunity to radically express the vulnerable parts of themselves anonymously or publicly in front of our community.

All of its inner walls are lined with seating that face inward. This is intentional since it isolates the space and allows those inside the temple to interact with eachother. At its center, there is a tree which will be burned the final night at Interfuse. At the base of that tree, are wooden leafs crafted in such a way that they can be written on and hung by participants. 

At the end of Interfuse, the temple itself will be deconstructed, stored, and brought back the following year until the "introduction" period is complete. Then, it will be burned in its entirity. 

Why a fundraiser?

The temple is a community-sized art project with a community sized budget. While several individuals have stepped up to help fund initial costs and we are seeking an art grant from the Interfuse board, there still are significant financial hurtles. 

Wood materials alone are estimated at over $1800

Transportation/fuel is estimated around $360

Lighting, power, writing materials, signage, and other costs extend the costs to the proposed amount we have set. So, you can see how the numbers start to add up. 

If you want this piece at Interfuse in 2015 and have the financial means to contribute, any amount would help spread out the financial burden and bring us closer to making this project a reality.

The Value of a Temple:

One of the most transformative parts of the Burning Man culture is Radical Self Expression when paired with Participation and Immediacy. When these 3 principles are combined, you find yourself actively and presently living the most authentic version of yourself. Many times this is in extroverted celebration but, sometimes, it may require you to be introspective and maybe even sorrowful. Not every part of us is bright and vibrant. Some parts are dark and full of regret, anger, or shame. It should be obvious then that a sacred space where these parts of ourselves can be safely expressed be available to participants whenever they need it. The Temple of Introduction is intended to be that space for this community. We would be honored for you to be a part of this effort.

Who is building it?

The lead artist for this project is Nate Kuester (aka Ginger Surprise, Nebraska's current regional coordinator) with a support team consisting of several members of Nebraska's Tallgrass Burners. Many of us have been to Burning Man, Interfuse, and other regionals. We have built theme camps, C.O.R.E. projects, and personal art projects of our own. We have a laser shop and all plans lined up and ready to go once funding begins. We are a team of burners dedicated to seeing this project through as we have consistently done with others in the past.

story:
Club for cultural Initiatives „Taralej” is a place where culture is created, developed, generated. It is a non-commercial club-gallery, which has a non-formal, cozy atmosphere, but a professional attitude towards art and culture. “Taralej” can be described also as a place for cultural exchange, experiments and improvisation. And all here is done for FREE!


How it all started: In Bulgarian “taralej” means a hedgehog. There is a wise saying: ” The hedgehog is a stubborn bird, you have to hit it, or it won’t fly”. Ever since our team started working on the project, those words have been our motivational slogan. In the beginning we were super unknown in the city, and this project sounded too utopic to everyone. But we had to do it, we had nothing to lose and a lot to gain. We were tired of looking for a job or working something that made no sense to us. It was time to try to fulfill our dreams.


The team: We are 4 young people with an art education, cultural lovers.  We like working for the people, we dream to improve the art and culture state in the city, we want to give the young emerging artists what we didn’t have when we were students- a place to experiment, create, grow and be free.


“Taralej”- club for cultural initiatives, started as social project for contemporary art, which had 4 main goals:

-  To provide a free of charge “stage” for young artistic people and introduce them  to notable artists (there are many young people in the city, because it hosts the second largest university in the country and has a fairly developed  art department);

-  To fight the common issue of centralizing cultural events (we are located in a lovely town in mid Bulgaria, called Veliko Tarnovo, which  has a great historical part, but has a poor alternative and  contemporary art stage compared to the capital Sofia);

-  To educate people in the new forms of arts and in general understanding of art and culture (all our events are free for the public, free for the artists to participate and for some of the events the artists are being paid to participate);


- To provoke creativity and improve general behavior and state of mind through the means of art and culture.

The statistics are:

-  more than 600 participants up to now;

-  more than 400 events (exhibitions, concerts, theater plays, literature readings , non-commercial movie projections, workshops, art  courses, seminars, performances, jam sessions  and so on;

-  Thousands of visitors;

-  6 Festivals:  “12 hours of art”, “Street art festival”, Festival of the “Street Artists”, “Ice Sculpture Symposium”, “Tetris – contemporary art festival”, “Night of Samovodska Charshia”;

-   “Taralej” has become a popular space for artistic events through the local media.


The problem:

“Taralej” project has been funded twice by the municipality of Veliko Tarnovo but since more than 7 months, the project doesn’t have any funding, and the team of “Taralej” no longer has financial strength to invest in it. We’ve been short on events because of the situation we are in. For the past months we haven’t been able to pay the rent of the club, the bills for administrative overheads, the salary for an accountant or other related expenses. Soon we’ll be running into debts we can’t pay and we’ll be forced to close the club.

 Our issues were put on the spotlight a month ago when we announced we were on the verge of shutting down. Our visitors and artists, who have felt at home here, started “spamming” the social networks with articles about our financial break down, they were upset, they were asking us not to close. After that much support we realized we are not giving up, we’re staying for the sake of all the people who cared! Unfortunately, Bulgarian business is not so prone to funding cultural activities and organizations, as donation is also not so popular.

That is why we need your help!

If you too, care about art and culture, if what we’re doing and fighting for inspires you, please support us. The past months were really hard for us, so if our cause is appealing to you, help us go through while we manage to set our feet back on the ground and find a way to raise funds for a longer term.

We need financial support so we can cover our general expenses for events, rents, administrative overhead expenses, electricity bills, accountant salaries, repair, equipments and so on.

Other ways you can support us;

Spread the word, share our campaign and find Taralej on Facebook!

Thank you!

Taralej team : Damyan Bumbalov, Ivelina Ruseva, Lilyana Georgieva, Adriana Ivanova

A big "Thank you" to BG live, FilmKrajok  for the video and to duo "Sha-sha" for the musical background! Without your support, our campagne wouldn't have been the same!

Thousands
of visitors;
- 
6 Festivals:
 “12 hours of art”, “Street art
festival”, Festival of the “Street Artists”, “Ice Sculpture Symposium”, “Tetris
– contemporary art festival”, “Night of Samovodska Charshia”;
- 
 “Taralej” has become a popular space for
artistic events through the local media.
The problem:
“Taralej” project has been
funded twice by the municipality of Veliko Tarnovo but since more than 7
months, the project doesn’t have any funding, and the team of “Taralej” no
longer has financial strength to invest in it. We’ve been short on events
because of the situation we are in. For the past months we haven’t been able to
pay the rent of the club, the bills for administrative overheads, the salary for an accountant or other related
expenses. Soon we’ll be running into debts we can’t pay and we’ll be forced to close
the club.
 Our issues were put on the spotlight a month
ago when we announced we were on the verge of shutting down. Our visitors and
artists, who have felt at home here, started “spamming” the social networks
with articles about our financial break down, they were upset, they were asking
us not to close. After that much support we realized we are not giving up,
we’re staying for the sake of all the people who cared! Unfortunately,
Bulgarian business is not so prone to funding cultural activities and
organizations, as donation is also not so popular.
That is why we need your
help!
If you too, care about
art and culture, if what we’re doing and fighting for inspires you, please support
us. The past months were really hard for us, so if our cause is appealing to
you, help us go through while we manage to set our feet back on the ground and
find a way to raise funds for a longer term.
We need financial support so we can cover our general expenses
for events, rents, administrative overhead expenses, electricity bills, accountant
salaries, repair, equipments and so on.Other ways you can support us;Spread the word, share our campaign and find Taralej on Facebook!Thank you!Taralej team : Damyan Bumbalov, Ivelina Ruseva, Lilyana Georgieva, Adriana IvanovaA big "Thank you" to BG live, FilmKrajok  for the video and to duo "Sha-sha" for the musical background! Without your support, our campagne wouldn't have been the same!

story:
Hello!

     I am Bethany Robertson, a thing maker. I am a print maker, book binder, illustrator, and painter. I recently completed my MFA and have taught at the K-12 and university levels the past few years, which has inspired me endlessly in my own work. Since majoring in printmaking in undergraduate school at The University of Tennessee, Knoxville, it has been my dream to have an Etsy business of screen printed tote bags, buttons, shirts, and books.

          You can see images of my drawings and designs that will be printed at: http://bethanyrobertson.sqsp.com/loveless-designs/ I am inspired by a combination of geometric and organic images as well as pattern and repetitive forms. Each of my patterns begin as one shape that then grows upon itself.

      It is time to stop procrastinating and make my creative endeavors extend beyond my friends and family and into the world. The holidays would be a prime time to debut my collection to the world online and hopefully within markets and boutiques around New York.

Fund Goal

      My fundraising goal of 800 dollars is the amount that I have calculated to be enough to really get Loveless Designs off the ground. This amount breaks down to the following:
$300- Screen print shop access for five(4) 5-hour sessions
$200- Approximately 100 black and natural colored cotton tote bags
$150- 30 small wood panels to be printed onto
$100- Fabricated Loveless Design stamps for packaging and business cards
$50- Mailing and packaging costs

       If the goal is not met, the funds raised will still go towards each of the listed costs, however, the quantity of bags, panels, and print shop access will be altered to fit within the amount raised.

Special Thank-You Gifts

   Each person who donates to the start-up of Loveless Designs will receive a handmade thank-you gift. Each gift is printed with one of my hand drawn patterns. The gifts in order of level are:
• Buttons
• Tote Bags
• Hand-bound Sketchbook
• Limited Edition Print
• Small Painting on Wood Panel

   Your kind words and support have been invaluable to me in my artistic endeavors. Even if you are not able to contribute money, your feedback and promotion mean a great deal to me and I appreciate anything you are able to offer. Thank you all!

story:
After only one year of self-employment Oil & Birch has outgrown its little home studio! It's time to move out of the spare bedroom workspace and into a beautiful downtown retail & studio location. I'm raising community funds to help cover our renovation costs and support my dream of creating a safe, welcoming, and beautiful store and creative work space for me, my customers and other local artists! 

My name is Brin Steeves (she/her) and I'm a full-time artist & potter creating in Amiskwaciy-Waskahikan (Edmonton, AB) on Treaty 6 land. My art practice has always been about expression, community and connection. This new studio will provide me and local artists a space to host workshops, teach, learn, connect and grow together. It will embody my core values: respect, community, inclusivity, care and vulnerability. For years I've dreamed of lining the walls of a shop with my pottery and artwork, and I'm so thrilled to have an opportunity to do so!

 

How will this studio be used?

  • The front half of the space will be used as a store, to sell locally with ease!
  • Host workshops, art clubs, paint nights and other community gatherings (once safe to do so) 
  • Provide other artists with a workshop space to teach, learn and connect. 
  • Host pop up sales, spoken word and lil musical performances (again, once safe with covid)
  • Foster a safe environment for LGBTQ2s+ and Queer folks.
  • Allow ample space for new ceramic skills, such as slip casting, hand building, reclaiming (recycling) clay, etc. 
  • Expand productivity and business opportunities 

 

What sort of renovations will this funding support?

  • Mend and paint the enormous 20-foot walls
  • Create a beautiful, functional shop! Including decor, shelving, tables, and clothing racks for up-and-coming merch! 
  • Build multiple custom work tables 
  • Improve the staircase to the loft
  • Install lighting and shelving throughout the space
  • Give the kitchen and bathroom a small facelift 
  • Purchase tools, furniture and equipment to ensure a functional, well-stocked workshop space 

If we surpass our financial goal, funds will be used for furnishings such as plants, candles, furniture, frames for art, blinds, etc. Any remaining funds will go towards operating costs!

 

What's in it for donors?

  • Sick gifts when you donate! Check out the perks on my page and claim some unreal deals on ceramics, and workshops! My pottery can be tough to come by, my online sales often sell out within 5 minutes - so this is a great opportunity to snag some wares and help grow my business.
  • Edmonton local? By supporting this fundraiser you're actively investing in a new art space in your city! You'll *eventually* have access to pottery workshops hosted by Brin, and other artists of various mediums!  Plus you'll be able to shop Oil & Birch pottery in person. No more fighting for a piece in online sales!!
  • Not a local? Don't worry, I'll still accept customs and do online shop updates every few months! Just know that your donation, big or small, is appreciated! 

 

Ways you can help!

  • Financial donations -  every dollar is appreciated and gets us closer to a renovated space! Plus we've got some rad perks as thank you gifts for your generosity! 
  • Bid on one of my instagram auctions! I've curated some kickass holiday bundles, filled with art donated by local pals!! Tattoo time, prints, leather goods, gift cards, resin art, jewelry, and more! 
  • Spread the word!! Share this campaign on your social media platforms. Tell your friends and fam!!
  • Donate a gift card! Ikea, Zocalo, Michael's, Home Depot, Winners/Homesense, all super helpful!! (Contact me by email, fb or instagram to donate a gift card)
  • Follow me on Patreon! That small monthly donation of 5 or 10$ will give you access to tons of behind the scenes content, and will go directly towards my studio's monthly bills. www.Patreon.com/oilandbirch

 

Tell me about the building!

My future studio is in a secure building located in Edmonton's downtown core, only a couple  of blocks away from MacEwan University and City Center Mall. Easily accessible by bus, LRT, bike and car. To gain access to the building guests are required to buzz up. My unit is on the 3rd floor, in the "Co-loft" artist lofts! It is accessible by stairs or elevator (with ramps for those with mobility restrictions, and wheelchair users).

*It should be noted that the buzzer system is rather high and may require assistance for those in wheelchairs. If you require help with the buzzer, doors or ramps please contact me personally and I'll be happy to come down to aid*

My beautiful, bright loft is right next door to one of Edmonton's raddest tattoo shops - Right Hand Tattoo, and down the hall from an equally rad print shop River Valley Printing Co. I can't wait to be apart of the creative community in this building. Working alone in my home studio for the past year has definitely impacted my mental health, and I look forward to shooting the shit with my buddies on the daily.  

 

A final thanks! 

To anyone who donates, shares, and supports this goal - thank you. From the bottom of my heart, I appreciate any and all support. Edmonton has already helped me build an in-demand business, and take the leap into full-time employment - so I can't wait to see where my business goes from here with this unique, exciting project. All my love - Brin

story:
Bref résumé - Summary

Depuis quelques années, l'École de danse contemporaine de Montréal (EDCM) organise un voyage annuel à New York au printemps pour les étudiants de 2e et de 3e année. Lors de ce voyage, du 10 au 13 mars, nous allons participer à des classes de maître, assister à des spectacles et visiter la ville, notamment ses nombreux musées.

Yearly, the École de danse contemporaine de Montréal (EDCM) has been organizing a short trip to New York for the 2nd and 3rd year students. During this trip, from march 10th to march 13th, we will take part in master classes, see shows and visit the city.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez - What we need and what you get

Nous avons besoin d'amasser un montant total de 10575$, dont 5000$ avec l'aide d'IndieGogo.
En échange de vos précieux dons, nous offrons des cadeaux de remerciement : messages, vidéos personnalisés, chandails personnalisés, et autres surprises...
We need to gather $10575, of which $5000 will be accumulated through this IndieGogo campaign.
In exchange for your donations, we offer a variety of different gifts : messages, personnalized videos, customized t-shirts, and surprises...

L'impact - The impact

Ce voyage nous permettra de sortir de notre milieu ensemble pour acquérir de nouvelles références communes différentes de celles que nous apprenons à l'école. Ce voyage nous permettra de nous épanouir en tant qu'artistes, et de nous ouvrir, dès notre formation, à la collaboration artistique internationale.

Les danseurs que vous soutenez :
Laurent Chalifour,
Miranda Chan,
Ariane Famelart,
Amélie Gauthier,
Gina Grand,
Leïla Mailly,
Jamie Malysh,
Chloé Ouellet-Payeur,
Jessica Perry,
Marie-Pier Proulx,
Gabriel Robert,
Cara Roy,
Gabrielle Roy,
Elsa Tellier et
Sabrina Verrette.

This project will help us bloom as artists throughout our educational pathway and allow us to acquire new common references and knowledge, overcoming the international cultural boundaries.

The dancers you are supporting :
Laurent Chalifour,
Miranda Chan,
Ariane Famelart,
Amélie Gauthier,
Gina Grand,
Leïla Mailly,
Jamie Malysh,
Chloé Ouellet-Payeur,
Jessica Perry,
Marie-Pier Proulx,
Gabriel Robert,
Cara Roy,
Gabrielle Roy,
Elsa Tellier and
Sabrina Verrette.

story:
What Are MOON PUPPIES??

Moon Puppies are the brainchild of fashion designer and artist Liza Fishbone, who along with "Asstronauts" Ethan Heller and Carly Jacobs created the marvelous, mischievous costumed air dancers.  After receiving an artist grant from Wakarusa Music Festival, the Moon Puppies hit the road for Arkansas where they wiggled, shook and pranced into the hearts of observers far and wide.  Moon Puppies have danced onstage with Wookiefoot, Elliot Lipp and Fanny Pack.  Our next move is to share our magical creation with the citizens of St. Louis, MO during the annual Mardi Gras Parade!



Mardi Gras 2015 - How to Help

The mystical, magnificent Moon Puppies have been accepted into the St. Louis Mardi Gras Parade as a Walking Krewe...but we need YOUR HELP to make it happen!

  • Entry Fee - $200
  • Costume Repairs - $200
  • Supplies for Handouts - $100
Contributions to help Moon Puppies perform at the Mardi Gras Parade will foremost go towards the Krewe entry fee.  In addition to this fee, we plan on creating engaging and unique handouts to give to the crowd, and we will reconfigure the apparatus that holds the costumes high above the heads of our dancers.  Any additional money will go towards creating even more Moon Puppies for future endeavors!

Moon Puppies, Spread The Love

This project was created to spread positive feelings of joy and wonder, to inspire rhythmic dancing and swooning, and to promote an ideology of fun!  When the Moon Puppies are present, reality is obscured by the rose-tinted laughter of passersby.  Please help us continue a tradition of creativity, excitement and love by contributing to the Moon Puppies cause!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this fundraiser with your artistic and fun-loving friends!  And of course, don't forget to come down to Soulard on February 14th for the Mardi Gras Parade!

Thanks so much for your help!

-Moon Puppies

story:
Kalham Sutra 

Indian Goddess Fine Art Nude Book

The book Kalham Sutra will feature stunning nude art photos of Indian Goddess Kalham Amor in nature by Sean Pozin of Gypsy Vibes Art. We estimate that book production & photoshoot travel expenses will cost around $1,200 so we need your help to make our dream come true by backing the Kalham Sutra campaign! 

Kalham Sutra is inspired by the Sanskrit Kama Sutra which is an ancient guide to love, sensuous & sensual pleasure. Kalham Sutra touches on an aspect of Indian culture that is practically ignored in this century, which is art with sensual tones that embraces the body for what it is in its natural state. The book will make more people realize that the world of photography and modeling is more about creating art that is centered around larger issues than just taking sexy photographs. 

About Kalham Amor

  • Kalham Amor is a glamour model of Indian descent based in Dallas, TX. Kalham always had a dream to model and is one of the very few open-minded glamour models of Indian descent who also comes from a conservative background. Kalham is a gorgeous model who has been published in many magazines & she also wrote her first book "The Book of Amor" at the age of 21. 

About Sean Pozin

www.Instagram.com/GypsyVibesArt

  • Sean Pozin is a rising star in the nude art photography world & has been involved in the arts for over 10 years from oil painting, photography, graphic design, art gallery installations to ceramics on the wheel. Sean only recently picked up a camera 14 months ago & is driven by passion to create beautiful nude art in nature that connects with the soul. As a photographer Sean strives to capture a models emotions, spark the creative spirit & showcase the beauty of mother nature.

"Love, consciousness, and creativity are the highest refinements of the cosmic evolutionary force." ~ Alex Grey

Where Will Funds Go?

  • Travel expenses: since Kalham is based in Dallas, TX, she will have to travel to Florida to create the photographs and she will also need a place to stay. This alone should cost about $600 to pay for flight tickets and a hotel room.
  • Designing, printing, and shipping costs: after the project is finished, all of the books will have to be designed, printed, and shipped to the contributors. High quality printing and shipping are not cheap so it should cost at least $600, if not more, to get all of the books to the contributors in a timely fashion.

Each and every contribution is valuable to us because without your support, none of this would be possible. To reward contributors, each contributor will receive an exclusive reward. 

Why Your Contribution Matters?

  • By contributing to this campaign you will be able to help Sean Pozin & Kalham Amor break the stereotype that people place on Indian culture plus create awareness about Indian mythological art. Kalham Sutra will help more people all over the world realize that there are women of Indian descent such as Kalham Amor who fully understand the meaning of the phrase "my body, my choice" and that clothes, or lack thereof, do not define a woman.

We Love Your Support!

Please help us by sharing the project as much as possible. We are humbled and grateful for your support because this project would not be possible without you!!

  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Snapchat
  • Facebook 
  • IndieGoGo share tools too!

Where Will Funds Go?




Travel
expenses: since Kalham is based in Dallas, TX, she will have to travel to
Florida to create the photographs and she will also need a place to stay. This
alone should cost about $600 to pay for flight tickets and a hotel room.


Designing,
printing, and shipping costs: after the project is finished, all of the books
will have to be designed, printed, and shipped to the contributors. High
quality printing and shipping are not cheap so it should cost at least $600, if
not more, to get all of the books to the contributors in a timely fashion.



Each and every contribution is valuable to us because without your support, none of
this would be possible. To reward contributors, each contributor will receive
an exclusive reward. 
Why Your Contribution Matters?


By contributing to this campaign you will be able
to help Sean Pozin & Kalham Amor break the stereotype that people place on
Indian culture plus create awareness about Indian mythological art. Kalham
Sutra will help more people all over the world realize that there are
women of Indian descent such as Kalham Amor who fully understand the meaning of
the phrase "my body, my choice" and that clothes, or lack thereof, do
not define a woman.


We Love Your Support!

Please help us by
sharing the project as much as possible. We are humbled and grateful for your support because this project would not be possible without you!!


Twitter
Instagram
Snapchat
Facebook 
IndieGoGo share tools too!

story:
Just shift the Cap - the simplest and most intuitive way to get a pen ready for writing: our new mechanism makes it possible.

Easy to use with only one Hand - the magnetic forces inside KOSMOS are perfectly balanced. A strong Neodymium magnet holds the cap safely in the idle and writing position.

Designed by Nature - the minimalistic design of KOSMOS is based on a universal pattern of nature: the Golden Ratio which can be credited for the pen's harmonic esthetic and turns out to be ergonomic too.

Award-Winning - KOSMOS is a 2016 Winner of the Red Dot Design Award, a prestigious and world-renowned honor bestowed to the best of the best in outstanding design.

The best Aluminum for a Lifetime Product - each part of KOSMOS is lathed from a solid block of a highly durable aluminum alloy. Known for its strength, this material is often used in aerospace engineering.

Fun to play!

 


"Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works."
- STEVE JOBS

 

"Make it simple, but significant." - DON DRAPER

The Golden Ratio is a universal pattern that can be observed in so many structures found in nature: from the balanced proportions of tiny butterfly wings up to the hypnotic whorls of giant spiral galaxies. This ratio equals 1.618 and has been used by great painters like Leonardo da Vinci and other creative minds throughout history. The fact that the beauty of natural beings can actually be described by a mathematical principle inspired us during every aspect of the KOSMOS design process. We have put a lot of effort into applying the Golden Ratio to every component of the pen. The result looks now very clean, minimalistic and beautiful.

 

Instant visual and tactile feedback on the state of the pen.


 

WHAT IS YOUR WAY TO USE KOSMOS?


 

YOUR CREATIVITY IS A COSMOS OF IDEAS

 

 
 
We designed KOSMOS with the intention to be a daily companion. Regardless of the occasion or the style you choose, KOSMOS will blend in perfectly, because of its subtle but distinct design. Make your choice from four colors to match your personal style and accessories: Comet Grey, Night Sky, Warp Black and Star Silver. 
 
 

"Good design is as little design as possible." - DIETER RAMS

 

The daily essential for modern gentlemen.

 

"Design can have many types of soul, the key is to have one." - JUSTIN AHRENS

 

 

 

 

 

Not only does the pen look good, it writes even better. We have tried and tested different types of cartridges and have chosen the best one for you, which uses German ink and a Swiss tungsten tip.

You will get one free stilform refill in black by purchasing KOSMOS.

The best pen deserves the best refill.

 

If you need a replacement, you won't have problems finding it. We recommend using a stilform refill, which is available in our e-commerce store with free international shipping. Our pen is compatible with any Parker-style G2 refill, which is a ISO standard refill for a variety of pens. So whenever you need it, there will always be a plenty to choose from.

 

Attachable KOSMOS Clip

You do not want to miss a clip on your pen? We created the KOSMOS Clip which is easily attachable to your KOSMOS Pen. It comes in two colors: matt black and matt silver. A special chrome plating on the inside of the clip's ring prevents scratching the pen when you shift it on. You can choose it as an add-on for only €3.95 within your backer survey.

The KOSMOS Clip is a beautiful and subtle add-on to make your pen attachable.

 

 

 

As a backer, you will be the first to receive KOSMOS. You also benefit from:

  • free international shipping and
  • limited pre-sale Indiegogo prices starting from €49. Retail price will be €70.

Check out the rewards below and make your selection on the right.

The KOSMOS pen makes a great gift :) Choose the 2- or 4-Pack to also get one for your friends or family.

 

 

 

 

 

We have been carrying around the idea of a new ballpoint concept for over 5 years. We presented our first versions to different pen manufacturers in Europe. They were always amazed by our pen's design and its functionality. So we got hired by a famous German pen brand to tweak the last details of the pen and get it ready for market. But in the end, they let us down because they did not dare to take on the risk of trying something really new. We realized we need to bring our vision to life on our own and re-designed the pen just the way we liked it most, without any restrictions. Eventually we made it work even better using magnets. So now, we are ready to start the production of KOSMOS... Together with you on Indiegogo ♥

 

 

stilform is a small design studio based in Munich, which is operated by Christoph Bohrer, Alexander Schmitke and Martin Wagner. It was founded in 2013 and creates products in the area of home and living as well as diverse industrial products. Their young spirit leads to a deep understanding of modern society and its needs for innovative creations. Always with the focus on creating visually appealing products with clear lines and esthetic form language, attributes like emotions, function and innovation are of utmost importance in the design process. Every design process starts with an empty sheet of paper and each time the project ends with a creative solution. Inspiration comes from nature, science and other areas that help to create a simplified everyday life. With this background customers and users will benefit from long-lasting products.

 

 

OUR AWARDS

 

SPREAD THE LOVE

We would be very happy, if you could share our campaign with your friends to spread the word. We created a few attractive extras to our campaign to round off the KOSMOS experience and offer more choice of colors and additional accessories to you.

 

 

 

FAQ

HOW DO I CHOOSE THE COLOR?

Once the campaign has been successfully funded, we will send a survey with the request of your color and address. During the campaign we offer different stretch goals which might unlock new colors. In this way you will be able to choose also from new colors.

WHAT KIND OF INK REFILLS CAN I USE?

For the best experience we recommend you stick to using stilform Ballpoint Refills, which use German ink and a Swiss tungsten tip. However, if you do want to try other brands we suggest that you look for Parker Style G2 Refills. Rollerballs are harder to specify but must have a Length of 98.1mm and a diameter of maximum 5.9mm. 

Pilot G2 style refills (G2/Schmidt/Euro Rollerball (and similar) Refills) will NOT fit into our pen, as they are 110mm long.

CAN I DISASSEMBLE THE PEN?

For changing the refills you surely can unscrew the front bush, but we do not recommend to disassamble the whole pen. The parts are perfectly adjusted and would no longer work as they should.

WHICH MATERIAL ARE YOU USING?

We are using a high quality 6000 Aluminum alloy. This is one of the the most durable Aluminum alloys known for its strength and frequently used in aerospace engineering. This alloy combines a high hardness with a long-lasting quality of the anodized surface. Our aim was to create one of the most scratch resistant pens available.

DO YOU OFFER PERSONALISED ENGRAVING?

Laser engravings are only in our Corporate Identity and Color Corporate Identity packages included.

 

The main risks and challenges are as follows:


We are working with extremely experienced machining and finishing suppliers that are used to handling quantities well over the amount that are typical for Indiegogo which means that there is little risk of a production bottleneck. Though it is unlikely, delays can still happen as machinery can break down, raw materials can arrive late etc. which can create unanticipated setbacks. If this highly unlikely scenario takes place, frequent communication and transparency with our backers is our top priority.

Pens are popular on Indiegogo so our funding goal could be exceeded significantly. Maintaining consistent quality - There are separate quality control procedures at every manufacturing step so defect rates are very low. We have the experience to realize high quality products through our background as a industrial design agency.

Shipping large volumes - If we will get highly overfunded, all products will be packaged and sent by a professional logistics warehouse so we will be able to pack shipments quickly and without mistakes.

story:
My name is Scruffy Unicorn. I'm an Australian Artist who for the past few years has been putting on exhibitions around Australia and over in the States in New York. These shows have been going very well and keep getting bigger and bigger. The best highlight of them  is getting to meet other artists from around the world. For years I have been talking with them about doing shows together and then I came up with the insane idea of doing a world tour where I would exhibit in each country with a different artist from that region. At first this was just a crazy little idea that I had and would laugh about and not take seriously. But the more I started to think about it and the more I mentioned it to other people the more I got excited by the idea. Why not do a world tour? What was stopping me? Nothing.

So starting this Nov in Melbourne Australia, with first guest artist Antony Makhlouf, I will be starting my world tour Brain Candy. 

So why am I here? Well sadly exhibitions need funds. As an artist I live on very little, and I need very little, but my one big expense is art materials. To pay for materials I sell my paintings, but when you are working on an exhibition you have no paintings to sale, so how do I pay for materials? Well that's where I'm hoping you can help me. I'm looking for a little support to help me get this ball rolling and in return I have some pretty cool rewards.

Starting with small things like mini prints and stickers of my work, to t-shirts and all the way to original paintings by myself. I think you will be very happy. 

As the exhibition itself is being worked out all I'm asking is for a little help with covering me for materials, i.e. paints, paper, frames. It's not a lot, but it is a small bump in the road I can't get over without your help. 

Please support this little Unicorns dream of world domination. THANK YOU.

story:
Help bring our 5 story imaginative Totem of Confessions to Burning Man this summer. We were fortunate to receive an Honoraria Grant from Burning Man yet need more funds to fulfill our detailed artistic vision. Dioramas of black and white photography compose worlds to wander through with your imagination.  Inside will be a gold gilded enclave made up of collages of paper, wood, and plaster. 



The photos you see are the first floor, please help us finish the rest and get it out to the playa for you to enjoy! 

With sincere gratitude,

Mike Garlington and the Crew

story: The Arts & Design Society of Fort Walton Beach (ADSO), a non-profit organization, is raising funds to bring its historic building up to code to avoid eviction. Established in 1956 and located in the Old City Hall, ADSO facilitates fine art exhibitions and provides art classes and education to adults and children in Fort Walton Beach, FL and surrounding communities where art education has been severely curtailed in the schools.  With the exception of one paid part-time employee, ADSO is an all-volunteer organization, whose members donate many hours to fulfill its mission. As the only non-profit art venue in our community, ADSO offers much to enrich lives;  please help save this oasis of creativity!  We sincerely appreciate your support.

story:
Support Game-Changing Technology 

Help us raise $100,000 to redefine the way people:

  • Create and send digital greeting cards
  • Raise funds for Nonprofits 
  • Send newsletters that people will actually love to receive, 
  • Market your businesses and products, even make direct sales
  • Extend invitations 
  • Announce events and occasions
Can one digital product do all that? Yes, and then some. Think Posti-cations instead of communications for cutting edge technology that makes any message you want to send compelling and thrilling to receive.

Instantly Bring Your Messages To Life

Posti Cards are completely customizable digital postcards that incorporate all these tools we love into one:

  • Video/audio
  • Images
  • Text
  • Hyperlink 
Best of all, each Posti represents your own unique creativity. You don't need anyone, or anything, else. You can create and share this all-inclusive digital postcard by yourself (some of you may need a nine-year old to walk you through it the first time). Postis will soon replace outdated messaging tools including: 
  • Static social media posts 
  • Costly print postcard campaigns
  • Boring email or snail mail newsletters that end in the trash


The Most Fun Investment You Will Ever Make. 

Invest in the everything digital postcard and get it right now. Instantly share your discovery of Postis with your friends, family and clients. They will love being the first to receive them. No need to wait until the Indiegogo campaign is over to start using the technology that is sure to captivate everyone.

Help Us Test and Improve Postis

With no external funding, we created the Posti platform for users to produce completely customized Posti Cards on their computers. Now we need your help to test this exciting messaging breakthrough and fund the App for mobile users. Go ahead invest in Posti now to create newsletters, greeting cards, invites and business promos. We need 1000 people to create Postis at the same time. We want you to experiment. Give us feedback. And don't freak out if our platform goes down for a few minutes. It happens to everyone. 

Realistically We Need More Than $100,000 To: 

  • Advance Posti technology even further 
  • Reach a worldwide market 
  • Develop an App for mobile phone users and the next generation of Postis with many more features. 

Here's How Postis Will Improve Your World 

Posti digital postcards are the most visual, compelling, and effective way to send messages. Innovative digital communication is the goal of every personal user and business. State of the art technology that everyone can use every day is what Posti delivers in 10 ways.  

  • Customized messaging makes each Posti unique 
  • Unlimited possibilities using Posti for every need
  • 6 powerful communication tools combined to maximize the impact of Posti
  • Easy to use advanced technology
  • Fun and exciting way to receive messages
  • Cost effective pricing you pay only for Posti "Postage" 
  • Unlimited distribution one Posti stamp exposes your message to all social media and to as many people as you desire 
  • Business friendly Posti promotions and branding will improve any business's bottom line
  • Posti is Green completely friendly to the environment of the planet
  • Posti has a social conscience Posti will contribute 15% of its profits  to Reach Out Recovery. ROR is the only nonprofit addiction recovery platform in the world devoted to providing information, awareness, healthy living and support to the hundreds of millions of people impacted by addiction.


People Love Posti -- Help Us Get The Word Out

People who have seen Posti are excited about creating their own. The WOW factor when someone receives a Posti is satisfying to the sender. Finally, there's a beautiful setting for prized photos and videos. You can now send personalized cards that will say and mean so much more than a post or a tweet. Postis can be emailed and sent by text message. 

Help us spread the word that Postis are the communication innovation of the future. And so easy to master. Even the least tech-savvy person on our team got it. Can you guess who had to try it twice.

The Posti Cards Team


Here's How To Help Us Meet Our Funding Goal

  1. Donate a dollar and share your thank-you Posti  perk with others to encourage them to donate a dollar and get involved in the Posti campaign.
  2. Try our Introductory Posti Perk (one Posti stamp) and share your created Posti with everyone you know. They'll love it.
  3. Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  4. Tell your friends on social media about this amazing new digital postcard.

Where Are We in Development?

The Posti Cards platform has been created with unique coding, a trademarked logo, and patent pending. Posti is now ready for a soft launch. New users are invited to participate in crowd funding to add features to the Posti product and to build a Mobile application so anyone, anywhere, can make a Posti Card with ease. Our platform is not open source and cannot be copied.

During the past year we have: 

  • Designed the web-based Posti Card platform with precision coding
  • Created our own animation-ready prototypes 
  • Developed original coding for every component of the platform 

Why Fund us on Indiegogo?

Posti Cards is an idea whose time has come! Creative customizable greeting and postcards with many tools we use every day will: save paper, reduce costs of US postage, and allow you to send personalized messages to any number of people in a cost effective manner. We did the hard part, we built a new form of messaging...You have the easy part. Get your creative juices flowing and have fun. For a small contribution to the Posti Campaign, you get to try Posti Cards and help us build the next generation of digital communication at the same time!

Posti Will Support A Social Cause

Reach Out Recovery (ROR) is a 501c3 nonprofit with the most comprehensive addiction recovery platform on the Internet. The ROR Platform was created for the huge, underserved population of 120 million people of all ages, ethnic backgrounds and socio-economic groups whose lives have been devastated by addiction. 26 million adult children of alcoholics and 6 million children under the age of 18, plus millions of high school and college students, need education, prevention tools and support they are not currently receiving. ROR is breaking the stigma and raising awareness to advance the recovery cause for all people affected, both substance abusers and their families. The ROR Facebook page alone engages some 500,000 people a week most of whom have no other source of support or education about what is happening to them. ROR is not affiliated with any belief system or organization. ROR is completely free and funded by individuals and nonprofit foundations. Your participation in the Posti campaign, and your continued use of Posti Cards will insure ROR's growth and sustainability.
