Unlimited possibilities using Posti for every need


6 powerful communication tools combined to maximize the impact of Posti

Easy to use advanced technology
Fun and exciting way to receive messages

Cost effective pricing you pay only for Posti "Postage" 

Unlimited distribution one Posti stamp exposes your message to all social media and to as many people as you desire 

Business friendly Posti promotions and branding will improve any business's bottom line


Posti is Green completely friendly to the environment of the planet


Posti has a social conscience Posti will contribute 15% of its profits  to Reach Out Recovery. ROR is the only nonprofit addiction
recovery platform in the world devoted to providing information, awareness, healthy
living and support to the hundreds of millions of people impacted by addiction.











People Love Posti -- Help Us Get The Word Out



People who have seen Posti are excited
about creating their own. The WOW factor when someone receives a Posti is satisfying to the sender. Finally, there's a beautiful setting for prized photos and videos. You can now send personalized cards that will say and mean so much more than a post or a tweet. Postis
can be emailed and sent by text message. 
Help us spread the word that Postis are the communication innovation of the future. And so easy to master. Even the least tech-savvy person on our team got it. Can you guess who had to try it twice.
The Posti Cards Team










Here's How To Help Us Meet Our Funding Goal


Donate a dollar and share your thank-you Posti  perk with others to encourage them to donate a dollar and get involved in the Posti campaign.


Try our Introductory Posti Perk (one Posti stamp) and share your created Posti with everyone you know. They'll love it.


Use the Indiegogo share tools.


Tell your friends on social media about this amazing new digital postcard.



Where Are We in Development?
The Posti Cards platform has been created with unique coding, a trademarked logo, and patent pending. Posti is now ready for a soft launch. New users are invited to participate in crowd funding to add features to the Posti product and to build a Mobile application so anyone, anywhere, can make a Posti Card with ease. Our platform is not open source and cannot be copied.During the past year we have: 


Designed the web-based Posti Card platform with precision coding
Created our own animation-ready prototypes 
Developed original coding for every component of the platform 




Why Fund us on Indiegogo?
Posti Cards is an idea whose time has come! Creative customizable greeting and postcards with many tools we use every day will: save paper, reduce costs of US postage, and allow you to send personalized messages to any number of people in a cost effective manner. We did the hard part, we built a new form of messaging...You have the easy part. Get your creative juices flowing and have fun. For a small contribution to the Posti Campaign, you get to try Posti Cards and help us build the next generation of digital communication at the same time!




Posti Will Support A Social Cause
Reach Out Recovery (ROR) is a 501c3 nonprofit with the most comprehensive addiction recovery platform on the Internet. The ROR Platform was created for the huge, underserved population of 120 million people of all ages, ethnic backgrounds and socio-economic groups whose lives have been devastated by addiction. 26 million adult children of alcoholics and 6 million children under the age of 18, plus millions of high school and college students, need education, prevention tools and support they are not currently receiving. ROR is breaking the stigma and raising awareness to advance the recovery cause for all people affected, both substance abusers and their families. The ROR Facebook page alone engages some 500,000 people a week most of whom have no other source of support or education about what is happening to them. ROR is not affiliated with any belief system or organization. ROR is completely free and funded by individuals and nonprofit foundations. Your participation in the Posti campaign, and your continued use of Posti Cards will insure ROR's growth and sustainability.

story:
Hello, my name is Nya and this is the first divination deck I ever created. For years, I have used painting to express my inner shadows in search for release. In 2018 and 2019, I fought my way through surfacing trauma by not only painting, but finding confidence and comfort in showing that creative side of me to the world. I began to create a small following and with the encouragement of friends and family, I started to sell my work. When the pandemic hit and I had time, I started to create this deck. I would work on a piece and then recognize something within the lines that took me back into the archives of past paintings. I quickly realized what an incredible journey it had been and that I already had so much to share. So I created this Oracle from all that I felt and all that I learned in the past few years. The deck itself is my way of acknowledging that I went through some difficult times, but here I am on the other side of it. It's my way of releasing what needs to be left in the past and trying to do some good with it. Traveling through a deep darkness requires many levels of bravery and fearlessness as well as acceptance, rest and sometimes a little defeat. 

I fell... a lot, but I kept getting back up.

Now, I bring spiritual guidance and reflection in hopes to offer others a safe place to land or a gentle hand to help them get back up. 

The Deck

 

There are 58 cards total in each Tattered Wings Oracle Deck. 37 of them feature a message for inspiration, contemplation or a little kick in the rear. In addition to your message, there is a guided meditation prompt and a mantra to repeat throughout the day to keep the energies of the message active. 13 cards are Ritual Cards. These cards suggest an exercise, outing or even (my favorite) a quiet reset indoors with all of your favorite comfort items. I chose 13 ritual cards because there are 13 Full Moons in a calendar year and that is a great day to connect or reconnect to the LIFE all around and within us.  The remaining 8 cards are intuitive cards. These don't have meaning or a message, but instead are there to help you develop using your intuition in card reading. Let the images, the colors and the energy speak to you each time they come up. Maybe you write your own meaning or maybe you allow the message to change each time you see it-its up to you and a great way to really make this deck your own. 

THE CARDS

-330gsm Premium Cardstock

-Tarot size cards for better ease of handling

-Silver Gilded Edges 

-arriving in a grey satin, drawstring bag (More Earth friendly than a cardboard box)

 

*All cards can be viewed on my website, www.theritualmuse.com*

 

The Timeline and Money stuff

In October 2020, I launched The Tattered Wings Oracle on kickstarter and it was funded in less than three hours with my total funding hitting 297%!

Since then I launched a Lenormand deck that was funded at just over 110% and The Fools Tarot deck that was funded this past year at 262%. All of these decks will be available to add to your pledge!

This campaign will end on August 9th. This is my first time campaigning through Indiegogo so I'm not certain how long it takes to receive my funds. Once Received, your decks will be ordered with a three week turnaround time. I expect deliver from my production team by mid September and will immediately ship out to you. 

My campaign goal is low because I have already created the deck and done the work needed to start this small indie business. With the relationship I have created with my production team, I am no longer required to purchase large quantities of decks. This makes this whole process easy for me and you will receive your deck MUCH FASTER than campaigns in the early stages of creation and planning. 

The reason I am launching this deck again is to be able to purchase enough to keep in stock. I am grateful to receive so many orders for this oracle deck, but it's time to start thinking a little bigger and getting them into the local owned shops that we all love so much. This campaign will allow me to have the overstock to offer and sell to my customers without the production wait. 

The Artist

I began painting when I purchased my first home and couldn't quite afford beautiful art for my walls. To this day, if I have an empty wall screaming for color, I'll grab a canvas and just let the colors needed in the space, be my first inspiration. I am partial to using acrylic paints, but recently have begun to mix medias in order to increase the texture and flow on my paintings. Each one is multiple layers that expressed whatever was coming up at the time. I always paint with music in my ear. I feel like the notes and the lyrics are what wake that which is sleeping within. I've recently read that Empaths don't just listen to music in the background, it's an experience that they feel run through them again and again. This is exactly what happens when I'm before a canvas.

The female that continues to show up in my work, is painted in my image-but the strong, fearless and powerful version that I try to convince myself really is me. Sometimes I paint without any direction or thought and then stand back after a few hours and just cry. As if I didn't know what was coming out until it presented itself. I've always said, I don't paint...my paintings paint themselves, I simply hold the brush and love them deeply as they emerge. 

Creating these decks has been such an incredible way to combine my art with my love for writing. The community that has grown around indie deck creators has become a family that I will cherish forever. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project. I wish you all the guidance needed to support your highest and best good...wherever it may come from. Please remind yourself that you are exactly what you need to get through whatever comes your way.

Love, Nya

 

 

Risks and Challenges

The great news about this campaign is that I have already done all of the work in choosing my production team! They are quick and efficient while still offering me consistent quality! The only real challenge at this point is shipping. Im sure we have all experienced the delays that can happen with the pandemic and storms. I will keep you updated with any delays or road blocks. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you are interested/able to contribute in a monetary way, PLEASE share this campaign if you like it-and join the journey on social media. 

Instagram- @the_ritual_muse

Instagram- @the_ritual_muse

story:
I am Pilawuk

Ngaiyi Pilawuk
Ngaiyi wur Ngangiwumerri ngi
Dede ngaiyi Malfiyin.

I’m Pilawuk
My language is Ngangiwumerri
My country is Malfyin, along the Moyle River, in the Northern Territory.

I am an artist. Everyone in my family are artists. My inspiration for my art comes from my Aboriginal culture and country and the deep connection that my family share with it.

I am also a primary school teacher, consultant, workshop facilitator, public speaker and children’s book author. I have written and collaborated on several children’s books. “Pilawuk - When I Was Young” by Janeen Brian is my story about being forcibly taken from my family - Stolen Generation story.

My greatest strength is in teaching and sharing my story and my arts practice with others as a way to help them to find ways to experience “Dadirri.” Dadirri is a concept in my culture, which my big sister Miriam-Rose Baumann has written about, finding “the stream within,” perhaps similar to what you might call inner peace. Imagine if everyone contributed to the healing and wellbeing of others. My process in my workshops and as a teacher is about developing shared stories to create meaning using textile arts, mainly with children. Through this process I help people to achieve that sense of inner peace and to build respectful relationships within themselves and with others.

Please take 5 minutes to watch my film above. You will get a greater sense of who I am, how my country inspires my practice and what my campaign is about.

I have a goal
In mid-January I plan to travel to Mullumbimby to study with Aboubakar Fofana a Malian/French Indigo dye specialist in one of his ten day workshops.

Aboubakar possesses a similar love for textiles and respect for the natural environment - you can learn more about Aboubakar here or in my video. 

Learning new textile techniques helps me to broaden my arts practice and bring new processes into my teaching and workshops. And, collaborating with and learning from other artists who work through similar values related to their cultural heritage and practices (like Aboubakar) helps me to deliver creative workshops that not only share my artistic skills and ideas but which also help me to connect with people in the spirit of reconciliation and healing.

Much of my work is about inspiring children and adults to explore my Aboriginal culture, their own cultural traditions and to think and learn about the cultures of other countries throughout the world.

About the course

The course I hope to attend is a very intensive 10-day-long workshop, held over two consecutive weeks, which will serve as a comprehensive introduction to dyeing with natural dyes, also suitable for people with dyeing experience to extend their repertoire and techniques.

The main focus is Aboubakar Fofana's speciality, the fermented West African indigo dye-vat, made using the whole indigo leaves and fermented over a week to ten days to produce a dye of unmatchable colour and fastness. Whilst we wait for the fermented dye-vat to reach maturity, we will be shown other dyes, including powdered fructose (quick vat) indigo, mineral mud-dye, and a host of other colours from madder, cochieal, weld, oak-gall and catechu.

By the beginning of the second week, we will begin to work on a project. Aboubakar will be on hand at all times to assist and answer questions and to help all of the participants to realise their project. Finally, coming full circle, the fermented indigo vat will be ready to use and we will complete the final stage of the course, tying everything in together and hopefully creating some beautiful and very colourful final projects.

By the end of this workshop, I will have enough knowledge and confidence to begin working with many of the dyes and the techniques used in this workshop.

The workshop size is small with just nine students in this workshop. This will allow Aboubakar to give individual attention to each of us through our project!

My budget to achieve this goal

Course fee - $1800
Flights - $500
Accommodation for 12 days - $1000
Car hire - $500
Petrol - $150
Food - $400
Indiegogo fees - $282
Rewards - $300
Total: AUD $4932 
This is equal to USD $3500 my target goal.

Any funds raised above my target goal will be used to further develop my business and I will keep you updated here on exactly how monies are used to further my work.

To say thank you for your support I am offering hand painted silk products. Please see the rewards for more details. For those of you who get in early I can post them to you in time for Christmas!

Thank you for taking the time to view my campaign.

Mamak,
Pilawuk

story:
UPDATE! Here's a new video explaining why and how we chose our artists for our first issue, and how we define the term "artist"


UPDATE! A video on why we choose to print locally! It affects the price of our publication, so it's worth a watch ;)


-----


We are Adele and Emily, two photographers, and graduates from a 3 year-intensive photo program in Montreal.  Since graduation, we had both been working throughout the Summer of 2013.  On a quest to re-inspire herself, Emily worked nearly full-time in order to fund her European journey.  Adele had been working and interning, in order to gain some experience, while getting her foot in the door.  Upon Emily's return, she found herself incredibly fortunate for her beautiful (photographic) experiences, and yet frustrated by the fact that she felt like she wouldn't be able to continue to immerse herself into travels and culture for another while.  Adele and Emily brainstormed some ideas as they were both tired with the current state of the art and photography world, where work is hardly commissioned beyond credit and typically goes unseen.  The additional factor to all this, was they found they didn't really find a place within the photography industry - through this, Soi Publications was born.

Soi Publications is the medium upon which we will distribute our findings and interviews with creators; a crossover between a book and a magazine.  Our idea was to find creators who are passionate about what their doing, rewarding them for following exactly that and sharing our discoveries with you!


As current photographers, we're familiar with how many personal and financial investments we have to make in our projects before it gets any appreciation, and if any - in the form of exposure.  That's not to say exposure isn't enough, but it doesn't allow for many creators to continue working as independent individuals, often leaving them to other jobs, and most likely, less favorable ones.  Our goal is to create a publication that features artists in order to support them and promote a sustainable way of creating work for themselves, all while also creating a niche for ourselves.  
We will feature five creators by generating interviews and showcasing their work within this quarterly publication.  In return, the supporter will get a beautiful publication filled with rich, inspiring content about the people involved.  In the bigger picture, we want to encourage the innovators to continue to do what they're doing, and at the same time we'd also like to encourage others to take that next step towards their passion.  

For our first issue, we'll be featuring people on an international level, which we will reveal shortly! - but for now have faith that the people we've chosen we'll be perfect candidates for our launch.  We have people ranging from different ages, countries and creative outlets, and we're SO excited to be working with them!  We can't wait to share with you what they have to offer, not only as artists, but as human beings.  

On to some more technical details:

- We're going to be completely ad-free! We want to focus all the attention on the people we feature so that you can have a much richer experience.

- We're looking at high-quality paper; supreme silk 200m, 9x11in format, with approximately 88-96 pages.  This will definitely be a keeper in your collection.

- This beautiful publication will be bound perfectly to give it a sturdy, book feel to it.

As a contributor you're not only making this project possible, you're also directly generating income for the 5 artists we feature. This is the basic formula for each publication; where each artist will get a percentage for each purchase for that issue.  

We also really want people to start working together and getting used to supporting other artists, because we do believe that it is a healthy way to nourish a community. 

As this is the first issue, your contribution will work towards exactly that, printing costs and shipping (which make up for the majority of our costs)!  However, keep in mind that we also have some other costs to come by.  Let's break it down!

- Our online presence: hosting for our website
- Perks for our supporters
- Promotional materials: flyers
- Our image: purchasing fonts
and of course
- PROFIT!

As you can see, profit will account for 30% of the campaign goal, which will then be further divided.  Of that amount, each artist will receive 10% which totals to 50%.  The other half of that will go into offsetting some expenses of the upcoming issue.  By achieving our goal, you'll be giving each artist $1000... How amazing is that?!  Of course, because this is percentage-based, it also has the ability to go below that if we don't reach our goal.  However, if we surpass our campaign goal, we'll be giving more than $1000 to each of them, which would be even more awesome!  See how this works?  Of course we'll include a few enticing perks to keep you motivated - keep scrolling!

Your contributions will not go unnoticed. Whether you share this project, or donate whatever you can, we really are relying on your help. 

PERKS:

Good vibes! For a $1 donation, we're sending you positive vibes for reaching out to us. Even this little bit will help to bring this project further, 


Thank you e-mail! For a $5 donation, we will be sending you an email thanking you personally for your contribution.

Thank you e-card! For a $10 donation, we will be sending you a personal e-card thanking you for being awesome. 


Thank you video! For a $25 donation, we will make a shout-out video to you on YouTube for your generosity (unless specified otherwise). 

1st issue pre-order! For a $35 donation, you will ensure yourself your very own copy of our 1st issue!

Mini gift bag! For a $45 donation, on top of a pre-order of the 1st SOI issue, you'll get a wearable patch to sport our logo on any piece of clothing, backpack, or anything you can pin it to!

Lil' gift bag! For a $55 donation, you will receive a pre-order, a SOI patch, and a personal hand-written thank you (AKA a love note, expressing how grateful we are) on one of our SOI postcards.

Big gift bag! For a $85 donation, on top of all the perks included in Lil' Gift Bag, you get a LIMITED edition poster celebrating our 1st issue!
Here's a preview of what they will resemble:



Big gift tote! For a $150 donation, you will get above perks in Big Gift Bag, along with our SOI tote bag. Sweeeeeet. 

                                    

(The picture above is an estimation of what the bag will look like, based on our supplier.)

Tote bundle! For a $250 donation, you'll be pre-ordering THREE copies of our 1st issue, for yourself and two other loved ones! Plus our patch, handwritten postcard, and poster.

Family sponsor! For a $350 donation, you'll get all things mentioned in the TOTE BUNDLE, plus another 2 pre-orders for more friends and family!

SUPER SPONSOR! For a $500 donation, you'll have secured a total of 10 issues for pre-order.  What does that mean? You'll be sharing this creation and will (hopefully) be touching many other people with this generous gift.  Plus, you get to tack on all of the above-mentioned perks and a Skype call with us!  We want to get to know you, so, to top it off, you'll be featured on our website with an in-depth profile (unless specified otherwise). 

A side-note: shipping costs are already included in the perk!

Again, we cannot say "thank you" enough for investing in our publication and for for believing in what we have to offer. 

As we mentioned earlier, we really want the art community to become stronger, which we believe will happen organically.  Moreover, we also want others to be involved regardless of whether they are artists or not, because we think this mentality of working together will yield positive results for all those involved.  With the success of this campaign, we would like to make it a possibility for creators to generate a sustainable way of income through future projects and through raised funds.  We also hope to inspire our readers to follow their passions; as we will interview people coming from very different backgrounds.

Share, share, share! This is where sharing this page with your friends, family, community, or your social networking buddies will be hugely appreciated. You can get in touch with those you feel would be most interested in getting involved on such a project. Email, Twitter, Facebook, word of mouth are all ways to help out! So, what are you waiting for?!
story_txt:
UPDATE! Here's a new video explaining why and how we chose our artists for our first issue, and how we define the term "artist"UPDATE! A video on why we choose to print locally! It affects the price of our publication, so it's worth a watch ;)-----We are
Adele and Emily, two photographers, and graduates from a 3 year-intensive photo
program in Montreal.  Since graduation, we had both been working
throughout the Summer of 2013.  On a quest to re-inspire herself, Emily
worked nearly full-time in order to fund her European journey.  Adele had
been working and interning, in order to gain some experience, while getting her
foot in the door.  Upon Emily's return, she found herself incredibly
fortunate for her beautiful (photographic) experiences, and yet frustrated by
the fact that she felt like she wouldn't be able to continue to immerse herself
into travels and culture for another while.  Adele and Emily brainstormed
some ideas as they were both tired with the current state of the art and
photography world, where work is hardly commissioned beyond credit and
typically goes unseen.  The additional factor to all this, was they found
they didn't really find a place within the photography industry - through this,
Soi Publications was born.Soi Publications is the medium upon which we will distribute our findings and interviews with creators; a crossover between a book and a magazine.  Our idea was to find creators who are passionate about what their doing, rewarding them for following exactly that and sharing our discoveries with you!As current photographers, we're familiar with how many personal and financial investments we have to make in our projects before it gets any appreciation, and if any - in the form of exposure.  That's not to say exposure isn't enough, but it doesn't allow for many creators to continue working as independent individuals, often leaving them to other jobs, and most likely, less favorable ones.  Our goal is to create a publication that features artists in order to support them and promote a sustainable way of creating work for themselves, all while also creating a niche for ourselves.  We will feature five creators by generating interviews and showcasing their work within this quarterly publication.  In return, the supporter will get a beautiful publication filled with rich, inspiring content about the people involved.  In the bigger picture, we want to encourage the innovators to continue to do what they're doing, and at the same time we'd also like to encourage others to take that next step towards their passion.  For our first issue, we'll be featuring people on an international level, which we will reveal shortly! - but for now have faith that the people we've chosen we'll be perfect candidates for our launch.  We have people ranging from different ages, countries and creative outlets, and we're SO excited to be working with them!  We can't wait to share with you what they have to offer, not only as artists, but as human beings.  On to some more technical details:- We're going to be completely ad-free! We want to focus all the attention on the people we feature so that you can have a much richer experience.- We're looking at high-quality paper; supreme silk 200m, 9x11in format, with approximately 88-96 pages.  This will definitely be a keeper in your collection.- This beautiful publication will be bound perfectly to give it a sturdy, book feel to it.As a contributor you're not only making this project possible, you're also directly generating income for the 5 artists we feature. This is the basic formula for each publication; where each artist will get a percentage for each purchase for that issue.  We also really want people to start working together and getting used to supporting other artists, because we do believe that it is a healthy way to nourish a community. As this is the first issue, your contribution will work towards exactly that, printing costs and shipping (which make up for the majority of our costs)!  However, keep in mind that we also have some other costs to come by.  Let's break it down!- Our online presence: hosting for our website- Perks for our supporters- Promotional materials: flyers- Our image: purchasing fontsand of course- PROFIT!As you can see, profit will account for 30% of the campaign goal, which will then be further divided.  Of that amount, each artist will receive 10% which totals to 50%.  The other half of that will go into offsetting some expenses of the upcoming issue.  By achieving our goal, you'll be giving each artist $1000... How amazing is that?!  Of course, because this is percentage-based, it also has the ability to go below that if we don't reach our goal.  However, if we surpass our campaign goal, we'll be giving more than $1000 to each of them, which would be even more awesome!  See how this works?  Of course we'll include a few enticing perks to keep you motivated - keep scrolling!Your contributions will not go unnoticed. Whether you share this project, or donate whatever you can, we really are relying on your help. PERKS:Good vibes! For a $1 donation, we're sending you positive vibes for reaching out to us. Even this little bit will help to bring this project further, Thank you e-mail! For a $5 donation, we will be sending you an email thanking you personally for your contribution.Thank you e-card! For a $10 donation, we will be sending you a personal e-card thanking you for being awesome. Thank you video! For a $25 donation, we will make a shout-out video to you on YouTube for your generosity (unless specified otherwise). 1st issue pre-order! For a $35 donation, you will ensure yourself your very own copy of our 1st issue!Mini gift bag! For a $45 donation, on top of a pre-order of the 1st SOI issue, you'll get a wearable patch to sport our logo on any piece of clothing, backpack, or anything you can pin it to!Lil' gift bag! For a $55 donation, you will receive a pre-order, a SOI patch, and a personal hand-written thank you (AKA a love note, expressing how grateful we are) on one of our SOI postcards.Big gift bag! For a $85 donation, on top of all the perks included in Lil' Gift Bag, you get a LIMITED edition poster celebrating our 1st issue! Here's a preview of what they will resemble:Big gift tote! For a $150 donation, you will get above perks in Big Gift Bag, along with our SOI tote bag. Sweeeeeet.                                     (The picture above is an estimation of what the bag will look
like, based on our supplier.)Tote
bundle! For a $250 donation, you'll be pre-ordering THREE copies of our 1st
issue, for yourself and two other loved ones! Plus our patch, handwritten
postcard, and poster.Family sponsor! For a $350 donation, you'll get all things
mentioned in the TOTE BUNDLE, plus another 2 pre-orders for more friends and
family!SUPER SPONSOR! For a $500 donation, you'll have secured a
total of 10 issues for pre-order.  What does that mean? You'll be sharing
this creation and will (hopefully) be touching many other people with this
generous gift.  Plus, you get to tack on all of the above-mentioned perks and a Skype call with us!  We want to get to know you, so, to top it off, you'll be featured on our website with an in-depth profile
(unless specified otherwise). A side-note: shipping costs are already included in the perk!Again, we cannot say "thank you" enough for investing in our publication and for for believing in what we have to offer. As we mentioned earlier, we really want the art community to become stronger, which we believe will happen organically.  Moreover, we also want others to be involved regardless of whether they are artists or not, because we think this mentality of working together will yield positive results for all those involved.  With the success of this campaign, we would like to make it a possibility for creators to generate a sustainable way of income through future projects and through raised funds.  We also hope to inspire our readers to follow their passions; as we will interview people coming from very different backgrounds.Share, share, share! This is where sharing this page with your friends, family, community, or your social networking buddies will be hugely appreciated. You can get in touch with those you feel would be most interested in getting involved on such a project. Email, Twitter, Facebook, word of mouth are all ways to help out! So, what are you waiting for?!

story:
Our Story

My name is Suzanne Hobbs and I am the Executive Director of PopAtomic Studios, a non-profit organization dedicated to arts integrated outreach in support of nuclear energy. We are a new organization with big dreams to change the misconceptions of nuclear energy so that one day all people can have access to clean energy.


The Impact

We are very resourceful here, and our very small budget rarely stops us from reaching our goals. However in order to complete our 501c3 application for federal tax exemption we need to raise money to pay for professional review of our application and the submission fee to the IRS. We just can't DIY our way out of this one, so we really need your help!!!


What We Need & What You Get

We need to earn approximately $2200 in order to pay for professional assistance in completing our 501c3, which can cost up to $1250, as well as the $850 filing fee to the IRS. Even if we don't meet our goal, we will put this money towards a slightly lower level of assistance with our application . If we exceed our goal, the funds will go straight into our Educational Outreach Program!! 


Every donation will be rewarded with original artwork created by our fabulous artists!


Donations of $1-$49 receive a signed holiday post card from the PopAtomic Team

Donations of $50-$100 receive a hand screen-printed PopAtomic T-Shirt 

Donations of $101-$500 receive a signed, framed "Uranium: Not Just Another Rock" or "Thorium: The Smart Rock" poster

Donations of $501 and up receive an original Chicago Pile 1 Graphite Sculpture


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our Holiday Fundraiser to friends and colleagues who are looking for the perfect gift for their favorite nuke worker or supporter.
